Sentences_from: Ruszyli się potem z Elimu, i przyszło wszystko mnóstwo synów Izraelskich na puszczą Zyn, która leży między Elim i między Synaj, piętnastego dnia miesiąca wtórego po wyjściu ich z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: They took their journey from Elim, and all the congregation of the children of Israel came to the wilderness of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after their departing out of the land of Egypt.
Translated_sentences: then they departed from elim, and all the multitude of the children of israel came into the wilderness of zin, which is between elim and sinai, on the fifteenth day of the second month after they departed from the land of egypt.

Sentences_from: I wyleję gorliwość moję na cię, i obejdą się z tobą zapalczywie, nos twój i uszy twoje oberżną, a ostatek twój od miecza polegnie; oni synów twoich i córki twoje pojmają, a ostatek twój ogniem pożarty będzie;
Sentences_to: I will set my jealousy against you, and they shall deal with you in fury; they shall take away your nose and your ears; and your residue shall fall by the sword: they shall take your sons and your daughters; and your residue shall be devoured by the fire.
Translated_sentences: i will pour out my zeal on you, and they will deal with you with anger, your nose and your ears are eggplant, and your remnant will fall by the sword. they will take your sons and your daughters, and your remnant will be devoured by fire.

Sentences_from: Zabłyśnij błyskawicą, a rozprosz ich; puść strzały twoje, a poraź ich.
Sentences_to: Throw out lightning, and scatter them. Send out your arrows, and rout them.
Translated_sentences: shine with lightning and scatter them; let go of your arrows and strike them.

Sentences_from: I wspomną na mię, którzy z was zachowani będą między narodami, u krórych będą w pojmaniu, żem ubolewał nad sercem ich wszetecznem, które odstąpiło odemnie, i nad oczyma ich, które nierząd płodziły, chodząc za plugawemi bałwanami swojemi: i omierzną sami sobie dla złości, które czynili we wszystkich obrzydliwościach swoich.
Sentences_to: Those of you that escape shall remember me among the nations where they shall be carried captive, how that I have been broken with their lewd heart, which has departed from me, and with their eyes, which play the prostitute after their idols: and they shall loathe themselves in their own sight for the evils which they have committed in all their abominations.
Translated_sentences: and they will remember me which of you will be preserved among the nations, with whom they will be taken in captivity, that i have lamented their harlot heart which has turned away from me, and their eyes which they have labored for, following their idols, and they will wash themselves for themselves for their own sake. the wickedness that they have done in all their abominations.

Sentences_from: A tak wzięli cielca, którego im dał, a zgotowawszy wzywali imienia Baalowego od poranku aż do południa, mówiąc: O Baalu, wysłuchaj nas! Ale nie było głosu, ani ktoby odpowiedział. I skakali koło ołtarza, który byli uczynili.
Sentences_to: They took the bull which was given them, and they dressed it, and called on the name of Baal from morning even until noon, saying, Baal, hear us. But there was no voice, nor any who answered. They leaped about the altar which was made.
Translated_sentences: and they took the calf which he had given them, and ready they called on the name of baal from the morning until noon, saying, o baal, hear us. but there was no voice and no one to answer. and they jumped around the altar that they had made.

Sentences_from: Kto wie, jeźli się nie obróci Bóg, a nie użali się tego, nie odwrócili się, mówię, od popędliwości gniewu swego, abyśmy nie zginęli.
Sentences_to: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: who knows, if god does not turn, and pity it, i say, turn away from the fury of their anger, lest we perish.

Sentences_from: A ten miał trzydzieści synów, którzy jeździli na trzydziestu ośląt, a mieli trzydzieści miast, które zwano Awot Jair aż po dzisiejszy dzień w ziemi Galaadskiej.
Sentences_to: He had thirty sons who rode on thirty donkey colts, and they had thirty cities, which are called Havvoth Jair to this day, which are in the land of Gilead.
Translated_sentences: and this one had thirty sons, who rode thirty donkeys, and had thirty cities, which are called avot jair to this day in the land of galaad.

Sentences_from: W oneż dni widziałem w Judzie tłoczących prasy w sabat, i noszących snopy, które kładli na osły, także i winne grona, i figi, i wszelki ciężar, a przynoszących do Jeruzalemu w dzień sabatu, i zgromiłem ich onegoż dnia, którego sprzedawali żywność.
Sentences_to: In those days saw I in Judah some men treading winepresses on the Sabbath, and bringing in sheaves, and loading donkeys; as also wine, grapes, and figs, and all kinds of burdens, which they brought into Jerusalem on the Sabbath day: and I testified against them in the day in which they sold food.
Translated_sentences: in those days i saw in judah pressing presses on the sabbath day, and bearing sheaves, which they laid on donkeys, and grapes, and figs, and every burden, and bringing them to jerusalem on the sabbath day, and rebuked them on the day that they were selling food.

Sentences_from: Ja zaiste jestem Pan, Bóg twój, który rozdzielam morze, tak, że szumią wały jego; Pan zastępów jest imię moje.
Sentences_to: For I am Yahweh your God, who stirs up the sea, so that its waves roar: Yahweh of Armies is his name.
Translated_sentences: i am the lord your god, who divide the sea so that its waves roar; the lord of hosts is my name.

Sentences_from: Wyrwij mię od tych, którzy broją nieprawość, a od mężów krwawych wybaw mię.
Sentences_to: For, behold, they lie in wait for my soul. The mighty gather themselves together against me, not for my disobedience, nor for my sin, Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: deliver me from those who do iniquity, and save me from men of blood.

Sentences_from: A synowie Izraelscy rozrodzili się, i rozpłodzili się, i rozmnożyli się, i zmocnili się bardzo wielce, a napełniona jest ziemia nimi.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel were fruitful, and increased abundantly, and multiplied, and grew exceedingly mighty; and the land was filled with them.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of israel became fruitful and became fertile and multiplied and grew very strong, and the earth was filled with them.

Sentences_from: Tedy rozkazał Pan Bóg człowiekowi, mówiąc: Z każdego drzewa sadu jeść będziesz.
Sentences_to: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "Of every tree of the garden you may freely eat;
Translated_sentences: and yahweh god commanded the man, saying, from every tree of the orchard you shall eat.

Sentences_from: A gdyby się prorok dał zwieść, aby mówił słowo, Ja Pan zwiodłem proroka onego, i wyciągnę nań rękę swoję, i wygładzę go z pośrodku ludu mego Izraelskiego.
Sentences_to: If the prophet is deceived and speak a word, I, Yahweh, have deceived that prophet, and I will stretch out my hand on him, and will destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
Translated_sentences: and if the prophet were deceived to speak the word, i, the lord, deceived the prophet, and i will stretch out my hand against him, and i will cut him off from among my people israel.

Sentences_from: Zna wół gospodarza swego, i osieł żłób pana swego; ale Izrael mię nie zna, lud mój nie zrozumiewa.
Sentences_to: The ox knows his owner, and the donkey his master's crib; but Israel doesn't know, my people don't consider."
Translated_sentences: he knows the ox of his host, and the ass of the manger of his master; but israel does not know me, my people do not understand.

Sentences_from: Rozdzielił tedy one trzy sta mężów na trzy hufce, a dał trąby w ręce każdemu z nich, i dzbany czcze, i pochodnie w pośrodek dzbanów
Sentences_to: He divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put into the hands of all of them trumpets, and empty pitchers, with torches within the pitchers.
Translated_sentences: so he divided the three hundred men into three bands, and gave each of them trumpets, and empty jugs and torches in the middle of the jugs.

Sentences_from: Tać będzie powinność domów synów Gersonowych w namiocie zgromadzenia, a będzie ich doglądał Itamar, syn Aarona kapłana.
Sentences_to: This is the service of the families of the sons of the Gershonites in the Tent of Meeting: and their duty shall be under the hand of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.
Translated_sentences: this will be the duty of the houses of the children of gerson in the tabernacle of the congregation, and ithamar son of aaron the priest will look after them.

Sentences_from: Teraz stworzone są, a nie onego czasu, o którycheś przed tym dniem nic nie słyszał, byś snać nie rzekł: Otom wiedział o tem.
Sentences_to: They are created now, and not from of old; and before this day you didn't hear them; lest you should say, 'Behold, I knew them.'
Translated_sentences: they are now created, and not at a time which you heard nothing about before that day, lest you say, behold, i knew it.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wziął Johanan, syn Kareaszowy, i wszyscy książęta wojsk, którzy z nim byli, wszystek ostatek ludu, który zaś przywiódł od Izmaela, syna Natanijaszowego, z Masfy, gdy zabił Godolijasza, syna Ahikamowego, mężów walecznych, i niewiasty, i dziatki, i komorników, których zaś przywiódł z Gabaonu.
Sentences_to: Then took Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, all the remnant of the people whom he had recovered from Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, from Mizpah, after that he had killed Gedaliah the son of Ahikam, the men of war, and the women, and the children, and the eunuchs, whom he had brought back from Gibeon:
Translated_sentences: and johanan the son of kareah, and all the princes of the armies with him, took all the remnant of the people that he had brought from ishmael the son of nathanias from mizpah, when he killed gedaliah the son of ahikam, men of war, and women, and children, and the bailiffs whom he brought from gibeon.

Sentences_from: Króle też Madyjańskie pobili między inszymi pobitymi ich, Ewiego, i Rechema, i Sura, i Hura, i Rebaha, pięciu królów Madyjańskich, i Balaama, syna Beorowego, zabili mieczem.
Sentences_to: But if her husband forbids her in the day that he hears it, then he shall make void her vow which is on her, and the rash utterance of her lips, with which she has bound her soul: and Yahweh will forgive her.
Translated_sentences: the kings of madyian also slaughtered them, ewi and rechema, and sura, and hur, and rebah, the five kings of madyian, and balaam, son of beor, with the sword.

Sentences_from: Albowiem czyhali na twoje złe; zmyślali radę, której dowieść nie mogli.
Sentences_to: For you will make them turn their back, when you aim drawn bows at their face.
Translated_sentences: for they have been after your evil; they made up advice which they could not prove.

Sentences_from: A teć są imiona synów Giersonowych, Lobni i Semei.
Sentences_to: The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.
Translated_sentences: and these are the names of the sons of gerson, lobni, and semea.

Sentences_from: I rzekła ona druga niewiasta: Nie tak; ale syn mój jest ten żywy, a syn twój ten umarły. Ale ona rzekła: Nie; ale syn twój jest ten umarły, a syn mój ten żywy. I tak się spierały przed królem.
Sentences_to: The other woman said, "No; but the living is my son, and the dead is your son." This said, "No; but the dead is your son, and the living is my son." Thus they spoke before the king.
Translated_sentences: and the other woman said, not so; but my son is the living one, and your son is the dead. but she said, no; but your son is the dead, and my son is the living. and so they argued before the king.

Sentences_from: Który to lud podał niezbożnym grób jego, a bogatemu śmierć jego, choć jednak nieprawości nie uczynił, ani zdrada znaleziona jest w ustach jego.
Sentences_to: They made his grave with the wicked, and with a rich man in his death; although he had done no violence, neither was any deceit in his mouth.
Translated_sentences: which people hath given his tomb to the wicked, and to the rich man his death, though he has not done iniquity, neither is deceit found in his mouth.

Sentences_from: Ziemia wasza spustoszona, miasta wasze popalone ogniem. Ziemię waszę cudzoziemcy przed wami pożerają i pustoszą, jako zwykli cudzoziemcy.
Sentences_to: Your country is desolate. Your cities are burned with fire. Strangers devour your land in your presence, and it is desolate, as overthrown by strangers.
Translated_sentences: your land is desolate, your cities are burnt with fire. foreigners devour and ravage your land before you, as ordinary foreigners.

Sentences_from: Przetoż i dobytek nasz pójdzie z nami, a nie zostanie i kopyto; albowiem z tego weźmiemy do służby Panu, Bogu naszemu; bo my nie wiemy, czem służyć mamy Panu, aż tam przyjdziemy.
Sentences_to: Our livestock also shall go with us. Not a hoof shall be left behind, for of it we must take to serve Yahweh our God; and we don't know with what we must serve Yahweh, until we come there."
Translated_sentences: therefore our goods will go with us, and the hoof will not remain; for from this we will take for the service of the lord our god; for we don't know what to serve the lord until we come there.

Sentences_from: Wyleje jako deszcz na niepobożnych sidła, ogieó i siarkę, a wicher będzie cząstką kielicha ich.
Sentences_to: On the wicked he will rain blazing coals; fire, sulfur, and scorching wind shall be the portion of their cup.
Translated_sentences: he will pour out as rain on the snares of the wicked, fire and brimstone, and the whirlwind will be a part of their cup.

Sentences_from: Kain, Gabaa, i Tamna, miast dziesięć, i wsi ich.
Sentences_to: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah; ten cities with their villages.
Translated_sentences: cain, gabaa, and timna, ten cities with their villages.

Sentences_from: Albowiem Ja znam sprawy ich, i myśli ich; i przyjdzie ten czas, że zgromadzę wszystkie narody, i języki, i przyjdą a oglądają chwałę moję.
Sentences_to: "For I know their works and their thoughts: the time comes, that I will gather all nations and languages; and they shall come, and shall see my glory.
Translated_sentences: for i know their works and their thoughts; and the time will come when i will gather together all nations and tongues, and they will come and see my glory.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy Józef obydwu, postawił Efraima po prawej ręce swojej, a po lewej Izraelowej; a Manasesa po lewej ręce swojej a po prawej Izraelowej, i przywiódł je do niego.
Sentences_to: Joseph took them both, Ephraim in his right hand toward Israel's left hand, and Manasseh in his left hand toward Israel's right hand, and brought them near to him.
Translated_sentences: and joseph took them both, and set ephraim in his right hand, and in israel's left hand; and manasseh on his left hand, and on israel's right hand, and brought them to him.

Sentences_from: A tak bieżał jezdny przeciwko niemu, i rzekł: Tak mówi król: A pokój? I odpowiedział Jehu: Co tobie do pokoju? Obróć się, jedź za mną. Przetoż oznajmił stróż mówiąc: Dojechałci poseł do nich, ale się nie wraca.
Sentences_to: So there went one on horseback to meet him, and said, "Thus says the king, 'Is it peace?'" Jehu said, "What do you have to do with peace? Fall in behind me!" The watchman said, "The messenger came to them, but he isn't coming back."
Translated_sentences: and a horseman ran against him, and said, thus saith the king: and peace? and jehu said, what is the matter with you? turn around, follow me. therefore the watchman said, “the messenger has come to them, but he will not return.

Sentences_from: A tak i Ja odkryję podołek twój aż na twarz twoję, aby się okazała sromota twoja.
Sentences_to: Therefore will I also uncover your skirts on your face, and your shame shall appear.
Translated_sentences: and so i will uncover your skirt even in your face, that your disgrace may be revealed.

Sentences_from: A oto, słudzy Dawidowi i Joab wracali się z wojny, korzyści wielkie z sobą prowadząc, ale Abnera już nie było u Dawida w Hebronie: bo go był odprawił, i odszedł był w pokoju.
Sentences_to: Behold, the servants of David and Joab came from a foray, and brought in a great spoil with them: but Abner was not with David in Hebron; for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.
Translated_sentences: and behold, the servants of david and joab were returning from the war, leading great profits with them, but abner was no longer with david in hebron: for he had sent him away, and he was gone in peace.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Saul do Achijasa: Przystaw skrzynię Bożą; (bo była skrzynia Boża dnia onego z syny Izraelskimi.)
Sentences_to: Saul said to Ahijah, "Bring the ark of God here." For the ark of God was with the children of Israel at that time.
Translated_sentences: and saul said to ahijah, set up the ark of god; (for there was a chest of god that day with the children of israel.)

Sentences_from: A synom Izraelskim tak powiesz, mówiąc: Olejek pomazywania świętego mnie będzie świętym w narodziech waszych;
Sentences_to: You shall speak to the children of Israel, saying, 'This shall be a holy anointing oil to me throughout your generations.
Translated_sentences: and to the children of israel you shall say this, saying, the holy anointing oil shall be holy unto me in your generations;

Sentences_from: Gdy siądziesz, abyś jadł z panem, uważaj pilnie, kto jest przed tobą;
Sentences_to: When you sit to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before you;
Translated_sentences: when you sit down to eat with your lord, be careful who is in front of you;

Sentences_from: A gdy się wrócili do niego, (a on mieszkał w Jerycho,)rzekł do nich: Azażem wam nie mówił: Nie chodźcie?
Sentences_to: They came back to him, while he stayed at Jericho; and he said to them, "Didn't I tell you, 'Don't go?'"
Translated_sentences: and when they returned to him (and he lived in jericho) he said to them, haven't i said to you, come not?

Sentences_from: Tedy Jonasz począł chodzić po mieście, ile mógł za jeden dzień ujść, i wołał mówiąc: Po czterdziestu dniach Niniwe będzie wywrócone.
Sentences_to: I said, 'I have been banished from your sight; yet I will look again toward your holy temple.'
Translated_sentences: and jonah began to walk in the city as far as he could get away in one day, and cried out, saying, after forty days nineveh will be overthrown.

Sentences_from: I pobił ich król Babiloński, a pomordował ich w Ryblacie w ziemi Emat. A tak przeniesiony jest Juda z ziemi swojej.
Sentences_to: The king of Babylon struck them, and put them to death at Riblah in the land of Hamath. So Judah was carried away captive out of his land.
Translated_sentences: the king of babylon struck them, and slaughtered them at ribel in the land of emath. so judah was taken out of his land.

Sentences_from: Znowu zaczął przypowieść swoję, i rzekł: Ach! któż będzie żyw, gdy to uczyni Bóg?
Sentences_to: He took up his parable, and said, "Alas, who shall live when God does this?
Translated_sentences: he began his parable again, and said, alas! who will be alive when god does this?

Sentences_from: A tak odprowadzili zasię Sadok i Abijatar skrzynię Bożą do Jeruzalemu, i zostali tam.
Sentences_to: Zadok therefore and Abiathar carried the ark of God again to Jerusalem; and they stayed there.
Translated_sentences: and they brought zadok and abiathar again the ark of god to jerusalem, and they remained there.

Sentences_from: Oczyść mię, isopem, a oczyszczon będę; omyj mię, a nad śnieg wybielony będę.
Sentences_to: Hide your face from my sins, and blot out all of my iniquities.
Translated_sentences: cleanse me with isop, and i will be cleansed; wash me, and i will be made white than snow.

Sentences_from: Cóż się przechwalasz dolinami? Spłynęła dolina twoja, o córko uporna! która ufasz w skarbach twoich, mówiąc: Któż przyciągnie przeciwko mnie?
Sentences_to: Why do you glory in the valleys, your flowing valley, backsliding daughter? who trusted in her treasures, saying, Who shall come to me?
Translated_sentences: what do you brag about the valleys? your valley has run down, o stubborn daughter! who trust in your treasures, saying, who will come against me?

Sentences_from: Potłukł gradem szczepy ich, a drzewa leśnych fig ich gradem lodowym.
Sentences_to: He destroyed their vines with hail, their sycamore fig trees with frost.
Translated_sentences: he destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycamore fig trees with ice hail.

Sentences_from: A rzecze do nich: Słuchaj Izraelu, wy dziś staczacie bitwę z nieprzyjacioły waszymi; niechajże nie słabieje serce wasze, nie bójcie się i nie trwożcie sobą, ani się ich lękajcie;
Sentences_to: You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.
Translated_sentences: and he said to them, hear, israel, today you are in battle with your enemies; do not let your heart grow weak, do not be afraid, and do not be afraid of yourselves, nor be afraid of them;

Sentences_from: Będzie błogosławił tym, którzy się boją Pana, małym i wielkim.
Sentences_to: He will bless those who fear Yahweh, both small and great.
Translated_sentences: he will bless those who fear the lord, small and great.

Sentences_from: A tak zabijcie baranka wielkanocnego, a poświęćcie się, i przygotujcie braci waszych, sprawując się według słowa Pańskiego, podanego przez Mojżesza.
Sentences_to: He did this in the cities of Manasseh and Ephraim and Simeon, even to Naphtali, around in their ruins.
Translated_sentences: so kill the passover lamb, and sanctify yourselves, and prepare your brethren, doing according to the word of the lord, which moses spoke about.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy był czas sprawowania ofiary śniednej, przystąpił Elijasz prorok, i rzekł: Panie, Boże Abrahama, Izaaka, i Izraela! dziś niech poznają, żeś ty jest Bogiem w Izraelu, a jam sługa twój, a żem według słowa twego uczynił to wszystko.
Sentences_to: It happened at the time of the offering of the offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, "Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.
Translated_sentences: and it came to pass, while it was time to offer the food offering, elijah the prophet came and said, lord god of abraham, isaac, and israel. let them know today that you are god in israel, and i am your servant, and that i have made all these things according to your word.

Sentences_from: Kapłanów jego przyoblokę zbawieniem, a święci jego weseląc się, radować się będą.
Sentences_to: Her priests I will also clothe with salvation. Her saints will shout aloud for joy.
Translated_sentences: i will clothe his priests with salvation, and his saints will rejoice and be glad.

Sentences_from: Także wszyscy starsi miasta onego, które jest najbliższe zabitego, umyją ręce swoje nad jałowicą ściętą w dolinie;
Sentences_to: What man is there who has planted a vineyard, and has not used its fruit? Let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man use its fruit.
Translated_sentences: and all the elders of the city nearest to the slain shall wash their hands over the juniper cut down in the valley;

Sentences_from: I dał mu znak dnia onegoż, mówiąc: Tenci jest znak, że to mówił Pan: Oto się ołtarz rozpadnie, a wysypie się popiół, który jest na nim.
Sentences_to: He gave a sign the same day, saying, "This is the sign which Yahweh has spoken: Behold, the altar will be split apart, and the ashes that are on it will be poured out."
Translated_sentences: and he gave him the sign of that day, saying, this is the sign that the lord has spoken: behold, the altar shall be broken up, and the ashes on it shall be poured out.

Sentences_from: Z ręki grobu wybawię ich, od śmierci wykupię ich. O śmierci! będę śmiercią twoją; o grobie! będę skażeniem twojem; żałość skryta będzie od oczów moich.
Sentences_to: Ephraim has bitterly provoked anger. Therefore his blood will be left on him, and his Lord will repay his contempt.
Translated_sentences: i will save them from the hand of the grave; i will redeem them from death. about death! i will be your death; about the grave! i will be your contamination; mourning will be hidden from my eyes.

Sentences_from: Na szyi swej prześladowanie cierpiemy, pracujemy, a nie dadzą nam odpocząć.
Sentences_to: Our pursuers are on our necks: We are weary, and have no rest.
Translated_sentences: we suffer persecution around our neck, we work, and they will not let us rest.

Sentences_from: Także i Lewitowie, którzy się oddalali odemnie, gdy błądził Izrael, którzy się obłądzili odemnie za plugawemi bałwanami swemi, ci poniosą nieprawość swoję.
Sentences_to: But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.
Translated_sentences: and the levites, who have strayed from me when israel errs, and who have gone astray from me for their idols, will bear their iniquity.

Sentences_from: Mówi w sercu swem: Nie będę wzruszony od narodu do narodu; bo się nie boję złego.
Sentences_to: He says in his heart, "I shall not be shaken. For generations I shall have no trouble."
Translated_sentences: he says in his heart: i will not be moved from nation to nation; because i'm not afraid of evil.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy powstał Filistyóczyk, i szedł, a przybliżał się przeciwko Dawidowi, że pospieszył i Dawid, a bieżał na spotkanie przeciwko Filistynowi:
Sentences_to: It happened, when the Philistine arose, and came and drew near to meet David, that David hurried, and ran toward the army to meet the Philistine.
Translated_sentences: and it came to pass, when the philistine rose up, and went and came near against david, that david also hastened, and ran to meet against the philistine:

Sentences_from: I mówił z nimi król; ale nie był znaleziony między onymi wszystkimi, jako Danijel, Ananijasz, Misael i Azaryjasz; i stawali przed obliczem królewskiem.
Sentences_to: The king talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.
Translated_sentences: and the king spoke with them; but he was not found among them all, as daniel, ananias, misael, and azariah; and they appeared before the king.

Sentences_from: Weźmiecie też snopek hysopu, i omoczycie we krwi, która będzie w miednicy, a pokropicie odrzwi, i oba podwoje oną krwią, która będzie w miednicy; a z was nie wynijdzie żaden ze drzwi domu swego aż do poranku.
Sentences_to: You shall take a bunch of hyssop, and dip it in the blood that is in the basin, and strike the lintel and the two doorposts with the blood that is in the basin; and none of you shall go out of the door of his house until the morning.
Translated_sentences: and take a bundle of hysop, and drench it in the blood that is in the pelvis, and sprinkle the doorpost, and doubled them with the blood that is in the pelvis; and no one of the doors of his house will come out of you until the morning.

Sentences_from: Ołtarz do całopalenia, i kratę jego miedzianą, drążki jego, i wszystkie naczynia jego, wannę z stolcem jej.
Sentences_to: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of brass, it poles, and all its vessels, the basin and its base;
Translated_sentences: the altar of burnt offering with its copper grate, its poles and all its utensils, the basin with its stool.

Sentences_from: Do ziemi, w której bez niedostatku jeść będziesz chleb, a na żadnej rzeczy schodzić ci nie będzie; do ziemi, której kamienie są żelazo, a z jej gór miedź kopać będziesz.
Sentences_to: a land in which you shall eat bread without scarceness, you shall not lack anything in it; a land whose stones are iron, and out of whose hills you may dig copper.
Translated_sentences: to a land where you will eat bread without want, and where nothing will come to you; to a land the stones of which are iron, and from its mountains you shall dig copper.

Sentences_from: Edomczyków, i Moabczyków, i synów Ammonowych;
Sentences_to: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon;
Translated_sentences: edom, and moab, and the children of ammon;

Sentences_from: Oprócz tego, co przychodziło od kupców i z handlu tych, którzy rzeczami wonnemi kupczyli, i od wszystkich królów Arabskich, i książąt ziemi.
Sentences_to: besides that which the traders brought, and the traffic of the merchants, and of all the kings of the mixed people, and of the governors of the country.
Translated_sentences: except for what came from the merchants and the merchants who bought fragrances, and from all the kings of arabia and the princes of the earth.

Sentences_from: I czynił dobrze Bóg onym babom; i krzewił się lud, i zmocnili się bardzo.
Sentences_to: God dealt well with the midwives, and the people multiplied, and grew very mighty.
Translated_sentences: and god did good to the women; and the people multiplied, and they became very strong.

Sentences_from: A tak odstąpili wszyscy mężowie Izraelscy od Dawida za Sebą, synem Bichry; ale mężowie Judzcy trzymali się króla swego, od Jordanu aż do Jeruzalemu.
Sentences_to: So all the men of Israel went up from following David, and followed Sheba the son of Bichri; but the men of Judah joined with their king, from the Jordan even to Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: so all the men of israel departed from david after sheba the son of bichra; but the men of judah clung to their king from jordan to jerusalem.

Sentences_from: A tak było po cztery koła pod onem listwowaniem, a osi kół wychodziły z podstawka, a każde koło było wzwyż na półtora łokcia.
Sentences_to: The four wheels were underneath the panels; and the axles of the wheels were in the base: and the height of a wheel was a cubit and half a cubit.
Translated_sentences: so there were four wheels under the molding, and the axles of the wheels protruded from the stand, and each wheel was a cubit and a half high.

Sentences_from: A ci, którzy weszli do domu Michasowego, wzięli obraz ryty, Efod i Terafim, i obraz lany; i rzekł do nich kapłan: Cóż to czynicie?
Sentences_to: When these went into Micah's house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, "What are you doing?"
Translated_sentences: and those who entered the house of micah took the engraved image, ephod and teraphim, and the mastic image; and the priest said to them, what are you doing?

Sentences_from: Bo go złożył król Egipski w Jeruzalemie, i nałożył winę na onę ziemię sto talentów srebra, i talent złota.
Sentences_to: The king of Egypt deposed him at Jerusalem, and fined the land one hundred talents of silver and a talent of gold.
Translated_sentences: for the king of egypt laid it down in jerusalem, and charged the land with a hundred talents of silver, and a talent of gold.

Sentences_from: Wysławiajcież Pana, albowiem jest dobry: albowiem na wieki miłosierdzie jego.
Sentences_to: Oh give thanks to Yahweh, for he is good, for his loving kindness endures forever.
Translated_sentences: give thanks to the lord, for he is good: for his mercy endures forever.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do nich: Pójdźcie za mną: albowiem podał Pan nieprzyjacioły wasze Moabity w ręce wasze. Tedy szli za nim, a odjąwszy bród Jordański Moabitom, nie dopuszczali nikomu przeprawy.
Sentences_to: He said to them, "Follow me; for Yahweh has delivered your enemies the Moabites into your hand." They followed him, and took the fords of the Jordan against the Moabites, and didn't allow any man to pass over.
Translated_sentences: and he saith unto them, follow me: for the lord hath delivered your enemies moabite into your hand. and they followed him, and taking the ford of jordan from the moabites, they would let no man pass.

Sentences_from: A Isfan, i Eber, i Eliel,
Sentences_to: and Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,
Translated_sentences: and ishan, and eber, and eliel,

Sentences_from: A w czwartym rzędzie: chryzolit, onychin i berył; te będą wsadzone w złoto w rzędziech swoich.
Sentences_to: and the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.
Translated_sentences: and in the fourth row: chrysolite, onychin and beril; these will be set with gold in their ranks.

Sentences_from: Mów do synów Izraelskich, i rzecz im: Gdy przejdziecie przez Jordan do ziemi Chananejskiej.
Sentences_to: "'You shall mark out your east border from Hazar Enan to Shepham;
Translated_sentences: speak to the children of israel, and say to them, when you pass over the jordan into the land of canaan.

Sentences_from: I zawiódł go na pole Sofim, na wierzch góry Fazga, i zbudował siedem ołtarzów, i ofiarował cielca i barana na każdym ołtarzu.
Sentences_to: He took him into the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, and built seven altars, and offered up a bull and a ram on every altar.
Translated_sentences: and he led him to the field of sofim, to the brow of mount phazga, and built seven altars, and offered a bull and a ram on every altar.

Sentences_from: A do Dana rzekł: Dan jako szczenię lwie wyskakujące z Basan.
Sentences_to: Of Dan he said, "Dan is a lion's cub that leaps out of Bashan."
Translated_sentences: and to dan he said, dan like a lion cub leaping out of bashan.

Sentences_from: Znowu rzekł do mnie: Jeszcze obróciwszy się ujrzysz obrzydliwości większe, które oni czynią.
Sentences_to: He said also to me, You shall again see yet other great abominations which they do.
Translated_sentences: again he said to me, turning yet again, you will see greater abominations that they do.

Sentences_from: A gdy wstępował płomieó z ołtarza ku niebu, tedy wstąpił Anioł Pański w płomieniu ołtarzowym, a Manue, i żona jego widząc to, upadli na twarze swe na ziemię.
Sentences_to: For it happened, when the flame went up toward the sky from off the altar, that the angel of Yahweh ascended in the flame of the altar: and Manoah and his wife looked on; and they fell on their faces to the ground.
Translated_sentences: and as the flame went up from the altar to heaven, then the angel of the lord went up in the altar flame, and when manoah and his wife saw it, they fell on their faces to the ground.

Sentences_from: I rzekł do chłopca swego: Bież, szukaj prędko strzał, które ja wystrzelę. Tedy chłopiec bieżał; a on wystrzelił strzały dalej przedeó.
Sentences_to: He said to his boy, "Run, find now the arrows which I shoot." As the boy ran, he shot an arrow beyond him.
Translated_sentences: and he said to his boy, go, search quickly for the arrows which i will shoot. then the boy ran; and he fired arrows farther ahead.

Sentences_from: Daj mi żony moje, i dzieci moje, za którem ci służył, że odejdę; bo ty wiesz posługi moje, jakom ci służył.
Sentences_to: Give me my wives and my children for whom I have served you, and let me go; for you know my service with which I have served you."
Translated_sentences: give me my wives and my children for whom i have served you, and i will go away; for you know my ministries, how i have served you.

Sentences_from: Tedy poseł, który chodził, aby przyzwał Micheasza, rzekł do niego, mówiąc: Oto teraz słowa proroków jednemi usty dobrze tuszą królowi; niechże będzie proszę słowo twoje, jako słowo jednego z nich, a mów dobre rzeczy.
Sentences_to: The messenger who went to call Micaiah spoke to him, saying, "See now, the prophets declare good to the king with one mouth. Please let your word be like the word of one of them, and speak good."
Translated_sentences: and the messenger who went to summon micaiah spoke to him, saying, behold, now the words of the prophets are well over the king's mouth with one mouth; let your word be the word of one of them, and say good things.

Sentences_from: Synów Pashurowych tysiąc dwieście czterdzieści i siedm;
Sentences_to: The children of Pashhur, one thousand two hundred forty-seven.
Translated_sentences: the sons of pashura, one thousand two hundred forty and seven;

Sentences_from: Do tego wygotowali kamienie onychiny, oprawione złotem osadzeniem, rzezane, jako ryte bywają pieczęci, z imiony synów Izraelskich.
Sentences_to: They worked the onyx stones, enclosed in settings of gold, engraved with the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the children of Israel.
Translated_sentences: moreover, they boiled onychine stones, set with gold on them, carved, as seals are engraved, with the names of the sons of israel.

Sentences_from: A synowie Chamowi: Chus, i Micraim, i Put, i Chanaan.
Sentences_to: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of ham: chus, and egypt, and put, and chanaan.

Sentences_from: Dnia onego pomdleją panienki piękne, nawet i młodzieńcy od onego pragnienia;
Sentences_to: In that day the beautiful virgins and the young men will faint for thirst.
Translated_sentences: on that day, the beautiful ladies, even the young men, will faint because of his thirst;

Sentences_from: Albo jeźliby mając kamień w ręku, którym by mógł zabić, uderzył go, tak żeby umarł, mężobójcą jest; śmiercią umrze on mężobójca.
Sentences_to: "These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance: Eleazar the priest, and Joshua the son of Nun.
Translated_sentences: or if, having a stone in his hand to kill, he strikes him to die, he is a murderer; a murderer will die.

Sentences_from: Będzieszli mądrym, sobie będziesz mądrym; a jeźli naśmiewcą, ty sam szkodę odniesiesz.
Sentences_to: If you are wise, you are wise for yourself. If you mock, you alone will bear it.
Translated_sentences: you will be wise, you will be wise yourself; and if he is a scoffer, you yourself will suffer.

Sentences_from: I Elisama, i Beelijada, i Elifelet.)
Sentences_to: and Elishama, and Beeliada, and Eliphelet.
Translated_sentences: and elisama, and beelijada, and elifelet.)

Sentences_from: Nie będą Panu wina ofiarowali, ani mu będą przyjemne. Ofiary ich będą im jako chleb płaczących; którzybykolwiek z niego jedli, zmazaliby się, przeto, że chleb ich za umarłych ich nie wnijdzie do domu Pańskiego.
Sentences_to: They have set up kings, but not by me. They have made princes, and I didn't approve. Of their silver and their gold they have made themselves idols, that they may be cut off.
Translated_sentences: they will not offer the lord wine, nor will it be pleasant to him. their offerings will be to them as bread for weeping; whosoever eat of it will be blotted out, because their bread for their dead will not enter the house of the lord.

Sentences_from: Mów, a rzecz: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja przeciwko tobie o Faraonie, królu Egipski, wielorybie wielki, który leżysz w pośrodku rzek twoich, i mówisz: Mojać jest rzeka, i jam ją sobie uczynił;
Sentences_to: Speak and say, 'Thus says the Lord Yahweh: "Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great monster that lies in the midst of his rivers, that has said, 'My river is my own, and I have made it for myself.'
Translated_sentences: speak and say, thus saith the lord god; behold, i am against you, pharaoh king of egypt, the great whale that lies in the midst of your rivers, and you say, the river is mine, and i have made it for myself.

Sentences_from: Śpiewajcie mu, śpiewajcie mu psalmy, rozmawiajcie o wszystkich cudach jego.
Sentences_to: Sing to him, sing praises to him! Tell of all his marvelous works.
Translated_sentences: sing to him, sing him psalms, talk about all his wonders.

Sentences_from: I uczynił Mojżesz, jako rozkazał Pan; i wstąpili na górę Hor przed oczyma wszystkiego zgromadzenia.
Sentences_to: Moses did as Yahweh commanded: and they went up into Mount Hor in the sight of all the congregation.
Translated_sentences: and moses did as yahweh commanded; and they went up mount hor in the sight of all the congregation.

Sentences_from: I ostrze miecza jego stępiłeś, a nie ratowałeś go w bitwie.
Sentences_to: You have ended his splendor, and thrown his throne down to the ground.
Translated_sentences: you blunt the edge of his sword, and did not save him in battle.

Sentences_from: Niech rozsądzi Pan między mną i między tobą, a niech się zemści Pan krzywdy mojej nad tobą; lecz ręka moja nie będzie na tobie.
Sentences_to: Then David and his men, who were about six hundred, arose and departed out of Keilah, and went wherever they could go. It was told Saul that David was escaped from Keilah; and he gave up going there.
Translated_sentences: may the lord judge between me and you, and may the lord avenge me against you; but my hand will not be on you.

Sentences_from: I żył Matuzalem po spłodzeniu Lamecha siedem set osiemdziesiąt lat, i dwa lata, i spłodził syny i córki.
Sentences_to: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.
Translated_sentences: and methuselah lived after he became the father of lamech, seven hundred eighty and two years, and became the father of sons and daughters.

Sentences_from: Pójdźcież, a oglądajcie sprawy Boże; straszny jest w sprawach swoich przy synach ludzkich.
Sentences_to: Come, and see God's deeds-- awesome work on behalf of the children of men.
Translated_sentences: come and see the works of god; he is terrible in his dealings with the sons of men.

Sentences_from: A teraz znieś proszę grzech mój, a wróć się ze mną, abym się pokłonił Panu.
Sentences_to: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: now, please bear my sin and come back with me, that i may bow down to the lord.

Sentences_from: I kruszyłem szczęki złośnika, a z zębów jego wydzierałem łup.
Sentences_to: I broke the jaws of the unrighteous, and plucked the prey out of his teeth.
Translated_sentences: and i broke the jaws of the wicked one, and tore the booty from its teeth.

Sentences_from: A ty wstawszy idź do domu twego a gdy wchodzić będziesz do miasta, tedy umrze dziecię.
Sentences_to: Arise therefore, and go to your house. When your feet enter into the city, the child shall die.
Translated_sentences: and you get up and go to your house, and when you enter the city, the child will die.

Sentences_from: I ofiarować będzie Aaron Lewity na ofiarę przed panem od synów Izraelskich, aby sprawowali posługi Pańskie.
Sentences_to: and Aaron shall offer the Levites before Yahweh for a wave offering, on the behalf of the children of Israel, that it may be theirs to do the service of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and aaron shall offer the levites as a sacrifice before the lord of the children of israel, to minister to the lord.

Sentences_from: Prawda z ziemi wyrośnie, a sprawiedliwość z nieba wyjrzy.
Sentences_to: Yes, Yahweh will give that which is good. Our land will yield its increase.
Translated_sentences: truth will rise out of the earth, and justice will look out of heaven.

Sentences_from: Nauczcież mię, a ja umilknę; a w czemem zbłądził pokażcie mi.
Sentences_to: "Teach me, and I will hold my peace. Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
Translated_sentences: teach me, and i will be silent; show me where he has gone astray.

Sentences_from: Z pokolenia Symeonowego Salamijel, syn Surysaddajów.
Sentences_to: Of Simeon: Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai.
Translated_sentences: of simeon, salamiiel the son of suryaddai.

Sentences_from: Z talentu złota szczerego uczynił go, i wszystko naczynie jego.
Sentences_to: He made it of a talent of pure gold, with all its vessels.
Translated_sentences: he made it and all its vessels of a talent of pure gold.

Sentences_from: Zatwardź serce ludu tego, a uszy jego obciąż, i oczy jego zawrzyj, aby nie widział oczyma swemi, a uszyma swemi nie słyszał, i sercem swem nie zrozumiał, a nie nawrócił się, i nie był uzdrowion.
Sentences_to: Make the heart of this people fat. Make their ears heavy, and shut their eyes; lest they see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and turn again, and be healed."
Translated_sentences: harden the heart of this people, and burden their ears, and bind their eyes, that they may not see with their eyes, and hear with their ears, and understand with their heart, and be converted, and be healed.

Sentences_from: I nazwała imię jego Józef, mówiąc: Niech mi przyda Pan drugiego syna.
Sentences_to: She named him Joseph, saying, "May Yahweh add another son to me."
Translated_sentences: and she called his name joseph, saying, the lord give me another son.

Sentences_from: Synowie Racheli, żony Jakóbowej: Józef i Benjamin.
Sentences_to: The sons of Rachel, Jacob's wife: Joseph and Benjamin.
Translated_sentences: the sons of rachel, jacob's wife: joseph and benjamin.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Ornan do Dawida: Weźmij je sobie, a niech uczyni król, pan mój, co mu się dobrego widzi; otoć przydaję i woły na całopalenia, i wóz na drwa, i pszenicę na ofiarę śniedną: toć to wszystko daję.
Sentences_to: Ornan said to David, "Take it for yourself, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes. Behold, I give the oxen for burnt offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the meal offering. I give it all."
Translated_sentences: and ornan said to david, take them for yourselves, and let the king my lord do whatever is good for him; lo, i am giving and oxen for burnt offerings, and a chariot for wood, and wheat for a meal-offering: these are all these i give.

Sentences_from: Kto czyni zamięszanie w domu swoim, odziedziczy wiatr, a głupi musi służyć mądremu.
Sentences_to: He who troubles his own house shall inherit the wind. The foolish shall be servant to the wise of heart.
Translated_sentences: whoever makes a commotion in his house will inherit the wind, and the foolish must serve the wise.

Sentences_from: Ale iż Nadab i Abiju umarli przed obliczem ojca swego, a synów nie mieli: przetoż odprawowali urząd kapłański Eleazar i Itamar.
Sentences_to: But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest's office.
Translated_sentences: but that nadab and abiju died before their father, and they had no sons: therefore eleazar and ithamar were priests.

Sentences_from: Oto póki było całe, nic nie mogło być z niego urobione; dopieroż gdy je ogieó strawił, a spaliło się, na nic się więcej nie przyda.
Sentences_to: Behold, when it was whole, it was meet for no work: how much less, when the fire has devoured it, and it is burned, shall it yet be meet for any work!
Translated_sentences: behold, while it was whole, nothing could be made of it; but when the fire consumes them and is burnt up, they are of no use anymore.

Sentences_from: Pamiętaj co uczynił Pan, Bóg twój, Maryi w drodze, gdyście wyszli z Egiptu.
Sentences_to: When you go forth in camp against your enemies, then you shall keep yourselves from every evil thing.
Translated_sentences: remember what the lord your god did to mary on the way when you came out of egypt.

Sentences_from: To gdy usłyszał Elijasz, zakrył oblicze swoje płaszczem swoim, a wyszedłszy stanął we drzwiach jaskini. A oto do niego głos mówiący: Co tu czynisz Elijaszu?
Sentences_to: It was so, when Elijah heard it, that he wrapped his face in his mantle, and went out, and stood in the entrance of the cave. Behold, a voice came to him, and said, "What are you doing here, Elijah?"
Translated_sentences: when elijah heard it, he covered his face with his mantle, and went out, and stood at the door of the cave. and here is a voice to him saying, what are you doing here, elijah?

Sentences_from: Potem rzekli: Nużeż, zbudujmy sobie miasto i wieżą, której by wierzch dosięgał do nieba, a uczyńmy sobie imię; byśmy się snać nie rozproszyli po obliczu wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: They said, "Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth."
Translated_sentences: then they said, come on, let's build for ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to heaven, and let's make a name for ourselves; lest we be scattered over the face of all the earth.

Sentences_from: Oto ja według słów twoich odpowiem ci za Boga, chociażem ja też z błota utworzony.
Sentences_to: Behold, I am toward God even as you are. I am also formed out of the clay.
Translated_sentences: behold, i will answer you for god according to your words, although i am also made of mud.

Sentences_from: Pragnie dusza moja do Boga, do Boga żywego, mówiąc: Kiedyż przyjdę, a okażę się przed obliczem Bożem?
Sentences_to: My tears have been my food day and night, while they continually ask me, "Where is your God?"
Translated_sentences: my soul is thirsty to god, to the living god, saying: when will i come and show myself before god?

Sentences_from: Takby i ciebie wyrwał z miejsca ciasnego na przestronne, gdzie niemasz ucisku, a spokojny stół twój byłby pełen tłustości.
Sentences_to: Yes, he would have allured you out of distress, into a broad place, where there is no restriction. That which is set on your table would be full of fatness.
Translated_sentences: so that he would deliver you from a narrow to a spacious place, where there is no oppression, and your calm table would be full of fat.

Sentences_from: Były też komory i drzwi ich przy podwojach bram, a tam omywano całopalenia.
Sentences_to: A room with its door was by the posts at the gates; there they washed the burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: there were also chambers and their doors at the gates, where burnt offerings were washed.

Sentences_from: Nad to rzekł Mojżesz: Ukaż mi proszę, chwałę twoję.
Sentences_to: He said, "Please show me your glory."
Translated_sentences: and moses said, show me thy glory, please.

Sentences_from: A w koszu najwyższym były wszelakie potrawy Faraonowe, roboty piekarskiej, a ptactwo jadło je z kosza, który był nad głową moją.
Sentences_to: In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head."
Translated_sentences: and in the highest basket were all kinds of pharaoh's bakers' dishes, and the fowls ate them from the basket that was over my head.

Sentences_from: A wnętrzności jego, i nogi jego, opłucze wodą, i zapali kapłan to wszystko na ołtarzu; całopalenie jest ofiary ognistej ku wdzięcznej wonności Panu.
Sentences_to: but its innards and its legs he shall wash with water. The priest shall burn the whole on the altar, for a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Samuel do lud: Pan świadkiem, który uczynił Mojżesza i Aarona, i który wywiódł ojce wasze z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Samuel said to the people, "It is Yahweh who appointed Moses and Aaron, and that brought your fathers up out of the land of Egypt.
Translated_sentences: and samuel said to the people, the lord is the witness that made moses and aaron, and brought your fathers out of the land of egypt.

Sentences_from: Rzekł tedy Pan: Krzyk Sodomy i Gomorry, iż się rozmnożył grzech ich, iż bardzo ociężał;
Sentences_to: Yahweh said, "Because the cry of Sodom and Gomorrah is great, and because their sin is very grievous,
Translated_sentences: and the lord said, the cry of sodom and gomorrah, because their sin was multiplied, because it was heavy;

Sentences_from: A jeźliby nie stawało do pięćdziesięciu sprawiedliwych, pięciu, izali wytracisz dla tych pięciu wszystko miasto? I rzekł Pan: Nie wytracę, jeźli tam znajdę czterdziestu i pięciu.
Sentences_to: What if there will lack five of the fifty righteous? Will you destroy all the city for lack of five?" He said, "I will not destroy it, if I find forty-five there."
Translated_sentences: and if five are not up to fifty righteous, will you destroy all the city for these five? and the lord said, i will not destroy them, if i find forty-five there.

Sentences_from: Dokądże trapić będziecie duszę moję, a nacierać na mię mowami swemi?
Sentences_to: "How long will you torment me, and crush me with words?
Translated_sentences: how long will you afflict my soul, and attack me with your words?

Sentences_from: Alem Ja jest Panem, Bogiem twoim, od wyjścia z ziemi Egipskiej; jeszczeć dopuszczę mieszkać w namiotach, jako za dni uroczystych świąt;
Sentences_to: They will walk after Yahweh, who will roar like a lion; for he will roar, and the children will come trembling from the west.

Sentences_from: A usłyszawszy Finees kapłan, i książęta zgromadzenia, i przełożeni nad tysiącmi Izraelskimi, którzy z nim byli, słowa, które mówili synowie Rubenowi, i synowie Gadowi, i synowie Manasesowi, podobało się im to.
Sentences_to: When Phinehas the priest, and the princes of the congregation, even the heads of the thousands of Israel that were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the children of Manasseh spoke, it pleased them well.

Sentences_from: Uczynił też siedem lamp do niego, i nożyczki do nich i kaganki jego ze złota szczerego.
Sentences_to: He made its seven lamps, and its snuffers, and its snuff dishes, of pure gold.
Translated_sentences: he made seven lamps for it, and its scissors and its lamps of pure gold.

Sentences_from: Przetoż teraz rozdziel tę ziemię w dziedzictwo, dziewięciorgu pokoleniu, i połowie pokolenia Manasesowego.
Sentences_to: Now therefore divide this land for an inheritance to the nine tribes and the half-tribe of Manasseh."
Translated_sentences: now therefore divide this land for an inheritance, to the nine tribes, and to the half tribe of manasseh.

Sentences_from: Ułamuj łaknącemu chleba twego, a ubogich wygnańców wprowadź do domu twego; ujrzyszli nagiego, przyodziej go, a przed ciałem swojem nie ukrywaj się.
Sentences_to: Isn't it to distribute your bread to the hungry, and that you bring the poor who are cast out to your house? When you see the naked, that you cover him; and that you not hide yourself from your own flesh?
Translated_sentences: break your hungry for bread, and bring the poor exiles into your house; when they beheld him naked, clothe him, and hide not from thy body.

Sentences_from: Powiedz synom Izraelskim, a mów do nich: Gdy wnijdziecie do ziemi, którą Ja wam daję, tedy święcić będzie ziemia sabat Panu.
Sentences_to: "Command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.
Translated_sentences: tell the children of israel, and say to them: when you enter into the land that i am giving you, the land shall keep the sabbath holy to the lord.

Sentences_from: A dnia ósmego zacne święto mieć będziecie; żadnej roboty służebniczej nie będziecie czynić.
Sentences_to: "'On the eighth day you shall have a solemn assembly: you shall do no servile work;
Translated_sentences: on the eighth day ye shall have a fair feast; you shall not do any servant work.

Sentences_from: Prędko tedy każdy złożył wór swój na ziemię; i rozwiązali każdy wór swój.
Sentences_to: Then they hurried, and each man took his sack down to the ground, and each man opened his sack.
Translated_sentences: so quickly each one lowered his sack to the ground; and they untied each one of his sacks.

Sentences_from: Mówią słowa, przysięgając kłamliwie, gdy czynią przymierze; i wzrośnie sąd jako jad na zagonach polnych.
Sentences_to: They won't pour out wine offerings to Yahweh, neither will they be pleasing to him. Their sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; all who eat of it will be polluted; for their bread will be for their appetite. It will not come into the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: they speak words, swearing falsely as they make a covenant; and judgment will increase as venom in the fields of the field.

Sentences_from: Ukazali się tedy obaj straży Filistyńskiej. I rzekli Filistynowie: Onoż Hebrejczycy wychodzą z jaskini, w której się byli pokryli.
Sentences_to: Both of them revealed themselves to the garrison of the Philistines: and the Philistines said, "Behold, the Hebrews are coming out of the holes where they had hidden themselves!"
Translated_sentences: so both appeared to guard the philistines. and the philistines said, the hebrews are coming out of the cave where they are covered.

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi pieśó Dawida, sługi Pańskiego.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By David, the servant of Yahweh. > > An oracle is within my heart about the disobedience of the wicked: "There is no fear of God before his eyes."
Translated_sentences: (to the foremost singer the songs of david, the servant of the lord.)

Sentences_from: Albowiem małżonkiem twoim jest stworzycie twój, Pan zastępów imię jego, a odkupiciel twój, Święty Izraelski, Bogiem wszystkiej ziemi zwany będzie.
Sentences_to: For your Maker is your husband; Yahweh of Armies is his name: and the Holy One of Israel is your Redeemer; the God of the whole earth shall he be called.
Translated_sentences: for you create your husband, the lord of hosts, his name is, and your redeemer, the holy one of israel, will be called the god of all the earth.

Sentences_from: Synów Jahala, synów Darkona, synów Giddela,
Sentences_to: the children of Jaalah, the children of Darkon, the children of Giddel,
Translated_sentences: the children of jahal, the children of darkon, the children of giddel,

Sentences_from: Jako ocet zębom, i jako dym oczom, tak jest leniwy tym, którzy go posyłają.
Sentences_to: As vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is the sluggard to those who send him.
Translated_sentences: as vinegar to the teeth, and as smoke to the eyes, so is he lazy to those who send him.

Sentences_from: Cóż mam czynić z tobą, o Efraimie? cóż mam czynić z tobą, o Judo? gdyż miłosierdzie wasze jest jako obłok poranny a jako rosa rano przemijająca.
Sentences_to: Their deeds won't allow them to turn to their God; for the spirit of prostitution is within them, and they don't know Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: what shall i do with you, o ephraim? what shall i do to you, o judah? for your mercy is as a morning cloud, and as the morning dew is passing away.

Sentences_from: Niewiasty spokojne! powstańcie, słuchajcie głosu mego; córki bezpieczne! bierzcie w uszy swe powieści moje.
Sentences_to: Rise up, you women who are at ease! Hear my voice! You careless daughters, give ear to my speech!
Translated_sentences: peaceful women! arise, hear my voice; daughters safe! give ear to my novels.

Sentences_from: A sykiel niech ma dwadzieścia pieniędzy a dwadzieścia syklów, dwadzieścia pięć syklów, a piętnaście syklów grzywną wam będzie.
Sentences_to: The shekel shall be twenty gerahs. Twenty shekels plus twenty-five shekels plus fifteen shekels shall be your mina.
Translated_sentences: and let the sirek have twenty money, and twenty shekels, twenty-five shekels, and fifteen shekels a fine for you.

Sentences_from: Mądrością twoją i roztropnością twoją nazbierałeś sobie bogactw, i nabyłeś złota i srebra do skarbów toich;
Sentences_to: by your wisdom and by your understanding you have gotten yourself riches, and have gotten gold and silver into your treasures;
Translated_sentences: by your wisdom and your understanding you have accumulated riches, and have acquired gold and silver for their treasures;

Sentences_from: Ale oto, dobra ich nie są w rękach ich; przetoż rada niepobożnych daleka jest odemnie.
Sentences_to: Behold, their prosperity is not in their hand. The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
Translated_sentences: but behold, their goods are not in their hands; therefore the counsel of the wicked is far from me.

Sentences_from: Tedy przyszedł Achab do domu swego smutny i zagniewany dla słowa, które mu rzekł Nabot Jezreelita, mówiąc: Nie dam ci dziedzictwa ojców moich; i układł się na łożu swem, a odwrócił twarz swoję, i nie jadł chleba.
Sentences_to: Ahab came into his house sullen and angry because of the word which Naboth the Jezreelite had spoken to him; for he had said, "I will not give you the inheritance of my fathers." He laid himself down on his bed, and turned away his face, and would eat no bread.
Translated_sentences: and ahab came to his house sad and angry at the word that naboth the jezreelite spoke to him, saying, i will not give you the inheritance of my fathers; and lay down on his bed, and turned his face away, and ate no bread.

Sentences_from: Spojrzyjcie na Abrahama, ojca waszego, i na Sarę, która was porodziła, żem go jednego wezwał, i pobłogosławiłem mu, a rozmnożyłem go.
Sentences_to: Look to Abraham your father, and to Sarah who bore you; for when he was but one I called him, and I blessed him, and made him many.
Translated_sentences: look at abraham your father and sarah, who bore you, for i called him one, and blessed him and made him multiplied.

Sentences_from: Ocuć się, ocuć się, oblecz się w siłę, o ramię Pańskie! Ocuć się jako za dni dawnych, i za rodzajów przeszłych! Izaliś nie ty jest, któreś zgładziło Egipt, i zraniło smoka?
Sentences_to: Awake, awake, put on strength, arm of Yahweh; awake, as in the days of old, the generations of ancient times. Isn't it you who cut Rahab in pieces, who pierced the monster?
Translated_sentences: awake, awake, put on strength, for the arm of the lord! awake as in the days of old and of the kinds of the past! are you not who destroyed egypt and wounded the dragon?

Sentences_from: Wyszli też synowie Benjaminowi przeciwko ludowi, o odsadziwszy się od miasta, poczęli bić lud i siec, jako pierwszy i wtóry raz po drogach, (z których jedna szła do Betel, a druga do Gabaa,)i po polu, a zabili około trzydziestu mężów z Izraela.
Sentences_to: The children of Benjamin went out against the people, and were drawn away from the city; and they began to strike and kill of the people, as at other times, in the highways, of which one goes up to Bethel, and the other to Gibeah, in the field, about thirty men of Israel.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of benjamin went out against the people, and departed from the city, began to strike the people and the net, the first and the second time along the roads (one of which went to bethel, and the other to gabaa), and in the field, and killed about thirty men. from israel.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy ojca waszego, i czeladź waszę, przyjedźcie do mnie; i dam wam dobre miejsce w ziemi Egipskiej, i będziecie używać tłustości ziemi.
Sentences_to: Take your father and your households, and come to me, and I will give you the good of the land of Egypt, and you will eat the fat of the land.'
Translated_sentences: and having taken your father and your domestics, come to me; and i will give you a good place in the land of egypt, and you will use the fat of the earth.

Sentences_from: Biada tym, którzy żądają dnia Pańskiego! cóż wam po tym dniu Pańskim, ponieważ jest ciemnością, a nie światłością?
Sentences_to: "Woe to you who desire the day of Yahweh! Why do you long for the day of Yahweh? It is darkness, and not light.
Translated_sentences: woe to those who ask for the lord's day! what to you after this day of the lord, because it is darkness and not light?

Sentences_from: A w pokoleniu Isascharowem Kades i przedmieścia jego, Daberet i przedmieścia jego.
Sentences_to: To the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron; Libnah also with its suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoa with its suburbs,
Translated_sentences: and to the tribe of issachar, kadesh and its suburbs, daberet and its suburbs.

Sentences_from: Trzy kroć do roku ukaże się każdy mężczyzna twój przed obliczem Panującego Pana, Boga Izraelskiego.
Sentences_to: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord Yahweh, the God of Israel.
Translated_sentences: three times in the year all your men shall appear before the lord god, the god of israel.

Sentences_from: I mówił tak Mojżesz do synów Izraelskich, ale nie usłuchali Mojżesza dla ściśnionego ducha, i dla niewoli ciężkiej.
Sentences_to: Moses spoke so to the children of Israel, but they didn't listen to Moses for anguish of spirit, and for cruel bondage.
Translated_sentences: and moses spoke thus to the children of israel, but they did not obey moses because of a strangled spirit, and because of heavy bondage.

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Błogosławiony wszelki, który się boi Pana, który chodzi drogami jego.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > Blessed is everyone who fears Yahweh, who walks in his ways.
Translated_sentences: a song of steps. blessed are everyone who fears the lord who walks in his ways.

Sentences_from: Nadto rzekł: Daj płachtę, którą masz na sobie, a trzymaj ją; a gdy ją trzymała, namierzył jej sześć miarek jęczmienia, i założył na nię, i weszła do miasta.
Sentences_to: He said, "Bring the mantle that is on you, and hold it." She held it; and he measured six measures of barley, and laid it on her; and he went into the city.
Translated_sentences: and he said, give the cloth that you have on, and keep it; and while she was holding her, he traced her six measures of barley, and put on her, and she entered the city.

Sentences_from: Tak zaiste mówi Pan: Ciężkie bardzo będzie skruszenie twoje, nader bolesna rana twoja.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, Your hurt is incurable, and your wound grievous.
Translated_sentences: for thus says the lord: your contrition will be very heavy, your wound will be exceedingly painful.

Sentences_from: Przetoż pytali się znowu Pana: Przyjdzieli jeszcze sam ten mąż? I odpowiedział Pan: Oto się skrył między sprzętem.
Sentences_to: Therefore they asked of Yahweh further, "Is there yet a man to come here?" Yahweh answered, "Behold, he has hidden himself among the baggage."
Translated_sentences: wherefore they asked the lord again: is this man yet come? and the lord answered, behold, he is hid among the furnishings.

Sentences_from: Nadto i cudzoziemiec, który nie jest z ludu twego Izraelskiego, przyjdzieli z ziemi dalekiej dla imienia twego;
Sentences_to: "Moreover concerning the foreigner, who is not of your people Israel, when he shall come out of a far country for your name's sake
Translated_sentences: moreover, a stranger, who is not of your people israel, came from a far country for your name's sake;

Sentences_from: I odstąpili od namiotu Korego, Datana i Abirona zewsząd. Ale Datan i Abiron wyszedłszy stali u drzwi namiotów swoich, i żony ich, i synowie ich, i maluczcy ich.
Sentences_to: So they went away from the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram, on every side: and Dathan and Abiram came out, and stood at the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little ones.
Translated_sentences: and they departed from the tent of korah, dathan, and abiron on all sides. but dathan and abiron went out, and stood at the door of their tents, and their wives, and their sons, and their little ones.

Sentences_from: I rzekli mu: Przyszliśmy, abyśmy cię związali, i wydali w ręce Filistynów; którym odpowiedział Samson: Przysiężcie mi, że się na mię sami nie targniecie.
Sentences_to: They said to him, "We have come down to bind you, that we may deliver you into the hand of the Philistines." Samson said to them, "Swear to me that you will not fall on me yourselves."
Translated_sentences: and they said to him, we are come to bind you and deliver you into the hands of the philistines; to whom samson replied, swear to me that you will not strike at me yourselves.

Sentences_from: A tak Balak dał nabić wołów i owiec, i posłał do Balaama, i do książąt, którzy z nim byli.
Sentences_to: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and sent to Balaam, and to the princes who were with him.
Translated_sentences: and balak slaughtered oxen and sheep, and sent to balaam and the princes who were with him.

Sentences_from: A oni odpowiedzieli: Zdrówci sługa twój, ojciec nasz, jeszczeć żyw. A schyliwszy się, pokłonili mu się.
Sentences_to: They said, "Your servant, our father, is well. He is still alive." They bowed down humbly.
Translated_sentences: and they said, thy servant our father is in good health, he is still alive. and bowing down, they bowed down to him.

Sentences_from: Rzekł potem Gad prorok do Dawida: Nie mieszkaj więcej na tym zamku; idź, a wróć się do ziemi Judzkiej. Tedy poszedł Dawid, a przyszedł do lasu Haret.
Sentences_to: David answered the priest, and said to him, "Truly, women have been kept from us about these three days. When I came out, the vessels of the young men were holy, though it was but a common journey. How much more then today shall their vessels be holy?"
Translated_sentences: and gad the prophet said to david, live no more in this castle; go and return to judaea. then david went and came into the forest of haret.

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwość wywyższa naród; ale grzech jest ku pohaóbieniu narodów.
Sentences_to: Righteousness exalts a nation, but sin is a disgrace to any people.
Translated_sentences: justice exalts the nation; but sin is to the peoples' reproach.

Sentences_from: Która rzekła do nich: Tak mówi Pan, Bóg Izraelski. Powiedzcie mężowi, który was posłał do mnie;
Sentences_to: because they have done that which is evil in my sight, and have provoked me to anger, since the day their fathers came forth out of Egypt, even to this day.'"
Translated_sentences: and she said to them, thus saith the lord god of israel. tell the man who sent you to me;

Sentences_from: I umarł w starości dobrej, pełen dni, bogactw i sławy: a królował Salomon, syn jego, miasto niego.
Sentences_to: He died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor: and Solomon his son reigned in his place.
Translated_sentences: and he died in good old age, full of days, riches, and glory: and solomon his son reigned in his stead.

Sentences_from: Gdzież jest ta droga do miejsca światłości? a ciemności gdzie mają miejsce swoje?
Sentences_to: "What is the way to the dwelling of light? As for darkness, where is its place,
Translated_sentences: where is this road to the place of light? and where does the darkness have its place?

Sentences_from: I rzekł Dawid do Pana, gdy ujrzał Anioła bijącego lud, mówiąc: Otom ja zgrzeszył, jam źle uczynił; ale te owce cóż uczyniły? niech się proszę obróci ręka twoja na mię i na dom ojca mego.
Sentences_to: David spoke to Yahweh when he saw the angel who struck the people, and said, "Behold, I have sinned, and I have done perversely; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand be against me, and against my father's house."
Translated_sentences: and david spake unto the lord when he saw the angel beating the people, saying, behold, i have sinned, i have done evil; but what did these sheep do? please, let your hand be on me and on my father's house.

Sentences_from: Nie będziesz mógł ofiarować ofiary święta przejścia w któremkolwiek mieście twojem, z onych, które Pan, Bóg twój, dawa tobie.
Sentences_to: if only you diligently listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to observe to do all this commandment which I command you this day.
Translated_sentences: you shall not be able to offer the sacrifice of the passover in any of your cities, of those whom the lord your god gives you.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony Pan! bo dziwnie okazał miłosierdzie swoje przeciwko mnie, jakoby w mieście obronnem.
Sentences_to: As for me, I said in my haste, "I am cut off from before your eyes." Nevertheless you heard the voice of my petitions when I cried to you.
Translated_sentences: blessed lord! for he has shown mercy in a strange way against me, as if in a defensive city.

Sentences_from: I przyniesie ją do synów Aaronowych, kapłanów, a weźmie stąd pełną garść swoję tej pszennej mąki, i tej oliwy, ze wszystkiem kadzidłem; i zapali to kapłan na pamiątkę jej na ołtarzu; ofiara ognista jest ku wdzięcznej wonności Panu;
Sentences_to: He shall bring it to Aaron's sons, the priests; and he shall take his handful of its fine flour, and of its oil, with all its frankincense; and the priest shall burn its memorial on the altar, an offering made by fire, of a pleasant aroma to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and he will bring it to the priests of aaron, and he will take from here his full handful of that wheat flour, and this oil, with all the incense; and the priest will light it in remembrance of her on the altar; a fiery sacrifice is a sweet fragrance to the lord;

Sentences_from: Ajalon i przedmieścia jego; Gatrymon i przedmieścia jego; miasta cztery.
Sentences_to: Aijalon with its suburbs, Gath Rimmon with its suburbs; four cities.
Translated_sentences: ajalon and its suburbs; gatrimon and its suburbs; four cities.

Sentences_from: Niech zaniemieją wargi kłamliwe, które mówią przeciwko sprawiedliwemu rzeczy przykre z hardością i ze wzgardą.
Sentences_to: Oh how great is your goodness, which you have laid up for those who fear you, which you have worked for those who take refuge in you, before the sons of men!
Translated_sentences: let the lying lips that speak harsh and scornful things against the righteous be speechless.

Sentences_from: Wszakże Bóg nasz jest na niebie, czyniąc wszystko, co mu się podoba.
Sentences_to: But our God is in the heavens. He does whatever he pleases.
Translated_sentences: after all, our god is in heaven, doing whatever pleases him.

Sentences_from: Kozła też jednego z stada za grzech ofiarować będziecie Panu oprócz ustawicznego całopalenia, i mokrej ofiary jego.
Sentences_to: One male goat for a sin offering to Yahweh; it shall be offered besides the continual burnt offering, and the drink offering of it.
Translated_sentences: and you shall offer one goat from the herd for sin, in addition to his continual burnt offering and his wet offering.

Sentences_from: I nie będzie ktoby uszedł i został z ostatków Judzkich, którzy weszli do ziemi Egipskiej, aby tam pielgrzymowali, aby się zaś wrócić mieli do ziemi Judzkiej, do której się oni pragną wrócić, i mieszkać tam; ale się nie wrócą, tylko ci, którzy ujdą.
Sentences_to: so that none of the remnant of Judah, who have gone into the land of Egypt to live there, shall escape or be left, to return into the land of Judah, to which they have a desire to return to dwell there: for none shall return save such as shall escape.
Translated_sentences: and there will be no one to escape and remain of the remnant of judah who came into the land of egypt to go there to make pilgrimages, and that they may return to the land of judea, to which they wish to return, and live there; but they will not return, only those who escape.

Sentences_from: Książęta ludu mego są dziećmi, a niewiasty panują nad nimi. O ludu mój! ci, którzy cię wodzą, zwodzą cię, a drogę ścieżek twoich ukrywają.
Sentences_to: As for my people, children are their oppressors, and women rule over them. My people, those who lead you cause you to err, and destroy the way of your paths.
Translated_sentences: the princes of my people are children, and women rule over them. o my people! those who lead you deceive you, and they hide the way of your paths.

Sentences_from: Zatem padł na szyję Benjamina, brata swego, i płakał; Benjamin też płakał na szyi jego.
Sentences_to: He fell on his brother Benjamin's neck, and wept, and Benjamin wept on his neck.
Translated_sentences: so he fell on the neck of his brother benjamin and wept; benjamin was crying on his neck too.

Sentences_from: Wysłuchajże głos próśb moich, gdy wołam do ciebie, gdy podnoszę ręce moje do świątnicy świętej twojej.
Sentences_to: Hear the voice of my petitions, when I cry to you, when I lift up my hands toward your Most Holy Place.
Translated_sentences: hear the voice of my prayers when i cry to you, when i lift up my hands to your holy sanctuary.

Sentences_from: I stało się niektórego dnia, gdy przyszli synowie Boży, aby stanęli przed Panem, przyszedł też szatan między nich, aby stanął przed Panem.
Sentences_to: Again it happened on the day when the God's sons came to present themselves before Yahweh, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and it happened on a certain day when the sons of god came to present themselves before the lord, and satan came among them to appear before the lord.

Sentences_from: A widząc Dawid, że słudzy jego szeptali z sobą, porozumiał Dawid, iż umarło dziecię. I rzekł Dawid do sług swoich: Albo umarło dziecię? A oni odpowiedzieli: Umarło.
Sentences_to: But when David saw that his servants were whispering together, David perceived that the child was dead; and David said to his servants, "Is the child dead?" They said, "He is dead."
Translated_sentences: and when david saw that his servants were whispering with one another, david understood that the child was dead. and david said to his servants, or is the child dead? and they said, he is dead.

Sentences_from: Usłyszał Pan prośbę moję; Pan modlitwę moję przyjął.
Sentences_to: May all my enemies be ashamed and dismayed. They shall turn back, they shall be disgraced suddenly.
Translated_sentences: the lord heard my prayer; the lord accepted my prayer.

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał Hyram, król Tyrski, posły do Dawida, i drzewa cedrowe, i cieśle, i kamienniki, i murarze, którzy zbudowali dom Dawidowi.
Sentences_to: Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and masons; and they built David a house.
Translated_sentences: and hyram king of tire sent messengers to david, and cedar trees, and carpenters, and stoners, and masons, who built a house for david.

Sentences_from: Hardość twoja zdradzi cię, i pycha serca twego, ty, który mieszkasz w rozsiadlinach skalnych, który się trzymasz wysokich pogórków; byś też wywyższył jako orzeł gniazdo swoje, i stamtąd cię stargnę, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: As for your terror, the pride of your heart has deceived you, O you who dwell in the clefts of the rock, who hold the height of the hill: though you should make your nest as high as the eagle, I will bring you down from there, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: your hardness will betray you, and the pride of your heart, you who dwell in the rocky places, who hold to the high hills; that you may exalt your nest as an eagle, and from thence i will chase you, saith the lord.

Sentences_from: Jakoż sam znosić mam ciężką pracę około was, i brzemię wasze, i swary wasze?
Sentences_to: How can I myself alone bear your encumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?
Translated_sentences: how can i myself bear your hard work and your burden and your quarrels?

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Jeźli mogą być rozmierzone niebiosa z góry, a doścignione grunty ziemi na dole, tedyć i Ja cale odrzucę nasienie Izraelskie dla tego wszystkiego, co uczynili, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: If heaven above can be measured, and the foundations of the earth searched out beneath, then will I also cast off all the seed of Israel for all that they have done, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: thus says the lord: if the heavens above may be measured, and the ground of the earth below shall be caught, then i will also throw away all the seed of israel because of all that they have done, saith the lord.

Sentences_from: Oto Pan, Pan zastępów, okrzesze wszystkę siłę latorośli, a te, którzy są wysokiego wzrostu, podetnie; i będą wysocy poniżeni.
Sentences_to: Behold, the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, will lop the boughs with terror. The tall will be cut down, and the lofty will be brought low.
