Translated_sentences: behold, the lord, the lord of hosts, will cut off all the strength of the branches, and cut off those who are tall; and will be high humiliated.

Sentences_from: Przetoż wyrzucili synowie Izraelscy Baala i Astarota, a służyli Panu samemu.
Sentences_to: Then the children of Israel removed the Baals and the Ashtaroth, and served Yahweh only.
Translated_sentences: so the children of israel threw out baal and ashtaroth, and served the lord alone.

Sentences_from: Spuść na Pana drogę twoję, a ufaj w nim, a on wszystko uczyni;
Sentences_to: Commit your way to Yahweh. Trust also in him, and he will do this:
Translated_sentences: send down your way on the lord, and trust in him, and he will do all things;

Sentences_from: Przetoż najgorszych z pogan przywiodę, aby posiedli domy ich; i uczynię wstręt pysze mocarzów, a splugawieni będą, którzy je poświęcają.
Sentences_to: Therefore I will bring the worst of the nations, and they shall possess their houses: I will also make the pride of the strong to cease; and their holy places shall be profaned.
Translated_sentences: therefore i will bring the worst of the gentiles, that they may possess their houses; and i will disgust the pride of the mighty, and those who sanctify them will be defiled.

Sentences_from: A Salmon spłodził Booza, a Booz spłodził Obeda;
Sentences_to: and Salmon became the father of Boaz, and Boaz became the father of Obed,
Translated_sentences: a salmon spelled booza, a booz spelled obeda;

Sentences_from: A do Lewiego rzekł: Tummim twoje, i Urim twoje było przy mężu świętym twoim, któregoś kusił w Massa, i z którymeś miał spór u wód Meryba.
Sentences_to: Of Levi he said, "Your Thummim and your Urim are with your godly one, whom you proved at Massah, with whom you strove at the waters of Meribah;
Translated_sentences: and to levi he said, thymim and thy urim were with thy holy man, whom thou tempted in massah, and with whom thou hast quarreled in the waters of merib.

Sentences_from: Jam jest mur, a piersi moje jako wieże. Wtenczas byłam przed oczyma jego, jako ta, która znajduje pokój.
Sentences_to: I am my beloved's. His desire is toward me.
Translated_sentences: i am a wall, and my breasts are towers. then i was before his eyes as one who finds peace.

Sentences_from: Teć są ustawy i sądy i prawa, które postanowił Pan między sobą, i między syny Izraelskimi na górze Synaj przez Mojżesza.
Sentences_to: You may make them an inheritance for your children after you, to hold for a possession; of them may you take your slaves forever: but over your brothers the children of Israel you shall not rule, one over another, with harshness.
Translated_sentences: these are the statutes, and the judgments, and the laws which the lord hath ordained among himself and among the children of israel on mount sinai by moses.

Sentences_from: Tedy na Azaryjasza, syna Obedowego, przypadł Duch Boży.
Sentences_to: So Abijah slept with his fathers, and they buried him in the city of David; and Asa his son reigned in his place. In his days the land was quiet ten years.
Translated_sentences: then the spirit of god fell on azariah the son of obed.

Sentences_from: Aby tam uciekł mężobójca, coby zabił człowieka nie chcąc, z niewiadomości; i będą wam dla ucieczki przed tym, któryby się krwi chciał mścić.
Sentences_to: that the manslayer who kills any person accidentally or unintentionally may flee there. They shall be to you for a refuge from the avenger of blood.
Translated_sentences: that a murderer would run away there, that he would kill a man without knowing it; and they will be for you to escape from the one who avenges his blood.

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał król Jerycha do Rachaby, mówiąc: Wywiedź męże, którzy przyszli do ciebie, a weszli do domu twego; bo na przeszpiegowanie wszystkiej ziemi przyszli.
Sentences_to: The king of Jericho sent to Rahab, saying, "Bring out the men who have come to you, who have entered into your house; for they have come to spy out all the land."
Translated_sentences: and the king of jericho sent to rahab, saying, bring forth the men that come to you, and are entered into your house; for they have come to spy on all the earth.

Sentences_from: Przetoż słuchajcie słowa Pańskiego wy wszyscy pojmani, którychem wysłał z Jeruzalemu do Babilonu.
Sentences_to: Hear therefore the word of Yahweh, all you of the captivity, whom I have sent away from Jerusalem to Babylon.
Translated_sentences: hear the word of the lord, all ye prisoners, whom i have sent from jerusalem to babylon.

Sentences_from: I podał im ziemię pogan, a posiedli prace narodów.
Sentences_to: He gave them the lands of the nations. They took the labor of the peoples in possession,
Translated_sentences: and he gave them the land of the gentiles, and they possessed the labors of the nations.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do mnie: Fałsz prorokują ci prorocy w imieniu mojem; nie posłałem ich, anim im rozkazał, owszem, anim mówił do nich; widzenie kłamliwe, i wieszczbę, i marność, i kłamstwo serca swego oni wam prorokują.
Sentences_to: Then Yahweh said to me, The prophets prophesy lies in my name; I didn't send them, neither have I commanded them, neither spoke I to them: they prophesy to you a lying vision, and divination, and a thing of nothing, and the deceit of their own heart.
Translated_sentences: and the lord said to me, the prophets prophesy false in my name; i did not send them, anim commanded them, yes, anim spoke to them; deceitful vision, and prophecy, and vanity, and the deceit of their hearts, they prophesy to you.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby nie chcieli wziąć kubka z ręki twojej, aby pili, tedy rzeczesz do nich: Tak mówi Pan zastępów: Koniecznie pić musicie.
Sentences_to: It shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at your hand to drink, then you shall tell them, Thus says Yahweh of Armies: You shall surely drink.
Translated_sentences: and if they refuse to take a cup from your hand to drink, then you shall say to them, thus says the lord of hosts: you must drink it.

Sentences_from: Po nim wzruszony gorliwością poprawiał Baruch, syn Zabbajowy, części drugiej od Mikzoa aż do drzwi domu Elijasyba, najwyższego kapłana.
Sentences_to: After him, Baruch the son of Zabbai earnestly repaired another portion, from the turning of the wall to the door of the house of Eliashib the high priest.
Translated_sentences: after him, moved by zeal, baruch, son of zabbayah, corrected the second part from mikzo to the door of the house of eliasib, the high priest.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Jam jest sługa Abrahamów;
Sentences_to: He said, "I am Abraham's servant.
Translated_sentences: and he said, i am the servant of abraham;

Sentences_from: Ale rzekł Pan do Dawida, ojca mego: Aczkolwiekeś postanowił w sercu twem, zbudować dom imieniowi memu, i dobrześ uczynił, żeś to umyślił w sercu twojem.
Sentences_to: But Yahweh said to David my father, 'Whereas it was in your heart to build a house for my name, you did well that it was in your heart.
Translated_sentences: but the lord said to david my father, although thou hast ordained in thy heart, to build a house for my name, and thou hast thought well in thy heart.

Sentences_from: A Neer spłodził Cysa, a Cys spłodził Saula, a Saul spłodził Jonatana, i Melchisuego, i Abidanaba, i Esbaala.
Sentences_to: Ner became the father of Kish; and Kish became the father of Saul; and Saul became the father of Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.
Translated_sentences: neer spelled juliet, cys spelled saula, saul spelled jonathan jonathan, melchisuego, abidanaba, esbaala.

Sentences_from: Onci obróci na nich nieprawość ich, a dla złości ich wytraci ich; wytraci ich Pan, Bóg nasz.
Sentences_to: He has brought on them their own iniquity, and will cut them off in their own wickedness. Yahweh, our God, will cut them off.
Translated_sentences: he will turn their iniquity upon them, and destroy them for their wickedness; the lord our god will destroy them.

Sentences_from: A widząc, żeście mię wybawić nie chcieli, odważyłem zdrowie swoje, i ciągnąłem przeciw synom Ammonowym, a podał je Pan w ręce moje, i przeczżeście przyszli do mnie dnia tego, abyście walczyli przeciwko mnie?
Sentences_to: When I saw that you didn't save me, I put my life in my hand, and passed over against the children of Ammon, and Yahweh delivered them into my hand. Why then have you come up to me this day, to fight against me?"
Translated_sentences: and seeing that you would not save me, i weighed my health, and dragged against the sons of ammon, and the lord gave them into my hand, and why did you come to me this day to fight against me?

Sentences_from: A synów ich rozmnożyłeś jako gwiazdy niebieskie, i wwiodłeś ich do ziemi, o którejś mawiał ojcom ich, że wnijdą i posiędą ją.
Sentences_to: You also multiplied their children as the stars of the sky, and brought them into the land concerning which you said to their fathers, that they should go in to possess it.
Translated_sentences: and you multiplied their sons as the stars of heaven, and led them into the land of which you told their fathers that they would go in and possess it.

Sentences_from: Bo Judas był najmężniejsz między braćmi swymi, a książęciem między nimi; ale pierworodztwo należało Józefowi.)
Sentences_to: For Judah prevailed above his brothers, and of him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph's:)
Translated_sentences: for judas was the bravest among his brethren, and the prince among them; but the birthright belonged to joseph.)

Sentences_from: Ten chował Hadassę, którą też zwano Ester, córkę stryja swego, przeto, iż nie miała ojca, ani matki; a była panienka pięknej urody, i wdzięcznej twarzy, którą Mardocheusz po śmierci ojca jej i matki jej za córkę przyjął.
Sentences_to: He brought up Hadassah, that is, Esther, his uncle's daughter; for she had neither father nor mother. The maiden was fair and beautiful; and when her father and mother were dead, Mordecai took her for his own daughter.
Translated_sentences: he hid hadassah, who was also called esther, the daughter of her uncle, because she had neither father nor mother; and she was a young lady of beautiful beauty and graceful face, which mordecai took as a daughter after the death of her father and her mother.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Jeremijasz: Stało się słowo Pańskie do mnie, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: Jeremiah said, The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
Translated_sentences: and jeremiah said, the word of the lord came unto me, saying,

Sentences_from: Oto Ja wzbudzę ich z tego miejsca, na któreście ich zaprzedali, a obrócę nagrodę waszę na głowę waszę;
Sentences_to: Behold, I will stir them up out of the place where you have sold them, and will return your repayment on your own head;
Translated_sentences: behold, i will raise them up from the place where you sold them, and i will set your reward on your head;

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Bardzoć mię utrapili zaraz od młodości mojej, powiedz teraz Izraelu.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > Many times they have afflicted me from my youth up. Let Israel now say,
Translated_sentences: a song of steps. they have afflicted me greatly from my youth, tell me now, israel.

Sentences_from: Szerokość zaś sieni na przedniej stronie, na wschód słońca, pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: The breadth of the court on the east side eastward shall be fifty cubits.
Translated_sentences: the width of the entrance hall on the front side, facing east, is fifty cubits.

Sentences_from: Synom zaś Aaronowym dali z miast Judzkich miasta ucieczki Hebron, i Lobne i przedmieścia jego, i Jeter, i Estemoa, i z przedmieściami jego;
Sentences_to: the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,
Translated_sentences: and to the sons of aaron they gave refuge cities of judea, hebron, and lobn, and its suburbs, and jether, and estemoa, and its suburbs;

Sentences_from: Przetoż upadną młodzieńcy jego na ulicach jego, a wszyscy mężowie waleczni dnia onego wytraceni będą, mówi Pan zastępów.
Sentences_to: Therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh of Armies.
Translated_sentences: therefore her young men shall fall in her streets, and all the mighty men of war shall be cut off in that day, saith the lord of hosts.

Sentences_from: Przeczżeby tedy sobie utyskiwać miał człowiek żyjący, a mąż nad kaźnią za grzechy swoje.
Sentences_to: Why does a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?
Translated_sentences: why then should the living man mourn, and the man the punishment for his sins?

Sentences_from: Ale żebyście pamiętali i czynili wszystkie przykazania moje, a byli świętymi Bogu waszemu.
Sentences_to: that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
Translated_sentences: but that you may remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your god.

Sentences_from: Bo mówi Pan: Przeto, że ten lud przybliża się do mnie usty swemi, a serce jego dalekie jest odemnie, a bojaźni, którą się mnie boją, z przykazaó ludzkich nauczyli się:
Sentences_to: The Lord said, "Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;
Translated_sentences: for says the lord: because this people draws near to me with their mouth, and their heart is far from me, and the fear which they fear me has learned by the commandments of men:

Sentences_from: Zatem przeniósł się stamtąd, i wykopał drugą studnią o którą żadnego sporu nie było; i nazwał imię jej Rechobot, i mówił: Oto, teraz rozszerzył nas Pan, i urośliśmy na ziemi.
Sentences_to: He left that place, and dug another well. They didn't argue over that one. He called it Rehoboth. He said, "For now Yahweh has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land."
Translated_sentences: so he moved from there, and dug a second well over which there was no dispute; and he called her name rehobot, and said, behold, now the lord has enlarged us, and we have grown up on the earth.

Sentences_from: Nie uczynisz krzywdy najemnikowi ubogiemu, i potrzebnemu z braci twojej, albo z cudzoziemców twoich, którzy są w ziemi twej, w bramach twoich.
Sentences_to: for Yahweh your God walks in the midst of your camp, to deliver you, and to give up your enemies before you; therefore your camp shall be holy, that he may not see an unclean thing in you, and turn away from you.
Translated_sentences: do not hurt the hired servant, who is needy and needy, of thy brethren, or of thy strangers who are in thy land, at thy gates.

Sentences_from: A Semma spłodził Rahama, syna Jerkaamowego, a Rechem spłodził Sammajego.
Sentences_to: Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.
Translated_sentences: and semma became the father of raham the son of jerkaam, and rechem became the father of sammai.

Sentences_from: Jako żyje Bóg, który odrzucił sąd mój, a Wszechmocny, który gorzkości nabawił duszy mojej:
Sentences_to: "As God lives, who has taken away my right, the Almighty, who has made my soul bitter.
Translated_sentences: as the god who has rejected my judgment lives, and the almighty who made my soul bitter:

Sentences_from: A drugi z żoną bliźniego swego czyni obrzydliwość, a inny z synową swoją sprośnie się maże; inny zaś siostrę swoję, córkę ojca swego, gwałci w tobie.
Sentences_to: One has committed abomination with his neighbor's wife; and another has lewdly defiled his daughter-in-law; and another in you has humbled his sister, his father's daughter.
Translated_sentences: and the other does an abomination to his neighbor's wife, and the other becomes dirty with his daughter-in-law; and another, his sister, his father's daughter, rapes in you.

Sentences_from: Aby poznali od wschodu słońca, i od zachodu słońca, iż niemasz żadnego oprócz mnie, Jam Pan, a niemasz żadnego więcej;
Sentences_to: that they may know from the rising of the sun, and from the west, that there is none besides me. I am Yahweh, and there is no one else.
Translated_sentences: that they may know from the sunrise and from the sunset that there is none but me, i am the lord, and there is no more;

Sentences_from: Szarpają go wszyscy, którzy drogą mimo idą; pośmiewiskiem jest i sąsiadom swoim.
Sentences_to: You have exalted the right hand of his adversaries. You have made all of his enemies rejoice.
Translated_sentences: it is plucked by all who follow the road in spite of it; he is a laughingstock also to his neighbors.

Sentences_from: I umarł Saul, a królował miasto niego Balanan, syn Achborów.
Sentences_to: Shaul died, and Baal Hanan, the son of Achbor reigned in his place.
Translated_sentences: and saul died, and balanan the son of ahbor reigned in his place.

Sentences_from: Lecz Amaza walał się w krwi w pośród drogi. A widząc on mąż, iż się zastanawiał wszystek lud nad nim, zwlekł Amazę z drogi na pole, i przyrzucił go szatą, gdyż widział, że ktokolwiek szedł mimo niego, zastanawiał się.
Sentences_to: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the midst of the highway. When the man saw that all the people stood still, he carried Amasa out of the highway into the field, and cast a garment over him, when he saw that everyone who came by him stood still.
Translated_sentences: but amaza was littered with blood in the midst of the road. when the man saw that all the people were wondering about him, he dragged amma out of the way to the field, and threw him a garment, for he saw that whoever was going in spite of him wondered.

Sentences_from: Także strusia, i sowy i wodnej kani i jastrzębia, według rodzaju ich;
Sentences_to: Moses diligently inquired about the goat of the sin offering, and, behold, it was burned: and he was angry with Eleazar and with Ithamar, the sons of Aaron who were left, saying,
Translated_sentences: and the ostrich, and the owl, and the water-kite, and the hawk, after their kind;

Sentences_from: A teraz otośmy w rękach twoich; coć się dobrego i słusznego widzi uczynić z nami, uczyń.
Sentences_to: Now, behold, we are in your hand. Do to us as it seems good and right to you to do."
Translated_sentences: and now let us stay in your hands; what he sees good and right to do with us, do.

Sentences_from: A tak zgładzone będzie przymierze wasze z śmiercią, a porozumienie wasze z piekłem nie ostoi się; gdy bicz gwałtowny przechodzić będzie, będziecie od niego podeptani.
Sentences_to: Your covenant with death shall be annulled, and your agreement with Sheol shall not stand. When the overflowing scourge passes through, then you will be trampled down by it.
Translated_sentences: and so will your covenant be cut off with death, and your agreement with hell will not stand; when a whip passes by, you will be trampled underfoot.

Sentences_from: Słyszysz urąganie ich, o Panie! i wszystkie zamysły ich przeciwko mnie.
Sentences_to: You have heard their reproach, Yahweh, and all their devices against me,
Translated_sentences: you hear their taunts, lord! and all their designs against me.

Sentences_from: I mniemasz, żeś to z rozsądkiem rzekł: Sprawiedliwość moja przechodzi Boską?
Sentences_to: "Do you think this to be your right, or do you say, 'My righteousness is more than God's,'
Translated_sentences: and you suppose you said these things wisely, my righteousness passes through god?

Sentences_from: Głos straszliwy brzmi w uszach jego, że czasu pokoju pustoszący przypadnie nań.
Sentences_to: A sound of terrors is in his ears. In prosperity the destroyer shall come on him.
Translated_sentences: a terrible voice rings in his ears that in a time of peace a devastating will fall upon him.

Sentences_from: Pierwej niż pracowała ku porodzeniu, porodziła, pierwej niż ją ogarnęła boleść, porodziła mężczyznę.
Sentences_to: "Before she travailed, she brought forth; before her pain came, she delivered a son.
Translated_sentences: before she labored to give birth, she gave birth, before pain overwhelmed her, she gave birth to a man.

Sentences_from: Pan króluje, niechże zadrżą narody; siedzi między Cherubinami, niechże się poruszy ziemia.
Sentences_to: Yahweh reigns! Let the peoples tremble. He sits enthroned among the cherubim. Let the earth be moved.
Translated_sentences: the lord reigns, let the peoples tremble; he sits among the cherubim, let the earth move.

Sentences_from: Dlategom rzekł: Odstąpcie odemnie, abym gorzko płakał; nie kwapcie się, cieszyć mię w spustoszeniu córki ludu mojego.
Sentences_to: Therefore I said, "Look away from me. I will weep bitterly. Don't labor to comfort me for the destruction of the daughter of my people.
Translated_sentences: therefore he said, depart from me, that i may weep bitterly; do not be anxious to rejoice in the desolation of the daughter of my people.

Sentences_from: Nawiedzę też dnia onego każdego, który próg przeskakuje, którzy napełniają domy panów swych łupiestwem i bezprawiem.
Sentences_to: In that day, I will punish all those who leap over the threshold, who fill their master's house with violence and deceit.
Translated_sentences: on that day i will visit everyone who jumps over the threshold, who fill their lords' houses with plunder and lawlessness.

Sentences_from: Wody kradzione słodsze są, a chleb pokątny smaczniejszy.
Sentences_to: "Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant."
Translated_sentences: the stolen waters are sweeter, and the bread is tastier.

Sentences_from: A na onych gałkach, które były na wierzchu słupów w przysionku, była robota lilii, na cztery łokcie.
Sentences_to: The capitals that were on the top of the pillars in the porch were of lily work, four cubits.
Translated_sentences: and on the knobs that were on top of the pillars of the porch, the work of the lilies was four cubits.

Sentences_from: Pragnęł tedy Dawid: Oby mi się kto dał napić wody z studni Betlehemskiej, która jest u bramy!
Sentences_to: David longed, and said, "Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Bethlehem, which is by the gate!"
Translated_sentences: and david wished, may anyone give me water to drink from the well of bethlehem at the gate!

Sentences_from: Ale oni mężowie robili wiosłami, chcąc się do brzegu dostać, wszakże nie mogli; bo się morze im dalej tem więcej burzyło przeciwko nim.
Sentences_to: Nevertheless the men rowed hard to get them back to the land; but they could not, for the sea grew more and more stormy against them.
Translated_sentences: but these men were using oars to get to the shore, but could not; for the sea the more it stormed against them.

Sentences_from: A wszakże naród on, któremu służyć będą, ja sądzić będę; a potem wynijdą stamtąd z majętnością wielką.
Sentences_to: I will also judge that nation, whom they will serve. Afterward they will come out with great wealth,
Translated_sentences: and yet this people whom they will serve, i will judge; and then they will go out from there with great wealth.

Sentences_from: Szukajcie też pokoju miastu temu, do któregom was przeniósł, a módlcie się za nie Panu; bo w pokoju jego będziecie mieli pokój.
Sentences_to: Seek the peace of the city where I have caused you to be carried away captive, and pray to Yahweh for it; for in its peace you shall have peace.
Translated_sentences: seek peace also in that city where i have transferred you, and pray for it to the lord; for in his peace you will have peace.

Sentences_from: Zaprzęgajcie konie, a wsiadajcie jezdni, staócie w hełmach, wycierajcie oszczepy, obleczcie się w pancerze.
Sentences_to: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.
Translated_sentences: harness your horses and get on the road, stand in helmets, wipe your spears, put on your armor.

Sentences_from: I nakłoniła go wielą słów swoich, a łagodnością warg swoich zniewoliła go.
Sentences_to: With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.
Translated_sentences: and she persuaded him with many words, and with the meekness of her lips she enslaved him.

Sentences_from: I Giedeor, i Achyjo, i Zacharyjasz, i Michlot;
Sentences_to: and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.
Translated_sentences: i giedeor, i achyjo, i zacharyjasz, i michlot;

Sentences_from: A poszedłszy, służyłby obcym bogom, i kłaniałby się im, albo słoócu, albo miesiącowi, albo wszystkim zastępom niebieskim, czegom nie przykazał;
Sentences_to: You shall eat no leavened bread with it. You shall eat unleavened bread with it seven days, even the bread of affliction; for you came forth out of the land of Egypt in haste: that you may remember the day when you came forth out of the land of Egypt all the days of your life.
Translated_sentences: and going and ministering to other gods, and worshiping them, either to the sun or to the month, or to all the hosts of heaven, which i have not commanded;

Sentences_from: A Sammaj był synem Maonowym, a Maon był ojcem Betsurczyków.
Sentences_to: The son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth Zur.
Translated_sentences: and sammai was the son of maon, and maon the father of the bethsurians.

Sentences_from: Ale wieża była mocna w pośrodku miasta, na którą uciekli wszyscy mężowie, i niewiasty, i wszyscy przedniejsi miasta, a zamknąwszy ją za sobą, weszli na dach wieży.
Sentences_to: But there was a strong tower within the city, and there fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and went up to the roof of the tower.
Translated_sentences: but the tower was strong in the center of the city, to which all the men and women and all the heads of the city fled, and closing it behind them, they climbed onto the roof of the tower.

Sentences_from: Tedy Jonatan pobił straż Filistyóską, która była w Gabaa, i usłyszeli Filistynowie. Zatem Saul zatrąbił w trąbę po wszystkiej ziemi, mówiąc: Niech usłyszą Hebrejczycy.
Sentences_to: Jonathan struck the garrison of the Philistines that was in Geba: and the Philistines heard of it. Saul blew the trumpet throughout all the land, saying, "Let the Hebrews hear!"
Translated_sentences: then jonathan struck down the guard of the philistines in gabaa, and the philistines heard it. so saul blew his trumpet throughout all the earth, saying, let the hebrews hear.

Sentences_from: I rzekli: Dwanaście nas braci było sług twoich, synów jednego męża w ziemi Chananejskiej; a oto, najmłodszy z ojcem naszym teraz jest w domu, a jednego już nie masz.
Sentences_to: They said, "We, your servants, are twelve brothers, the sons of one man in the land of Canaan; and behold, the youngest is this day with our father, and one is no more."
Translated_sentences: and they said, we twelve brethren are thy servants, the sons of one man in the land of canaan; and behold, the youngest with our father is now at home, and one is no more.

Sentences_from: Rzekł tedy Pan do Mojżesza: Zbierz wszystkie książęta z ludu, a każ im, te przestępce powieszać Panu przed słońcem, aby się odwrócił gniew popędliwości Pańskiej od Izraela.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Take all the chiefs of the people, and hang them up to Yahweh before the sun, that the fierce anger of Yahweh may turn away from Israel."
Translated_sentences: and the lord said to moses, gather all the princes of the people, and have them hang these transgressors before the sun before the sun, that the anger of the lord's anger may turn away from israel.

Sentences_from: Nie wnośże obrzydliwości w dom twój, abyś się nie stał przeklęstwem, jako i ona; wielce się nią brzydzić będziesz, i bardzo ją sobie obmierzysz, ponieważ przeklęstwem jest.
Sentences_to: You shall not bring an abomination into your house, and become a devoted thing like it. You shall utterly detest it, and you shall utterly abhor it; for it is a devoted thing.
Translated_sentences: do not bring abominations into your house, lest you become a curse, as she also; you will loathe it greatly, and disgust it greatly, for it is a curse.

Sentences_from: Potem mężowie Izraelscy wróciwszy się do synów Benjaminowych, wybili je ostrzem miecza, w mieście, począwszy od ludzi aż do bydlęcia, i do wszystkiego, co znaleźli; przytem i wszystkie miasta, które pozostały, popalili ogniem.
Sentences_to: The men of Israel turned again on the children of Benjamin, and struck them with the edge of the sword, both the entire city, and the livestock, and all that they found: moreover all the cities which they found they set on fire.
Translated_sentences: then the men of israel, going back to the sons of benjamin, struck them down with the edge of the sword in the city, from men to beasts, and to all that they found; and all the cities that were left they burnt with fire.

Sentences_from: Dlatego tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja powstał przeciwko tobie, o Tyrze! a przywiodę na cię wiele narodów, jakobym przywiódł morze z nawałnościami jego;
Sentences_to: therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
Translated_sentences: therefore thus says the lord god: behold, i am against you, tire! and i will bring many nations upon you, as if i had brought the sea with its storms;

Sentences_from: Matatyjasz też z Lewitów, pierworodny Salluma Korytczyka, był przełożony nad rzeczami, które w panwiach smażono.
Sentences_to: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.
Translated_sentences: matathias also of the levites, the firstborn of sallum korytczyk, was in charge of the things that were fried in pans.

Sentences_from: Z pokolenia Efraimowego Ozeasz, syn Nunów.
Sentences_to: Of the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Nun.
Translated_sentences: of the tribe of ephraim hosea the son of nun.

Sentences_from: Oto strach mój nie zatrwoży cię, a ręka moja nie obciąży cię.
Sentences_to: Behold, my terror shall not make you afraid, neither shall my pressure be heavy on you.
Translated_sentences: behold, my fear will not terrify you, and my hand will not weigh you down.

Sentences_from: Uczynił też zasłonę do drzwi namiotu z hijacyntu, i z szarłatu, i z karmazynu dwa kroć farbowanego, i z białego jedwabiu kręconego, robotą haftarską.
Sentences_to: He made a screen for the door of the tent, of blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of an embroiderer;
Translated_sentences: and he made the veil for the door of the tent of hyacinth, purple, and crimson dyed crimson, and of twisted white silk, a work of embroidery.

Sentences_from: Otoś mędrszym nad Danijela, żadna tajemnica nie jest zakryta przed tobą,
Sentences_to: behold, you are wiser than Daniel; there is no secret that is hidden from you;
Translated_sentences: you are wiser than daniel, no secret is hidden from you,

Sentences_from: Postawże nad nim bezbożnika, a przeciwnik niech stoi po prawej ręce jego.
Sentences_to: Set a wicked man over him. Let an adversary stand at his right hand.
Translated_sentences: set a wicked man over him, and let the adversary stand at his right hand.

Sentences_from: Wstań, poświęć lud i rzeczy: Poświęćcie się na jutro; bo tak mówi Pan, Bóg Izraelski: Przeklęstwo jest w pośrodku ciebie, Izraelu; nie ostoisz się przed nieprzyjacioły twymi, aż odejmiecie przeklęstwo z pośrodku siebie.
Sentences_to: "Get up! Sanctify the people, and say, 'Sanctify yourselves for tomorrow, for Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, "There is a devoted thing in the midst of you, Israel. You cannot stand before your enemies until you take away the devoted thing from among you."
Translated_sentences: get up, sanctify the people and things: sacrifice yourselves for tomorrow; for thus saith the lord god of israel: the curse is in the midst of you, israel; you will not be able to stand before your enemies until you take away the curse from within you.

Sentences_from: I uczynił go królem nad Gaaladem, i nad Assury, i nad Jezreelem, i nad Efraimem, i nad Benjaminem, i nad wszystkim Izraelem.
Sentences_to: and he made him king over Gilead, and over the Ashurites, and over Jezreel, and over Ephraim, and over Benjamin, and over all Israel.
Translated_sentences: and he made him king over gaalad, and over assura, and over jezreel, and over ephraim, and over benjamin, and over all israel.

Sentences_from: Tedy on rzekł: Niechże tak będzie, jako mówicie; jednak przy którym się znajdzie kubek, ten niech będzie niewolnikiem, a wy będziecie niewinnymi.
Sentences_to: He said, "Now also let it be according to your words: he with whom it is found will be my bondservant; and you will be blameless."
Translated_sentences: and he said, be it as ye say; but with whom the cup is found, let this one be a slave, and you will be innocent.

Sentences_from: Wszystkich synów Faresowych, mieszkających w Jeruzalemie, cztery sta sześćdziesiąt i ośm mężów dużych.
Sentences_to: All the sons of Perez who lived in Jerusalem were four hundred sixty-eight valiant men.
Translated_sentences: all the sons of pharese who live in jerusalem: four hundred and sixty-eight great men.

Sentences_from: Pieśó Dawidowa. Nie obruszaj się dla złośników, ani zajrzyj czyniącym nieprawość.
Sentences_to: < < By David. > > Don't fret because of evildoers, neither be envious against those who work unrighteousness.
Translated_sentences: david's song. do not be indignant with evildoers, neither look upon those who do lawlessness.

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi z synów Korego, na Alamot pieśó.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.Alamoth is a musical term. > > God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble.
Translated_sentences: (to the foremost singer of the sons of kore, in alamot chant.)

Sentences_from: Ani strusia, ani sowy, ani wodnej kani, ani krogulca według rodzaju jego.
Sentences_to: you shall surely strike the inhabitants of that city with the edge of the sword, destroying it utterly, and all that is therein and its livestock, with the edge of the sword.
Translated_sentences: neither the ostrich, nor the owl, nor the water kite, nor the sparrowhawk according to its kind.

Sentences_from: Teraz tedy, oto synowie Ammonowi, i Moabowi, i góra Seir, przez którycheś ty nie dopuścił przejść Izraelowi, gdy szli z ziemi Egipskiej, ale ich minęli, a nie wytracili ich.
Sentences_to: Whenever any controversy shall come to you from your brothers who dwell in their cities, between blood and blood, between law and commandment, statutes and ordinances, you shall warn them, that they not be guilty towards Yahweh, and so wrath come on you and on your brothers. Do this, and you shall not be guilty.
Translated_sentences: now, behold, the sons of ammon, and of moab, and mount seir, through which you did not allow israel to pass, as they came from the land of egypt, and passed them, and did not destroy them.

Sentences_from: Wylij na nich rozgniewanie swoje, a popędliwość gniewu twego niech ich ogarnie.
Sentences_to: Let their habitation be desolate. Let no one dwell in their tents.
Translated_sentences: send your wrath upon them, and let the anger of your anger overwhelm them.

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwość twoja sprawiedliwość wieczna, a zakon twój prawda.
Sentences_to: Your righteousness is an everlasting righteousness. Your law is truth.
Translated_sentences: your righteousness is everlasting, and your law is truth.

Sentences_from: Blisko jest zginienie Moabowe, i przyjdzie; a nieszczęście jego prędko się pospieszy.
Sentences_to: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.
Translated_sentences: moab's destruction is near, and he will come; and his misfortune will hasten quickly.

Sentences_from: Jakoż mówicie: Mocniśmy, a mężowie duży do boju?
Sentences_to: How do you say, We are mighty men, and valiant men for the war?
Translated_sentences: how do you say, we are strong, and great men to fight?

Sentences_from: A Jojada spłodził Jonatana, a Jonatan spłodził Jadduę.
Sentences_to: and Joiada became the father of Jonathan, and Jonathan became the father of Jaddua.
Translated_sentences: and jehoiada begat jonathan, and jonathan begat jaddua.

Sentences_from: Ale dni moje prędsze były niż poseł; uciekły, a nie widziały nic dobrego.
Sentences_to: "Now my days are swifter than a runner. They flee away, they see no good,
Translated_sentences: but my days were swifter than the envoy; they ran away and saw no good.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy parę wołów, rozrąbał je na sztuki, i rozesłał po wszystkich granicach Izraelskich przez też posły, mówiąc: Ktokolwiek nie wynijdzie za Saulem i za Samuelem, tak się stanie wołom jego. I padł strach Pański na lud, i wyszli jako mąż jeden.
Sentences_to: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, "Whoever doesn't come forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen." The dread of Yahweh fell on the people, and they came out as one man.
Translated_sentences: and he took a few oxen, and cut them into pieces, and sent them through all the borders of israel by the messengers, saying, whoever shall go out after saul and samuel, so shall it be to his oxen. and the fear of the lord fell on the people, and they went out as one man.

Sentences_from: Przytem pojmali dwoje książąt Madyjańskich, Oreba i Zeba; a zabili Oreba na skale Oreb, a Zeba zabili u prasy Zeb, i gonili Madyjanity, a głowę Oreba i Zeba przynieśli do Giedeona za Jordan.
Sentences_to: They took the two princes of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and they killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb, and Zeeb they killed at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian: and they brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon beyond the Jordan.
Translated_sentences: moreover, they captured two madyian princes, oreb and zeb; and they killed oreb in the rock of oreb, and they killed zeb at the zeb press, and they chased the midianites, and they brought the head of oreb and zeb to gideon across the jordan.

Sentences_from: Każdy ostrożny umiejętnie sobie poczyna; ale głupi rozpościera głupstwo.
Sentences_to: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, but a fool exposes folly.
Translated_sentences: each prudent man acts skillfully; but the foolish spreads folly.

Sentences_from: A za nim poprawiali kapłani, którzy mieszkali w równinie.
Sentences_to: After him, the priests, the men of the Plain made repairs.
Translated_sentences: the priests who lived in the plain corrected him after him.

Sentences_from: Bo już dwa lata głodu było na ziemi, a jeszcze pięć lat zostaje, których nie będą orać ani żąć.
Sentences_to: For these two years the famine has been in the land, and there are yet five years, in which there will be neither plowing nor harvest.
Translated_sentences: for there have been two years of hunger on the earth, and five more years which they will neither plow nor reap.

Sentences_from: I był nad Jeftem duch Pański, a przeszedł przez Galaad, i przez Manase; przeszedł też przez Masfa w Galaad, a z Masfy w Galaad ciągnął przeciw synom Ammonowym.
Sentences_to: Then the Spirit of Yahweh came on Jephthah, and he passed over Gilead and Manasseh, and passed over Mizpeh of Gilead, and from Mizpeh of Gilead he passed over to the children of Ammon.
Translated_sentences: and the spirit of the lord was upon jephth, and passed through galaad and through manase; and he passed through mizpah in galaad, and from mizpah at galaad he went against the sons of ammon.

Sentences_from: Panu pożycza, kto ma litość nad ubogim, a on mu za dobrodziejstwo jego odda.
Sentences_to: He who has pity on the poor lends to Yahweh; he will reward him.
Translated_sentences: whoever has mercy on the poor lends to the lord, and he will pay him back for his benefit.

Sentences_from: Izali wytrzyma serce twoje? izali zdołają ręce twoje dniom, których Ja z tobą będę miał sprawę? Ja Pan rzekłem, i uczynię.
Sentences_to: Can your heart endure, or can your hands be strong, in the days that I shall deal with you? I, Yahweh, have spoken it, and will do it.
Translated_sentences: can your heart stand? can your hands be overcome in the days that i will deal with you? i, the lord, have spoken, and will do it.

Sentences_from: Rozprzestrzeó miejsce namiotu swego, a opon przybytków swych nie zabraniaj rozciągnąć: wyciągnij powrozy twoje, a kołki twoje utwierdź.
Sentences_to: "Enlarge the place of your tent, and let them stretch forth the curtains of your habitations; don't spare: lengthen your cords, and strengthen your stakes.
Translated_sentences: set aside the place of your tent, and forbid not to stretch the tires of your tabernacles: take out your ropes, and firmly fix your pegs.

Sentences_from: Dla głosu tego, który mię sromoci i potwarza, dla nieprzyjaciela, i tego, który się mści.
Sentences_to: All this has come on us, yet have we not forgotten you, Neither have we been false to your covenant.
Translated_sentences: to the voice of him that humiliates me and afflicts me, to the enemy and to him that avenges.

Sentences_from: Zbudowałaś sobie dom nierządny, i wystawiłaś sobie wyżynę w każdej ulicy.
Sentences_to: that you have built for yourselves a vaulted place, and have made yourselves a lofty place in every street.
Translated_sentences: you built yourself a prostitute, and set yourself high in every street.

Sentences_from: A posławszy Joab posły do Dawida, rzekł: Walczyłem przeciw Rabbie i wziąłam miasto wód.
Sentences_to: Joab sent messengers to David, and said, "I have fought against Rabbah. Yes, I have taken the city of waters.
Translated_sentences: and joab sent messengers to david, and said, i fought against rabbah, and took up the city of the waters.

Sentences_from: Wspominałem sobie na śpiewanie moje; w nocym w sercu swem rozmyślał, i wywiadywał się o tem duch mój, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: "Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he be favorable no more?
Translated_sentences: i remembered singing mine; in the night he meditated in his heart, and my spirit inquired about it, saying:

Sentences_from: To usłyszawszy Syon rozweseli się, a radować się będą córki Judzkie, dla sądów twoich, Panie!
Sentences_to: Zion heard and was glad. The daughters of Judah rejoiced, because of your judgments, Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: when zion hears this, he will rejoice, and the daughters of judah will rejoice because of thy judgments, o lord.

Sentences_from: Bo długość komórek, które były w sieni zewnętrzej, była na pięćdziesiąt łokci, a przed kościołem sto łokci.
Sentences_to: For the length of the rooms that were in the outer court was fifty cubits: and behold, before the temple were one hundred cubits.
Translated_sentences: for the length of the cells that were in the outer court was fifty cubits, and in front of the temple a hundred cubits.

Sentences_from: Synowie zaś Merarego według domów swych: Naheli i Muzy; te są familije Lewiego według domów ojców ich.
Sentences_to: The sons of Merari by their families: Mahli and Mushi. These are the families of the Levites according to their fathers' houses.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of merari after their families: nahel and muse; these are the families of levi according to the houses of their fathers.

Sentences_from: Gdyż i ciemności nic nie zakryją przed tobą; owszem tobie noc jako dzień świeci; ciemnościć są jako światłość.
Sentences_to: even the darkness doesn't hide from you, but the night shines as the day. The darkness is like light to you.
Translated_sentences: for darkness will not hide anything from you; yes, night shines to you as day; darkness is as light.

Sentences_from: Ćwicz młodego według potrzeby drogi jego; bo gdy się zstarzeje, nie odstąpi od niej.
Sentences_to: Train up a child in the way he should go, and when he is old he will not depart from it.
Translated_sentences: train the young according to the need of his way; for when she grows old, he will not depart from her.

Sentences_from: Gdy omyje Pan plugastwo córek Syońskich, a krew Jeruzalemską opłócze z niego w duchu sądu, i w duchu zapalenia.
Sentences_to: when the Lord shall have washed away the filth of the daughters of Zion, and shall have purged the blood of Jerusalem from its midst, by the spirit of justice, and by the spirit of burning.
Translated_sentences: when the lord has washed the filth of the daughters of zion, and washed the blood of jerusalem from it in a spirit of judgment, and in a spirit of inflammation.

Sentences_from: A ołtarz na dwanaście łokci wdłuż, a na dwanaście wszerz czworograniasty po czterech stronach swoich;
Sentences_to: The altar hearth shall be twelve [cubits] long by twelve broad, square in the four sides of it.
Translated_sentences: and the altar is twelve cubits long, and twelve cubits wide on its four sides;

Sentences_from: Rozweselże nas według dni, którycheś nas utrapił, według lat, którycheśmy doznali złego.
Sentences_to: Make us glad for as many days as you have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen evil.
Translated_sentences: he will cheer us up according to the days in which you have afflicted us, according to the years in which we have suffered evil.

Sentences_from: Wiedzcież, żeć Pan odłączył sobie pobożnego; wysłucha Pan, gdy zawołam do niego.
Sentences_to: Stand in awe, and don't sin. Search your own heart on your bed, and be still. Selah.
Translated_sentences: know that the lord has separated himself from the pious; the lord will hear when i call to him.

Sentences_from: A wezbrawszy się z synowemi swemi wróciła się z ziemi Moabskiej; bo słyszała w krainie Moabskiej, że był nawiedził Pan lud swój, i dał im chleb.
Sentences_to: Then she arose with her daughters-in-law, that she might return from the country of Moab: for she had heard in the country of Moab how that Yahweh had visited his people in giving them bread.
Translated_sentences: and having swallowed up with her daughters in law, she returned from the land of moab; for she heard in the country of moab that the lord had visited his people, and gave them bread.

Sentences_from: A gdy usłyszał Aza te słowa, i proroctwo Obeda proroka, zmocnił się, i zniósł obrzydliwości ze wszystkiej ziemi Judzkiej i Benjamińskiej, i z miast, które był pobrał na górze Efraim, i odnowił ołtarz Pański, który był przed przysionkiem Pańskim.
Sentences_to: Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.
Translated_sentences: and when asa heard these words, and the prophecy of obed the prophet, he became strong, and suffered abominations from all the land of judea and benjamin, and from the cities he had taken in mount ephraim, and renewed the altar of the lord that was before the porch of the lord.

Sentences_from: Pan pokornych podnosi; ale niepobożnych aż ku ziemi uniża.
Sentences_to: Yahweh upholds the humble. He brings the wicked down to the ground.
Translated_sentences: the lord of the humble raises up; but he humbles the wicked to the ground.

Sentences_from: Popędliwość jego porwała mię, i wziął nienawiść przeciwko mnie; a zgrzytając na mię zębami swemi, jako nieprzyjaciel mój, bystremi oczyma swemi spojrzał na mię.
Sentences_to: He has torn me in his wrath, and persecuted me. He has gnashed on me with his teeth. My adversary sharpens his eyes on me.
Translated_sentences: his anger seized me, and he hated me; and gnashing his teeth upon me as my enemy, with his sharp eyes he looked upon me.

Sentences_from: I odwrócił się od niego ku drugiemu, i pytał się jako i przedtem; a odpowiedział mu lud tak jako i pierwej.
Sentences_to: He turned away from him toward another, and spoke like that again; and the people answered him again the same way.
Translated_sentences: and he turned from him to the other, and inquired as before; and the people answered him, as at the first time.

Sentences_from: Żadnej roboty nie będziecie czynili w ten dzień; bo dzień oczyszczania jest na oczyszczenie was przed obliczem Pana, Boga waszego.
Sentences_to: Whether it is a cow or ewe, you shall not kill it and its young both in one day.
Translated_sentences: you will not do any work on this day; for the day of cleansing is to cleanse you before the lord your god.

Sentences_from: Ale Danijel prosił króla, aby przełożył nad sprawami krainy Babilońskiej Sadracha, Mesacha i Abednego; a Danijel bywał w bramie królewskiej.
Sentences_to: Daniel requested of the king, and he appointed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, over the affairs of the province of Babylon: but Daniel was in the gate of the king.
Translated_sentences: but daniel asked the king to override sadrach, mesach and abedne over the affairs of the land of babylon; and daniel was at the king's gate.

Sentences_from: Pilnuj mię Panie! a słuchaj głosu tych, którzy się spierają ze mną.
Sentences_to: Give heed to me, Yahweh, and listen to the voice of those who contend with me.
Translated_sentences: watch me, lord! and listen to the voice of those who argue with me.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem: Ach, ach panujący Panie! Oto nie umiem mówić, bom jest dziecięciem.
Sentences_to: Then I said, "Ah, Lord Yahweh! Behold, I don't know how to speak; for I am a child."
Translated_sentences: and i said, ah, lord god! see, i cannot speak, for i am a child.

Sentences_from: Od Pana zastępów nawiedzione będzie gromem i trzęsieniem ziemi, i głosem wielkim, wichrem i burzą, i płomieniem ognia pożerającego.
Sentences_to: She will be visited by Yahweh of Armies with thunder, with earthquake, with great noise, with whirlwind and storm, and with the flame of a devouring fire.
Translated_sentences: she will be visited by the lord of hosts with thunder and earthquake and with a loud voice, with storm and storm, and with the flame of devouring fire.

Sentences_from: Przeniesie się urodzaj domu jego; dobra jego rozpłyną się w dzień gniewu jego.
Sentences_to: The increase of his house shall depart. They shall rush away in the day of his wrath.
Translated_sentences: the harvest of his house shall be shifted; his goodness will dissolve in the day of his wrath.

Sentences_from: Albowiem ruszyła się chorągiew obozu synów Judowych naprzód z hufcami swemi, a nad wojskiem jego był hetman Naason, syn Aminadabów.
Sentences_to: First, the standard of the camp of the children of Judah went forward according to their armies. Nahshon the son of Amminadab was over his army.
Translated_sentences: for the banner of the camp of the children of judah moved forward with their troops, and the captain of naason son of the aminadabs was over his army.

Sentences_from: Komory też bramy ku drodze wschodniej były trzy z jednej a trzy z drugiej strony; jednaka miara była wszystkich trzech, jednaka też miara podwoi ich z obu stron.
Sentences_to: The lodges of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
Translated_sentences: the chambers and the gates to the east road were three on one side and three on the other; the same measure was all three, and the same measure will double them on both sides.

Sentences_from: Miasta twoje w spustoszenie obrócę, że będziesz spustoszona, i dowiesz się, żem Ja Pan.
Sentences_to: I will lay your cities waste, and you shall be desolate; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: i will make your cities desolate, and you will be desolate, and you shall know that i am the lord.

Sentences_from: I zgromadził wszystkich książąt Izraelskich, i kapłanów, i Lewitów;
Sentences_to: He gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.
Translated_sentences: and he gathered all the princes of israel and the priests and the levites;

Sentences_from: Miesiąca ósmego roku wtórego Daryjusza stało się słowo Pańskie do mnie Zacharyjasza, syna Barachyjaszowego, syna Iddowego, proroka, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: In the eighth month, in the second year of Darius, the word of Yahweh came to Zechariah the son of Berechiah, the son of Iddo, the prophet, saying,
Translated_sentences: in the eighth month of the second year of darius the word of the lord came to me, zechariah son of barachiah, son of idd, a prophet, saying:

Sentences_from: Choć synowie Jonadaba, syna Rechabowego, dosyć uczynili rozkazaniu ojca swego, które im przykazał, ale ten lud nie jest mi posłuszny.
Sentences_to: Because the sons of Jonadab the son of Rechab have performed the commandment of their father which he commanded them, but this people has not listened to me;
Translated_sentences: though the sons of jonadab the son of rechab had done enough of their father's command which he commanded them, this people do not obey me.

Sentences_from: Był mąż w ziemi Uz, imieniem Ijob; a ten mąż był doskonały, i szczery, i bojący się Boga, a odstępujący od złego.
Sentences_to: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job. That man was blameless and upright, and one who feared God , and turned away from evil.
Translated_sentences: there was a man in the land of uz, whose name was job; and this man was perfect and sincere and fearing god and departing from evil.

Sentences_from: I stanęli w pośród onego pola, i obronili go, a porazili Filistynów: i wybawił Pan lud wybawieniem wielkiem.
Sentences_to: They stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and killed the Philistines; and Yahweh saved them by a great victory.
Translated_sentences: and they stood in the midst of the field, and defended it, and struck the philistines; and the lord saved the people with a great salvation.

Sentences_from: Pan mię wybawił; przetoż pieśó moję śpiewać będziemy po wszystkie dni żywota naszego w domu Pańskim.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will save me. Therefore we will sing my songs with stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: the lord saved me; therefore we shall sing my song in the house of the lord all the days of our life.

Sentences_from: Nie ofiarujcież więcej ofiary daremnej. Kadzenie jest mi obrzydłością; nowiu miesiąca i sabatu, gdy zwoływacie zgromadzenia, nie mogę ścierpieć (bo nieprawością jest) ani dnia zapowiedzianego.
Sentences_to: Bring no more vain offerings. Incense is an abomination to me; new moons, Sabbaths, and convocations: I can't bear with evil assemblies.
Translated_sentences: do not offer any more futile sacrifice. incense is an abomination to me; when you call the new moon and the sabbath day, i cannot endure (for it is unrighteousness) not the day that is foretold.

Sentences_from: A do Gada rzekł: Błogosławiony, który rozmnaża Gada! jako lew mieszkać będzie, a porwie ramię i głowę;
Sentences_to: Of Gad he said, "He who enlarges Gad is blessed. He dwells as a lioness, and tears the arm, yes, the crown of the head.
Translated_sentences: and to gad he said, blessed is he who multiplies gad! he will dwell as a lion, and shall seize his arm and head;

Sentences_from: A ktobykolwiek nie szukał Pana, Boga Izraelskiego, aby był zabity, od najmniejszego aż do największego, od męża aż do niewiast.
Sentences_to: Asa and the people who were with him pursued them to Gerar: and there fell of the Ethiopians so many that they could not recover themselves; for they were destroyed before Yahweh, and before his army; and they carried away very much booty.
Translated_sentences: whoever seeks the lord god of israel to be put to death, from the least to the greatest, from man to woman.

Sentences_from: Bo was wyzwolę od wszystkich nieczystót waszych, i przywołam zboża, i rozmnożę je, a nie dopuszczę na was głodu.
Sentences_to: I will save you from all your uncleanness: and I will call for the grain, and will multiply it, and lay no famine on you.
Translated_sentences: for i will deliver you from all your uncleanness, and i will summon grain and multiply it, and will not make you hungry.

Sentences_from: Manases Efraima, a Efraim Manasesa, a obaj społu będą przeciwko Judzie. Wszakże w tem wszystkiem nie odwróci się zapalczywość jego; ale jeszcze ręka jego będzie wyciągniona.
Sentences_to: One will devour on the right hand, and be hungry; and he will eat on the left hand, and they will not be satisfied. Everyone will eat the flesh of his own arm:
Translated_sentences: manases ephraim, and ephraim manasseh, and both will be against judah. for in all this his anger is not turned away; but his hand will be stretched out still.

Sentences_from: I stało się słowo Boże do Semejasza, męża Bożego, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: But the word of God came to Shemaiah the man of God, saying,
Translated_sentences: and the word of god came to shemaiah the man of god, saying,

Sentences_from: Napełnił je mądrością serca, aby robili wszelakie rzemiosło ciesielskie, i haftarskie, i tkackie z hijacyntu, i z szarłatu, z karmazynu dwa kroć farbowanego, i z białego jedwabiu tkacką robotą, aby robili każdą robotę dowcipnie wymyślając.
Sentences_to: He has filled them with wisdom of heart, to work all kinds of workmanship, of the engraver, of the skillful workman, and of the embroiderer, in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen, and of the weaver, even of those who do any workmanship, and of those who make skillful works.
Translated_sentences: he filled them with wisdom of heart, that they would make all kinds of carpentry, embroidery and weaving crafts of hyacinth, and purple, crimson and crimson dyed two times, and white silk, weaving, so that they would do each work with humor.

Sentences_from: Wnieśli tedy kapłani skrzynię przymierza Pańskiego na miejsce jej, do wnętrznego domu, to jest do świątnicy najświętszej pod skrzydła Cherubinów;
Sentences_to: The priests brought in the ark of the covenant of Yahweh to its place, into the oracle of the house, to the most holy place, even under the wings of the cherubim.
Translated_sentences: the priests therefore brought the ark of the lord's covenant into its place, into the inner house, that is, the most holy place, under the wings of the cherubim;

Sentences_from: A poznają Egipczanie, żem Ja Pan, gdy wyciągnę rękę moję na Egipt, i wywiodę syny Izraelskie z pośrodku ich.
Sentences_to: The Egyptians shall know that I am Yahweh, when I stretch out my hand on Egypt, and bring out the children of Israel from among them."
Translated_sentences: and the egyptians will know that i am the lord, when i stretch out my hand over egypt, and bring forth the children of israel from among them.

Sentences_from: Widzenie srogie jest mi okazane. Przewrotny przewrotność broi, a pustoszyciel pustoszy. Przyciągnijże, Elamie! Oblęż, Medzie! Babilon; wszelkiemu wzdychaniu jego koniec uczynię.
Sentences_to: A grievous vision is declared to me. The treacherous man deals treacherously, and the destroyer destroys. Go up, Elam; attack! I have stopped all of Media's sighing.
Translated_sentences: stern vision is shown to me. the perverse perversity is ravaging, and the ravager is devastating. draw it, elam! siege, medza! babylon; i will make all sighs an end.

Sentences_from: Także dla rozkosznych owoców ziemi, i obfitości jej, a dla życzliwości mieszkającego w krzu. Niech to błogosławieństwo przyjdzie na głowę Józefowę, i na wierzch głowy Nazarejczyka między bracią jego.
Sentences_to: for the precious things of the earth and its fullness, the good will of him who lived in the bush . Let this come on the head of Joseph, on the crown of the head of him who was separate from his brothers.
Translated_sentences: also for the delightful fruit of the earth and its abundance, and for the kindness of the one who dwells in the bush. let this blessing come on the head of joseph, and on the top of the head of the nazarene among his brothers.

Sentences_from: (I usłyszeli synowie Benjamin, iż się zebrali synowie Izraelscy w Masfa.) Rzekli tedy synowie Izraelscy: Powiedzcie, jako się stał ten zły uczynek?
Sentences_to: (Now the children of Benjamin heard that the children of Israel had gone up to Mizpah.) The children of Israel said, "Tell us, how did this wickedness happen?"
Translated_sentences: (and the sons of benjamin heard that the children of israel were gathered together at mizpah.) then said the children of israel, say, how is this evil work done?

Sentences_from: Pierwiastki pierwszych urodzajów ziemi twej przyniesiesz w dom Pana Boga twego. Nie będziesz warzył koźlęcia w mleku matki jego.
Sentences_to: "You shall bring the first of the first fruits of your ground to the house of Yahweh your God. "You shall not boil a young goat in its mother's milk."
Translated_sentences: you will bring the first fruits of your land into the house of the lord your god. thou shalt not brew a kid in its mother's milk.

Sentences_from: I niesli synowie Lewitów skrzynię Bożą, jako był rozkazał Mojżesz według słowa Pańskiego, na ramionach swych, na drążkach które przy niej były.
Sentences_to: The children of the Levites bore the ark of God on their shoulders with the poles thereon, as Moses commanded according to the word of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of the levites carried the ark of god, as moses had commanded according to the word of the lord, on their shoulders, on the staves that were with it.

Sentences_from: Kiedy ich był mały poczet, prawie mały poczet, a jeszcze w niej byli przychodniami.
Sentences_to: when they were but a few men in number, yes, very few, and foreigners in it.
Translated_sentences: when there was a small group of them, almost a small group, and they were still strangers in it.

Sentences_from: Jedno Panu nie bądźcie odpornymi, ani się wy bójcie ludu onej ziemi, bo jako chleb pojeść je możemy; odstąpiła obrona ich od nich, ale Pan jest z nami; nie bójcież się ich.
Sentences_to: Only don't rebel against Yahweh, neither fear the people of the land; for they are bread for us: their defense is removed from over them, and Yahweh is with us. Don't fear them."
Translated_sentences: but do not resist the lord, neither fear the people of the land, for we can eat them as bread; their defense turned away from them, but the lord is with us; do not be afraid of them.

Sentences_from: Wystawisz tedy przybytek na ten kształt, któryć ukazano na górze.
Sentences_to: You shall set up the tabernacle according to the way that it was shown to you on the mountain.
Translated_sentences: then you will build up the tabernacle according to the shape which is shown on the mountain.

Sentences_from: I stał się wieczór, i stał się zaranek, dzień czwarty.
Sentences_to: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
Translated_sentences: and the evening and the morning were the fourth day.

Sentences_from: Spojrzyjcie na narody a obaczcie i dziwujcie się z zdumieniem, przeto, iż czynię nieco za dni waszych, o czem gdy wam powiadać będą, nie uwierzycie.
Sentences_to: "Look among the nations, watch, and wonder marvelously; for I am working a work in your days, which you will not believe though it is told you.
Translated_sentences: behold the peoples, and see, and be amazed with amazement, for i do a little in your days, which when they tell you, you will not believe.

Sentences_from: Tylko niech nie chowa wiele koni, ani nawraca ludu do Egiptu, aby wiele koni nabył, ponieważ wam Pan rzekł: Nie wracajcie się zaś tą drogą więcej.
Sentences_to: Three times in a year shall all your males appear before Yahweh your God in the place which he shall choose: in the feast of unleavened bread, and in the feast of weeks, and in the feast of tents; and they shall not appear before Yahweh empty:
Translated_sentences: but let him not keep many horses, nor bring the people back to egypt, that he may have many horses, because the lord said to you, do not go back this way any more.

Sentences_from: I będzie kapłan ofiarował jedno za grzech, a drugie na ofiarę całopalenia, i oczyści go od tego, czem zgrzeszył nad umarłym, a poświęci głowę jego dnia onego.
Sentences_to: The priest shall offer one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering, and make atonement for him, because he sinned by reason of the dead, and shall make his head holy that same day.
Translated_sentences: and the priest shall offer one for a sin, and the other for a burnt offering, and will cleanse him from all that he has sinned over the dead, and sanctify his head that day.

Sentences_from: I dał imię pierwszej Jemina, a imię drugiej Kietzyja, a imię trzeciej Kierenhappuch.
Sentences_to: He called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren Happuch.
Translated_sentences: and he called the first jemin, the name of the second ketya, and the name of the third kierenhappuch.

Sentences_from: A Sedechyjasz, syn Chanaanowy, sprawił sobie rogi żelazne, i rzekł: Tak mówi Pan: Temi będziesz bódł Syryjczyków, aż ich wyniszczysz.
Sentences_to: The fear of Yahweh fell on all the kingdoms of the lands that were around Judah, so that they made no war against Jehoshaphat.
Translated_sentences: and zedekiah the son of canaan made iron horns for himself, and said, thus saith the lord: with this thou shalt continue the syrians until thou destroy them.

Sentences_from: Z nozdrzy jego wychodzi dym, jako z garnca wrzącego, albo kotła.
Sentences_to: "I will not keep silence concerning his limbs, nor his mighty strength, nor his goodly frame.
Translated_sentences: from his nostrils comes smoke as from a boiling pot or a cauldron.

Sentences_from: A powiedz ziemi Izraelskiej: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Otom Ja przeciwko tobie, i dobędę miecza mego z pochew jego, i wytnę z ciebie sprawiedliwego i niezbożnego.
Sentences_to: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,
Translated_sentences: and say to the land of israel, thus says the lord god: behold, i am against thee, and i will draw my sword out of his sheath, and cut out the righteous and the wicked from you.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Michas: Teraz wiem, że mi będzie Pan błogosławił, gdyż mam Lewitę za kapłana.
Sentences_to: Then Micah said, "Now know I that Yahweh will do good to me, since I have a Levite to my priest."
Translated_sentences: and micah said, now i know that the lord will bless me, for i have a levite priest.

Sentences_from: Widział też Jakób twarz Labanową, a oto, nie był takim przeciwko niemu, jako przedtem.
Sentences_to: Jacob saw the expression on Laban's face, and, behold, it was not toward him as before.
Translated_sentences: jacob saw the face of laban, and, behold, he was not against him as before.

Sentences_from: A jeźliby lud ziemi nie dbając przeglądał mężowi takiemu, który by ofiarował Molochowi potomstwo swe, i nie zabiłby go:
Sentences_to: "'Don't turn to idols, nor make molten gods for yourselves. I am Yahweh your God.
Translated_sentences: and if the people of the earth heedlessly looked upon a man who would offer his offspring to moloch, and would not kill him:

Sentences_from: Jako jeść wiele miodu nie jest rzecz dobra: tak szukanie własnej sławy jest niesławne.
Sentences_to: It is not good to eat much honey; nor is it honorable to seek one's own honor.
Translated_sentences: how to eat a lot of honey is not a good thing: so seeking self-fame is infamous.

Sentences_from: Z przykazaó twoich nabyłem rozumu: przetoż mam w nienawiści wszelką ścieszkę obłędliwą.
Sentences_to: Through your precepts, I get understanding; therefore I hate every false way.
Translated_sentences: by thy commandments i have acquired understanding: therefore i hate every insane path.

Sentences_from: Pan jest Bóg zapalczywy i mściwy; mściwy jest Pan a gniewliwy; Pan, który się mści nad przeciwnikami swymi, i chowa gniew przeciwko nieprzyjaciołom swoim.
Sentences_to: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenges. Yahweh avenges and is full of wrath. Yahweh takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.
Translated_sentences: the lord is a fiery and vengeful god; the lord is vengeful and angry; the lord who avenges his adversaries and haths anger against his enemies.

Sentences_from: I upadł Joab obliczem swem na ziemię, a pokłoniwszy się błogosławił królowi, i rzekł Joab: Dziś poznał sługa twój, żem znalazł łaskę w oczach twoich, królu, panie mój, ponieważ uczynił król zadość prośbie sługi swego.
Sentences_to: Joab fell to the ground on his face, showed respect, and blessed the king. Joab said, "Today your servant knows that I have found favor in your sight, my lord, king, in that the king has performed the request of his servant."
Translated_sentences: and joab fell down with his face to the ground, and bowed down, and blessed the king, and joab said, today thy servant hath known that i have found favor in thy eyes, my lord king, because the king has done to satisfy his servant's request.

Sentences_from: Zwierciadła, i rantuszki, i tkanki, i letniki.
Sentences_to: the hand mirrors, the fine linen garments, the tiaras, and the shawls.
Translated_sentences: mirrors and rims and tissues and lettuces.

Sentences_from: I wszedłszy Aod do niego, (a on sam siedział na sali letniej, którą miał sam dla siebie,)i rzekł Aod: Mam rozkazanie Boże do ciebie. I powstał z stolicy swojej.
Sentences_to: Ehud came to him; and he was sitting by himself alone in the cool upper room. Ehud said, "I have a message from God to you." He arose out of his seat.
Translated_sentences: and aod went in to him (and he himself sat in the summer hall which he had for himself) and aod said, i have a commandment of god to you. and he rose from his capital.

Sentences_from: A było dni Izaakowych sto lat, i osiemdziesiąt lat.
Sentences_to: The days of Isaac were one hundred eighty years.
Translated_sentences: and the days of isaac were one hundred and eighty years.

Sentences_from: Wszedł tedy Naaman, i oznajmił to panu swemu, mówiąc: Tak a tak mówiła dzieweczka, która jest z ziemi Izraelskiej.
Sentences_to: Someone went in, and told his lord, saying, "The maiden who is from the land of Israel said this."
Translated_sentences: and naaman went in and told his lord, saying, thus and thus saith the maid who is of the land of israel.

Sentences_from: (Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi na Machalat pieśó Dawidowa nauczająca.)
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. To the tune of "Mahalath." A contemplation by David. > > The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt, and have done abominable iniquity. There is no one who does good.
Translated_sentences: (to the foremost singer of machalat, david's song teaching.)

Sentences_from: Przed grzmotem jeźdźców i strzelających z łuku uciecze wszystko miasto; wejdą do gęstych obłoków, i na skały wstąpią. Wszystkie miasta opuszczone będą, a nie będzie, ktoby w nich mieszkał.
Sentences_to: Every city flees for the noise of the horsemen and archers; they go into the thickets, and climb up on the rocks: every city is forsaken, and not a man dwells therein.
Translated_sentences: all the city flees from the thunder of horsemen and archers; they will go into dense clouds and go up onto rocks. all cities will be abandoned, and no one will live in them.

Sentences_from: Nie został nikt z Enakitów, w ziemi synów Izraelskich; tylko w Gazie, w Gad, i w Azdod zostali.
Sentences_to: There were none of the Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel. Only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod, did some remain.
Translated_sentences: none of the enakites remained in the land of the children of israel; they stayed only in gaza, in gad, and in azdod.

Sentences_from: I położę znak odkupienia między ludem moim i między ludem twoim; jutro będzie znak ten.
Sentences_to: Then the magicians said to Pharaoh, "This is the finger of God:" and Pharaoh's heart was hardened, and he didn't listen to them; as Yahweh had spoken.
Translated_sentences: and i will make a sign of redemption between my people and your people; this sign will be tomorrow.

Sentences_from: A jeźliż jest nieczysta ziemia osiadłości waszej, przeprowadźcie się do ziemi dziedzictwa Pańskiego, w której przebywa przybytek Pański, i weźmiecie osiadłości w pośrodku nas; tylko Panu nie bądźcie odpornymi, a nie odpadajcie od nas, budując sobie ołtarz oprócz ołtarza Pana, Boga naszego.
Sentences_to: However, if the land of your possession is unclean, then pass over to the land of the possession of Yahweh, in which Yahweh's tabernacle dwells, and take possession among us; but don't rebel against Yahweh, nor rebel against us, in building an altar other than the altar of Yahweh our God.
Translated_sentences: and if the land of your inheritance is unclean, bring yourselves to the land of the inheritance of the lord, where the tabernacle of the lord is, and you will take a seat in our midst; only do not resist the lord, and do not fall away from us, building for yourselves an altar, except that of the lord our god.

Sentences_from: I rzekli do Jeremijasza proroka:Niech przyjdzie proszę prośba nasza przed oblicze twoje, a módl się za nami Panu, Bogu twemu, za wszystek ten ostatek; bo nas mało zostało z wielu, jako to widzisz oczyma twemi;
Sentences_to: and said to Jeremiah the prophet, Please let our supplication be presented before you, and pray for us to Yahweh your God, even for all this remnant; for we are left but a few of many, as your eyes do see us:
Translated_sentences: and they said to jeremiah the prophet, let our prayer, i pray thee, come before you, and pray for us to the lord your god, for all this remnant; for we are few left of many, as you see with your eyes;

Sentences_from: Synów Elamowych tysiąc dwieście pięćdziesiąt i cztery;
Sentences_to: The children of Elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.
Translated_sentences: the children of elam, one thousand two hundred fifty-four.

Sentences_from: Wymierzył też mur domu na sześć łokci, a szerokość komory na cztery łokcie wszędy około domu.
Sentences_to: Then he measured the wall of the house, six cubits; and the breadth of every side room, four cubits, all around the house on every side.
Translated_sentences: he also measured the wall of the house to be six cubits, and the width of the chamber to be four cubits all around the house.

Sentences_from: Ponieważ od króla i od siedmiu radnych panów jego jesteś posłany, abyś dojrzał Judy i Jeruzalemu według zakonu Boga twego, który jest w rękach twoich.
Sentences_to: Because you are sent of the king and his seven counselors, to inquire concerning Judah and Jerusalem, according to the law of your God which is in your hand,
Translated_sentences: for from the king and from the seven councilors of his masters you were sent to see judah and jerusalem according to the law of your god which is in your hands.

Sentences_from: Ona tedy przybiwszy gwoździem do wału tkackiego rzekła do niego: Filistynowie nad tobą, Samsonie; ale on ocuciwszy się ze snu swego, wyrwał gwóźdź z osnową i z wałem.
Sentences_to: She fastened it with the pin, and said to him, "The Philistines are on you, Samson!" He awakened out of his sleep, and plucked away the pin of the beam, and the web.
Translated_sentences: and she, nailing to the weaving shaft, said to him, the philistines are upon thee, samson; but he awakened from his sleep, and plucked the nail with the warp and the shaft.

Sentences_from: A niech postanowi król starostów po wszystkich krainach królestwa swego, którzyby zebrali wszystkie dzieweczki, panienki pięknej urody, do Susan miasta stołecznego, do domu białych głów, pod dozór Hegaja, komornika królewskiego, stróża białych głó w, a dali im ochędostwa ich.
Sentences_to: Let the king appoint officers in all the provinces of his kingdom, that they may gather together all the beautiful young virgins to the citadel of Susa, to the women's house, to the custody of Hegai the king's eunuch, keeper of the women. Let cosmetics be given them;
Translated_sentences: and let the king of governors in all the regions of his kingdom, that he gather all the little girls, young ladies of beautiful beauty, to susan, the capital city, to the house of white heads, under the supervision of hegai, the king's bailiff, and guardian of the white heads, and give them their mouthpieces.

Sentences_from: Spustoszenie w mieście zostanie, a bramy zburzone będą.
Sentences_to: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.
Translated_sentences: desolation will remain in the city, and the gates will be pulled down.

Sentences_from: Tedy Abimelech rzekł do Abrahama: Na cóż to siedmioro owiec, któreś postawił osobno?
Sentences_to: Abimelech said to Abraham, "What do these seven ewe lambs which you have set by themselves mean?"
Translated_sentences: and abimelech said to abraham, what are the seven sheep that thou hast set apart?

Sentences_from: Teć są domy Lewi: dom Libnitów, dom Hebronitów, dom Moholitów, dom Musytów, dom Korytów; a Kaat spłodził Amrama.
Sentences_to: These are the families of Levi: the family of the Libnites, the family of the Hebronites, the family of the Mahlites, the family of the Mushites, the family of the Korahites. Kohath became the father of Amram.
Translated_sentences: these are the houses of levi: the house of the libnites, the house of the hebronites, the house of the moholitas, the house of the musites, the house of koryta; and kaat became the father of amram.

Sentences_from: A tak poczęła niewiasta, i porodziła syna o onymże czasie po roku, jako jej był powiedział Elizeusz.
Sentences_to: The woman conceived, and bore a son at that season, when the time came around, as Elisha had said to her.
Translated_sentences: so the woman conceived, and bare a son at that time of the year, as elisha had told her.

Sentences_from: Przetoż oto przychodzą dni, mówi Pan, których nie rzeką więcej: Jako żyje Pan, który wywiódł synów Izraelskich z ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: Therefore behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that they shall no more say, As Yahweh lives, who brought up the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt;
Translated_sentences: therefore, behold, the days are coming, saith the lord, which shall no longer be said: as the lord lives, who brought the children of israel out of the land of egypt.

Sentences_from: I rozkazałem Baruchowi przed oczyma ich, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: I commanded Baruch before them, saying,
Translated_sentences: and i commanded baruch before their eyes, saying:

Sentences_from: Także we wszystkich sprawach ręki możnej, i we wszystkich postrachach wielkich, które czynił Mojżesz przed oczyma wszystkiego Izraela.
Sentences_to: Yahweh alone led him. There was no foreign god with him.
Translated_sentences: and in all the things of the mighty hand, and in all the great dreads which moses did in the sight of all israel.

Sentences_from: Albowiem pomagał mu Bóg przeciw Filistynom, i przeciw Arabczykom, którzy mieszkali w Gurbaalu, i przeciw Mahunitom.
Sentences_to: A man of God came to him, saying, "O king, don't let the army of Israel go with you; for Yahweh is not with Israel, with all the children of Ephraim.
Translated_sentences: for god helped him against the philistines, and against the arabs who lived in gurbaal, and against the mahunites.

Sentences_from: Poślij mi też drzewa cedrowego, jodłowego, i almugimowego z Libanu; bo ja wiem, iż słudzy twoi umieją wyrąbywać drzewo na Libanie; a oto słudzy moi będą z sługami twoimi,
Sentences_to: "Now therefore send me a man skillful to work in gold, and in silver, and in brass, and in iron, and in purple, and crimson, and blue, and who knows how to engrave engravings, to be with the skillful men who are with me in Judah and in Jerusalem, whom David my father provided.
Translated_sentences: send me also cedar, fir, and almug trees from lebanon; for i know your servants know how to cut wood in lebanon; and behold, my servants will be with your servants,

Sentences_from: Do starości przywiódł ciało moje i skórę moję, a połamał kości moje.
