Sentences_to: My flesh and my skin has he made old; he has broken my bones.
Translated_sentences: he brought my flesh and skin to old age, and broke my bones.

Sentences_from: Dlatego wyrzucę was z tej ziemi do ziemi, którejście nie znali, wy i ojcowie wasi, a tam służyć będziecie bogom cudzym we dnie i w nocy, dokąd wam nie okażę miłosierdzia.
Sentences_to: therefore will I cast you forth out of this land into the land that you have not known, neither you nor your fathers; and there you shall serve other gods day and night; for I will show you no favor.
Translated_sentences: therefore, i will throw you out of this land to a land that you and your fathers did not know, and there you will serve other gods day and night, until i show you mercy.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Dawid do Michol: Przed Panem (który mnie raczej obrał niż ojca twego, i niżeli wszystek dom jego, rozkazując mi, abym był książęciem nad ludem Pańskim, nad Izraelem.) grałem, i będę grał przed Panem.
Sentences_to: David said to Michal, "It was before Yahweh, who chose me above your father, and above all his house, to appoint me prince over the people of Yahweh, over Israel. Therefore will I celebrate before Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and david said to michol, before the lord (who hath chosen me rather than thy father, and than all his house, commanding me to be ruler over the lord's people over israel) i have played, and will play before the lord.

Sentences_from: Ja mu będę za ojca, a on mi będzie za syna, który gdy wystąpi, skarzę go rózgą ludzką, i plagami synów człowieczych.
Sentences_to: I will be his father, and he shall be my son. If he commits iniquity, I will chasten him with the rod of men, and with the stripes of the children of men;
Translated_sentences: i will be his father, and he will be my son, and when he comes up, i will punish him with a human rod and with the plagues of the sons of men.

Sentences_from: Wody wielkie nie mogłyby zagasić tej miłości, ani rzeki zatopić; choćby kto wszystkę majętność domu swego dał za takową miłość, byłby pewnie wzgardzony.
Sentences_to: Many waters can't quench love, neither can floods drown it. If a man would give all the wealth of his house for love, he would be utterly scorned. Friends
Translated_sentences: much waters could not quench this love, nor drown rivers; if any man gave all the goods of his house for such love, he would be despised.

Sentences_from: Co gdy ujrzeli mężowie Izraelscy, którzy za doliną, i za Jordanem mieszkali, iż uciekali mężowie Izraelscy, a iż umarł Saul, i synowie jego, odbieżawszy miast, pouciekali też, a przyszedłszy Filistynowie mieszkali w nich.
Sentences_to: David said to Abiathar the priest, the son of Ahimelech, "Please bring me here the ephod." Abiathar brought the ephod to David.
Translated_sentences: what when the men of israel who lived beyond the valley and beyond jordan saw, that the men of israel fled, and that saul and his sons had died when they received the cities, and fled, and came and dwelt in them.

Sentences_from: A gdy usłyszał król słowa ksiąg zakonu, rozdarł szaty swe.
Sentences_to: "Because Manasseh king of Judah has done these abominations, and has done wickedly above all that the Amorites did, who were before him, and has made Judah also to sin with his idols;
Translated_sentences: and when the king heard the words of the books of the law, he tore his garments.

Sentences_from: Syna Amaryjaszowego, syna Azaryjaszowego, syna Merajotowego,
Sentences_to: the son of Amariah, the son of Azariah, the son of Meraioth,
Translated_sentences: the son of amariah, the son of azariah, the son of meraiot,

Sentences_from: A do Zabulona rzekł: Wesel się Zabulon w wyjściu swem, a ty Isaschar w namiotach twoich.
Sentences_to: I will surely hide my face in that day for all the evil which they shall have worked, in that they are turned to other gods.
Translated_sentences: and to zebulun he said, rejoice, zebulun in thy going out, and thou, issachar, in thy tents.

Sentences_from: Synów Azgadowych dwa tysiące trzy sta dwadzieścia i dwa;
Sentences_to: The children of Azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty-two.
Translated_sentences: the children of azgad, two thousand three hundred twenty-two.

Sentences_from: Sprawiedliwe są wszystkie słowa ust moich; nie masz w nich nic nieprawego ani przewrotnego.
Sentences_to: All the words of my mouth are in righteousness. There is nothing crooked or perverse in them.
Translated_sentences: all the words of my mouth are righteous. there is nothing unrighteous or perverse about them.

Sentences_from: Bo się rozszerzał mur w około im dalej tem bardziej z wierzchu dla komór, które były około domu, od wierzchu aż do dołu zewsząd w około domu, ponieważ on dom im dalej tem szerszy był od wierzchu, a tak najniższe komory rozszerzały się ku wierzchow i dla średniej komory.
Sentences_to: The side rooms were broader as they encompassed [the house] higher and higher; for the encompassing of the house went higher and higher around the house: therefore the breadth of the house [continued] upward; and so one went up [from] the lowest [room] to the highest by the middle [room].
Translated_sentences: for the wall grew all around the farther, the farther the top of the chambers around the house, from the top to the bottom all around the house, for the house was the farther the wider was from the top, and so the lowest chambers grew out towards the top and for the middle compartment.

Sentences_from: Wszystkie narody klaskajcie rękoma, wykrzykajcie Bogu głosem wesela.
Sentences_to: For Yahweh Most High is awesome. He is a great King over all the earth.
Translated_sentences: clap your hands, all peoples, shout to god with the voice of joy.

Sentences_from: Przeczże ma być żal mój wieczny? a rana moja śmiertelna, która się uleczyć nie da? Przeczże mi tak masz być jako omylny, jako wody niepewne?
Sentences_to: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuses to be healed? Will you indeed be to me as a deceitful brook, as waters that fail?
Translated_sentences: why is my sorrow everlasting? and my wound is deadly, which cannot be healed? why should you be so fallible to me, as shaky waters?

Sentences_from: A Hebrejczycy, którzy przedtem przestawali z Filistynami, którzy z nimi ciągnęli w obozie tam i sam, ci się też obróciwszy stanęli przy Izraelu, który był z Saulem i z Jonatanem.
Sentences_to: Now the Hebrews who were with the Philistines as before, and who went up with them into the camp, from all around, even they also turned to be with the Israelites who were with Saul and Jonathan.
Translated_sentences: and the hebrews, who had been with the philistines before, who had gone with them in the camp there and by themselves, also turned, and stood with israel, who was with saul and jonathan.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Bóg: Niech będą światła na rozpostarciu niebieskim, ku rozdzielaniu dnia od nocy, a niech będą na znaki, i pewne czasy, i dni, i lata.
Sentences_to: God said, "Let there be lights in the expanse of sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs, and for seasons, and for days and years;
Translated_sentences: and god said, let there be lights in the expanse of heaven to divide the day from the night, and let them be for signs, and certain times, and days and years.

Sentences_from: Wzięliśmy też wszystkie miasta jego na on czas; nie było miasta, którego byśmy im nie wzięli, sześćdziesiąt miast, wszystkę krainę Argob królestwa Ogowego w Basan.
Sentences_to: We took all his cities at that time; there was not a city which we didn't take from them; sixty cities, all the region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
Translated_sentences: and we have taken all his cities at that time; there was no city which we did not take from them, sixty cities, all the land of argob, the kingdom of og in bashan.

Sentences_from: I będziesz się weselił w święto uroczyste twoje, ty, i syn twój, i córka twoja, i sługa twój, i służebnica twoja, i Lewita, i przychodzień, i sierota, i wdowa, którzy będą w bramach twoich.
Sentences_to: you shall furnish him liberally out of your flock, and out of your threshing floor, and out of your winepress; as Yahweh your God has blessed you, you shall give to him.
Translated_sentences: and you will rejoice at your solemn feast, you, and your son, and your daughter, and your servant, and your handmaid, and the levite, and the stranger, and the orphan, and the widow who will be in your gates.

Sentences_from: Tedym była u niego jako wychowaniec, i byłam uciechą jego na każdy dzień, grając przed nim na każdy czas.
Sentences_to: then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, always rejoicing before him,
Translated_sentences: then i was with him as a tutor, and i was his joy every day, playing in front of him every time.

Sentences_from: Przedniejszemu śpiewakowi psalm Dawidowy. Głupi rzekł w sercu swojem: Niemasz Boga. Popsowali się, obrzydliwymi się stali w zabawach swoich: niemasz, ktoby czynił dobrze.
Sentences_to: < < For the Chief Musician. By David. > > The fool has said in his heart, "There is no God." They are corrupt. They have done abominable works. There is none who does good.
Translated_sentences: to the foremost singer a psalm of david. a fool said in his heart, there is no god. they have broken themselves down, they have become disgusting in their games: there is no one doing good.

Sentences_from: Albowiem serce ich myśli o drapiestwie, a wargi ich mówią o uciśnieniu.
Sentences_to: for their hearts plot violence, and their lips talk about mischief.
Translated_sentences: for their heart thinks of violence, and their lips speak of oppression.

Sentences_from: Szczerym w ciemnościach światłość wschodzi; łaskawy, miłosierny, i sprawiedliwy jest Bóg.
Sentences_to: Light dawns in the darkness for the upright, gracious, merciful, and righteous.
Translated_sentences: for those who are honest, light rises in darkness; gracious, merciful, and just is god.

Sentences_from: Żądza sprawiedliwych jest zawżdy ku dobremu; ale oczekiwanie niepobożnych, popędliwość.
Sentences_to: The desire of the righteous is only good. The expectation of the wicked is wrath.
Translated_sentences: the desire of the righteous is always for good; but the expectation of the wicked, rashness.

Sentences_from: Odpowiedział mu młodzieniec, który mu to oznajmił: Przyszedłem z trafunku na górę Gilboe, a oto, Saul tkwiał na włóczni swojej, a wozy i jezdni doganiali go.
Sentences_to: The young man who told him said, "As I happened by chance on Mount Gilboa, behold, Saul was leaning on his spear; and behold, the chariots and the horsemen followed hard after him.
Translated_sentences: the young man who said to him answered him, i have come by chance to mount gilboe, and behold, saul was on his spear, and the wagons and the people were chasing after him.

Sentences_from: Obejrzyj się na przymierze twoje; albowiem i najciemniejsze kąty ziemi pełne jaskió drapiestwa.
Sentences_to: Honor your covenant, for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the earth.
Translated_sentences: look at your covenant; for the darkest corners of the earth are full of caverns of predation.

Sentences_from: Przetoż odszedł król Izraelski do domu swego smutny i zagniewany, i przyszedł do Samaryi.
Sentences_to: The king of Israel went to his house sullen and angry, and came to Samaria.
Translated_sentences: so the king of israel went to his house, sad and angry, and came to samaria.

Sentences_from: Baliście się miecza; ale miecz przywiodę na was, mówi panujący Pan.
Sentences_to: You have feared the sword; and I will bring the sword on you, says the Lord Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: you feared the sword; but i will bring the sword upon you, saith the lord god.

Sentences_from: Także gdy wnijdziesz między zboże bliźniego twego, tedy narwiesz kłosów ręką twą; ale sierpa nie zapuszczaj w zboże bliźniego twego.
Sentences_to: but to the lady you shall do nothing; there is in the lady no sin worthy of death: for as when a man rises against his neighbor, and kills him, even so is this matter;
Translated_sentences: and when thou come among thy neighbour's corn, then thou shalt pluck ears with thy hand; but do not put the sickle on your neighbor's grain.

Sentences_from: A tak lamentując król nad Abnerem, rzekł: Izali tak miał umrzeć Abner, jako umiera nikczemnik?
Sentences_to: The king lamented for Abner, and said, "Should Abner die as a fool dies?
Translated_sentences: and the king lamented over abner, and said, shall abner die, as the wicked dies?

Sentences_from: Tam Mesech, Tubal i wszystka zgraja jego, i w około niego groby jego, ci wszyscy nieobrzezaócy pobici mieczem, choć puszczali strach swój w ziemi żyjących.
Sentences_to: There is Meshech, Tubal, and all their multitude; their graves are around them; all of them uncircumcised, slain by the sword; for they caused their terror in the land of the living.
Translated_sentences: there, meshech, tubal, and all his multitude, and his graves around him, all the uncircumcising ones, slain with the sword, though they cast their fear in the land of the living.

Sentences_from: Oto Ja pobudzę przeciwko nim Medów, którzy o srebro nie będą dbali, a w złocie nie będą się kochali;
Sentences_to: Behold, I will stir up the Medes against them, who will not value silver, and as for gold, they will not delight in it.
Translated_sentences: behold, i will raise up the medes against them, who will not care for silver, and will not love gold;

Sentences_from: Ale się na każdy poranek odnawiają; wielka jest prawda twoja.
Sentences_to: They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.
Translated_sentences: but they are renewed every morning; great is your truth.

Sentences_from: Moc moja i chwała moja Pan, bo mi się stał zbawieniem; ten jest Bogiem moim, przetoż przybytek wystawię mu; Bóg ojca mego, przetoż wywyższać go będę.
Sentences_to: Yah is my strength and song. He has become my salvation. This is my God, and I will praise him; my father's God, and I will exalt him.
Translated_sentences: the lord is my strength and my glory, for he has become my salvation; this is my god, and i will make him a tabernacle; my father's god, and i will exalt him.

Sentences_from: A imię żony Abisurowej Abihail, która mu urodziła Achobbana i Molida.
Sentences_to: The name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bore him Ahban, and Molid.
Translated_sentences: and the name of abishur's wife is abihail, who bore him ahobban and molid.

Sentences_from: Wystawił mię zaiste na przypowieść ludziom, i jako śmiechowisko przed nimi.
Sentences_to: "But he has made me a byword of the people. They spit in my face.
Translated_sentences: he set me up for a parable to men, and as a laughingstock before them.

Sentences_from: Budując sobie nierządne domy na rozstaniu każdego gościńca, a wyżynę sobie stawiając w każdej ulicy, owszem pogardzając zapłatą nie jesteś ani jako wszetecznica,
Sentences_to: in that you build your vaulted place at the head of every way, and make your lofty place in every street, and have not been as a prostitute, in that you scorn pay.
Translated_sentences: building for yourself prostitutes at the parting of every highway, and setting high places for yourself in every street, but despising wages, and you are not a harlot,

Sentences_from: Pieśó stopni. Gdy zaś Pan nawrócił pojmanych z Syonu, byliśmy jako ci, którym się śni.
Sentences_to: < < A Song of Ascents. > > When Yahweh brought back those who returned to Zion, we were like those who dream.
Translated_sentences: a song of steps. but when the lord converted those captives of zion, we were as dreamers.

Sentences_from: Choćby i nazbyt miał wszystkiego, ściśniony będzie; wszelka ręka trapiących oburzy się nań.
Sentences_to: In the fullness of his sufficiency, distress shall overtake him. The hand of everyone who is in misery shall come on him.
Translated_sentences: even if he has everything too much, he will be crushed; every hand of the afflicted will be indignant at him.

Sentences_from: Trzody ich, i majętności ich, i wszystkie bydła ich, azaż nie nasze będą? na to tylko im pozwólmy, a będą mieszkać z nami.
Sentences_to: Won't their livestock and their possessions and all their animals be ours? Only let us give our consent to them, and they will dwell with us."
Translated_sentences: their flocks, and their goods, and all their cattle, are they not ours? let them only let them do it, and they will live with us.

Sentences_from: Teć są dni lat żywota Abrahamowego, które przeżył, sto i siedemdziesiąt, i pięć lat.
Sentences_to: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.
Translated_sentences: these are the days of the years of abraham's life which he lived, one hundred and seventy and five years.

Sentences_from: Syn Heseda w Arubot, który trzymał Socho i wszystkę ziemię Chefer;
Sentences_to: Ben Hesed, in Arubboth (to him belonged Socoh, and all the land of Hepher);
Translated_sentences: the son of hesed in aruboth, who kept shoho and all the land of hhefer;

Sentences_from: Bogaty nad ubogimi panuje; ale ten, co pożycza, sługą bywa tego, który mu pożycza.
Sentences_to: The rich rule over the poor. The borrower is servant to the lender.
Translated_sentences: the rich rules over the poor; but the borrower is the servant of the lender.

Sentences_from: Tedyćby nas byli żywo pożarli w rozpaleniu gniewu swego przeciwko nam;
Sentences_to: then they would have swallowed us up alive, when their wrath was kindled against us;
Translated_sentences: then they would have swallowed us up alive in their anger against us;

Sentences_from: Tedy będę nauczał przestępców dróg twoich, aby się grzesznicy do ciebie nawrócili.
Sentences_to: Lord, open my lips. My mouth shall declare your praise.
Translated_sentences: then i will teach the transgressors of your ways, that sinners may turn back to you.

Sentences_from: To, co było, teraz jest, a co będzie, już było; albowiem Bóg odnawia to, co przeminęło.
Sentences_to: That which is has been long ago, and that which is to be has been long ago: and God seeks again that which is passed away.
Translated_sentences: what was now is, and what will be has already been; for god renews what has passed.

Sentences_from: Jedni w wozach, a drudzy w koniach ufają; ale my na imię Pana, Boga naszego, wspominamy.
Sentences_to: They are bowed down and fallen, but we rise up, and stand upright.
Translated_sentences: some in the carts, and some trust in the horses; but we remember the name of the lord our god.

Sentences_from: Zda się pod czas droga być prosta człowiekowi; wszakże dokończenie jej jest drogą na śmierć.
Sentences_to: There is a way which seems right to a man, but in the end it leads to death.
Translated_sentences: in time the path will be straight for a man; but its completion is the way to death.

Sentences_from: Który zgromadził jako na kupę wody morskie, i złożył do skarbu przepaści.
Sentences_to: He gathers the waters of the sea together as a heap. He lays up the deeps in storehouses.
Translated_sentences: he gathered the waters of the sea as a heap, and put it into the treasure of the abyss.

Sentences_from: Nadto i sabaty moje dałem im, aby były znakiem między mną i między nimi, aby wiedzieli, żem Ja jest Pan, który ich poświęcam.
Sentences_to: Moreover also I gave them my Sabbaths, to be a sign between me and them, that they might know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
Translated_sentences: moreover, i also gave them my sabbaths, that they might be a sign between me and them, that they might know that i am the lord who sanctify them.

Sentences_from: A miasto było szerokie i wielkie, ale ludu mało w murach jego, a jeszcze nie były domy pobudowane.
Sentences_to: Now the city was wide and large; but the people were few therein, and the houses were not built.
Translated_sentences: and the city was wide and great, but there were few people within its walls, and houses were not yet built.

Sentences_from: Kto strzeże drzewa figowego, pożywa owocu jego; także kto strzeże pana swego, uczczony będzie.
Sentences_to: Whoever tends the fig tree shall eat its fruit. He who looks after his master shall be honored.
Translated_sentences: whoever keeps the fig tree eats its fruit; also whoever guards his lord will be honored.

Sentences_from: Ale ja w tobie mam nadzieję, Panie! Rzekłem: Tyś jest Bogiem moim.
Sentences_to: My times are in your hand. Deliver me from the hand of my enemies, and from those who persecute me.
Translated_sentences: but i hope in you, lord! i said: you are my god.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem do Anioła, który mówił zemną: Cóż to jest? I rzekł do mnie: Teć są rogi, które rozrzuciły Judę i Izraela i Jeruzalem.
Sentences_to: Then I asked, "Where are you going?" He said to me, "To measure Jerusalem, to see what is its breadth and what is its length."
Translated_sentences: and i said to the angel that talked with me, what is this? and he said to me, these are the horns which have scattered judah, and israel, and jerusalem.

Sentences_from: Gdy tedy Izraelczycy pobili wszystkie obywatele Haj na polu przy puszczy, tedy za nimi szli w pogoó, a polegli oni wszyscy od miecza, aż wygładzeni są; obrócili się wszyscy Izraelczycy do Haj, i wysiekli je ostrzem miecza.
Sentences_to: It happened, when Israel had made an end of killing all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, in the wilderness in which they pursued them, and they had all fallen by the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, that all Israel returned to Ai, and struck it with the edge of the sword.
Translated_sentences: and when the israelites had slain all the inhabitants of ai in the field by the wilderness, they followed them in the heat, and they all fell by the sword, until they were cut off; all the israelites turned to ai, and smashed it with the edge of the sword.

Sentences_from: Przysiągł Pan przez prawicę swoję i przez ramię mocy swojej, mówiąc: Nie podam więcej pszenicy twojej na pokarm nieprzyjaciołom twoim, i nie będą pić cudzoziemcy wina twego, około któregoś pracował.
Sentences_to: Yahweh has sworn by his right hand, and by the arm of his strength, "Surely I will no more give your grain to be food for your enemies; and foreigners shall not drink your new wine, for which you have labored:
Translated_sentences: the lord swore by his right hand and by the arm of his strength, saying, i will not give your wheat any more food for your enemies, neither shall foreigners drink your wine, about which you have labored.

Sentences_from: Roku dwudziestego i trzeciego Joaza, syna Ochozyjasza, króla Judzkiego, królował Joachaz, syn Jehu, nad Izraelem w Samaryi siedmnaście lat.
Sentences_to: In the seventh year of Jehu began Jehoash to reign; and he reigned forty years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Zibiah of Beersheba.
Translated_sentences: in the twentieth and third year of jehoash the son of ahaziah king of judah, jehoahaz the son of jehu reigned over israel in samaria seventeen years.

Sentences_from: Leniwiec rękę kryje do zanadrzy swych, a ciężko mu jej podnosić do ust swoich.
Sentences_to: The sluggard buries his hand in the dish. He is too lazy to bring it back to his mouth.
Translated_sentences: the sloth hides his hand to his bosom, and it is hard for him to raise it to his mouth.

Sentences_from: Rozstępując rozstąpi się ziemia; rozsiadając rozsiądzie się ziemia; poruszając poruszy się ziemia.
Sentences_to: The earth is utterly broken. The earth is torn apart. The earth is shaken violently.
Translated_sentences: when parting, the earth will part; the ground will sit down; the earth will move as it moves.

Sentences_from: Przetoż i Ja postąpię z nimi wedłu zapalczywości; oko moje nie sfolguje ani się zmiłuję; i będą wołać do uszów moich głosem wielkim, a nie wysłucham ich.
Sentences_to: Therefore will I also deal in wrath; my eye shall not spare, neither will I have pity; and though they cry in my ears with a loud voice, yet will I not hear them.
Translated_sentences: therefore i will deal with them in fury; my eye will neither pity nor have mercy; and they will cry to my ears with a loud voice, and i will not hear them.

Sentences_from: Bo gdybyśmy byli nie omieszkali, już byśmy się byli dwa kroć wrócili.
Sentences_to: for if we hadn't delayed, surely we would have returned a second time by now."
Translated_sentences: because if we hadn't missed it, we would've been back twice.

Sentences_from: A ty, synu człowieczy! izalibyś się zastawiał, izalibyś się zastawiał za to miasto krwi? Raczej mu oznajmij wszystkie obrzydliwości jego.
Sentences_to: You, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? then cause her to know all her abominations.
Translated_sentences: and you, son of man! would you pledge, or would you pledge for this city of blood? rather, tell him all his abominations.

Sentences_from: Usta moje będą opowiadały mądrość, a myśl serca mego roztropność.
Sentences_to: I will incline my ear to a proverb. I will open my riddle on the harp.
Translated_sentences: my mouth will tell wisdom, and my heart will speak to understanding.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza: Wyciesz sobie dwie tablice kamienne, podobne pierwszym, a napiszę na tychże tablicach słowa, które były na tablicach pierwszych, któreś stłukł.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Moses, "Chisel two stone tablets like the first: and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
Translated_sentences: and the lord said to moses, cut for yourselves two tablets of stone like the first, and i will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets that you broke.

Sentences_from: Przylgnęła do prochu dusza moja; ożywże mię według słowa twego.
Sentences_to: My soul is laid low in the dust. Revive me according to your word!
Translated_sentences: my soul clings to the dust; quicken me according to thy word.

Sentences_from: Ale teraz niech odrzucą wszeteczeństwo swoje, i trupy królów swoich odemnie, a będę mieszkał w pośrodku ich na wieki.
Sentences_to: Now let them put away their prostitution, and the dead bodies of their kings, far from me; and I will dwell in their midst forever.
Translated_sentences: but now let them put away their fornication and the dead bodies of their kings from me, and i will live in the midst of them forever.

Sentences_from: Gdzie rozmnożył Bóg lud swój bardzo, i uczynił go możniejszym nad nieprzyjaciół jego.
Sentences_to: He increased his people greatly, and made them stronger than their adversaries.
Translated_sentences: where god multiplied his people greatly, and made them more powerful than his enemies.

Sentences_from: A postanowił z nich siedmdziesiąt tysięcy, co ciężary nosili, a ośmdziesiąt tysięcy tych, co wyrąbywali na górze, a trzy tysiące i sześć set przystawów nad robotami ludu.
Sentences_to: Solomon numbered all the foreigners who were in the land of Israel, after the numbering with which David his father had numbered them; and they were found one hundred fifty-three thousand six hundred.
Translated_sentences: and he made seventy thousand of them to bear burdens, and eighty thousand of them to cut down on the mountain, and three thousand and six hundred rest over the work of the people.

Sentences_from: Miecz zewnątrz, a mór i głód będzie wewnątrz; kto będzie na polu, od miecza umrze; a kto w mieście, głód i mór go pożre.
Sentences_to: The sword is outside, and the pestilence and the famine within: he who is in the field shall die with the sword: and he who is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.
Translated_sentences: the sword is outside, and the plague and hunger will be inside; whoever is in the field will die by the sword; and whoever is in the city, hunger and plague will eat him up.

Sentences_from: We dnie taczają się jako w ciemnościach, a jako w nocy macają w południe.
Sentences_to: They meet with darkness in the day time, and grope at noonday as in the night.
Translated_sentences: they roll as in darkness during the day, and grope at noon as in the night.

Sentences_from: Którzy przyszedłszy do Balaama, mówili mu: Tak mówi Balak, syn Seforów: Nie ociągaj się proszę przyjść do mnie;
Sentences_to: They came to Balaam, and said to him, "Thus says Balak the son of Zippor, 'Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me:
Translated_sentences: and when they came to balaam, they said to him, thus says balak the son of sephora: do not hesitate, come to me;

Sentences_from: Który mądrze niebiosa uczynił; albowiem na wieki miłosierdzie jego;
Sentences_to: To him who by understanding made the heavens; for his loving kindness endures forever:
Translated_sentences: who by wisdom made the heavens; for his mercy endures forever;

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Absalom i wszyscy mężowie Izraelscy: Lepsza jest rada Chusajego Arachity, niż rada Achitofelowa. Albowiem Pan był postanowił, aby rozerwana była rada Achitofelowa, która była dobra, a tak aby przywiódł Pan złe na Absaloma.
Sentences_to: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel." For Yahweh had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, to the intent that Yahweh might bring evil on Absalom.
Translated_sentences: and absalom and all the men of israel said, better is the counsel of husa the arachite than the counsel of ahithophel. for the lord had ordained that the counsel of ahithophel, which was good, should be broken, so that the lord would bring evil upon absalom.

Sentences_from: Nie bój się, bo pohaóbiona nie będziesz; a nie zapalaj się, bo nie przyjdziesz na posromocenie; owszem na zelżywość młodości twojej zapomnisz, a na pohaóbienie wdowstwa twego więcej nie wspomnisz.
Sentences_to: "Don't be afraid; for you shall not be ashamed: neither be confounded; for you shall not be disappointed: for you shall forget the shame of your youth; and the reproach of your widowhood you shall remember no more.
Translated_sentences: do not be afraid, for you will not be ashamed; and do not get caught fire, for you will not come to the after-promotion; yes, for the slander of your youth you will forget, and you will not remember your widowhood again.

Sentences_from: Z Asera tłusty chleb jego, a on wyda rozkoszy królewskie.
Sentences_to: "Asher's food will be rich. He will yield royal dainties.
Translated_sentences: out of asher his bread shall be fat, and he shall yield royal dainties.

Sentences_from: Gdy wchodzić będą do namiotu zgromadzenia, umywać się będą wodą, aby nie pomarli; także gdyby mieli przystępować do ołtarza, aby służyli, i zapalili ofiarę ognistą Panu.
Sentences_to: When they go into the Tent of Meeting, they shall wash with water, that they not die; or when they come near to the altar to minister, to burn an offering made by fire to Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: when they enter the tent of meeting, they will wash themselves with water, lest they die; also if they were to come to the altar to serve and to light a fiery sacrifice to the lord.

Sentences_from: Spraw sobie dwie trąby srebrne; robotą ciągnioną uczynisz je, których używać będziesz do zwoływania ludu, i gdyby się wojsko ruszać miało.
Sentences_to: "Make two trumpets of silver. You shall make them of beaten work. You shall use them for the calling of the congregation, and for the journeying of the camps.
Translated_sentences: get yourself two silver trumpets; you will make them hauled work, which you will use to summon the people, and when the army should move.

Sentences_from: Albowiem oto minęła zima! deszcz przeszedł, i przestał.
Sentences_to: For, behold, the winter is past. The rain is over and gone.
Translated_sentences: for, behold, winter is over! the rain has passed and stopped.

Sentences_from: Modlitwa Dawidowa. Nakłoó, Panie! ucha twego, a wysłuchaj mię; bomci nędzny i ubogi.
Sentences_to: < < A Prayer by David. > > Hear, Yahweh, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.
Translated_sentences: david's prayer. order, lord! hear your ear and hear me. he is wretched and poor.

Sentences_from: A skórkami koźlęcemi obwinęła ręce jego, i gładkość szyi jego.
Sentences_to: She put the skins of the young goats on his hands, and on the smooth of his neck.
Translated_sentences: and she put the skins of the kids on his hands, and the smoothness of his neck.

Sentences_from: Ale Jebuzejczyka, obywatela Jeruzalemskiego, nie mogli synowie Judowi wypędzić; przetoż mieszkał Jebuzejczyk z syny Juda w Jeruzalemie aż do dnia tego.
Sentences_to: As for the Jebusites, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, the children of Judah couldn't drive them out; but the Jebusites live with the children of Judah at Jerusalem to this day.
Translated_sentences: but the jebusai, a citizen of jerusalem, could not be driven out by the sons of judah; therefore the jebusite of the son of judah lived in jerusalem until this day.

Sentences_from: Ten też poraził Edomczyków dziesięć tysięcy w dolinie solnej, i wziął mocą Selę, a nazwał imię jej Jokteel, aż do tego czasu.
Sentences_to: For he didn't leave to Jehoahaz of the people any more than fifty horsemen, and ten chariots, and ten thousand footmen; for the king of Syria destroyed them, and made them like the dust in threshing.
Translated_sentences: he struck the edom ten thousand in the valley of the salt, and took selah by power, and called her jokteel until that time.

Sentences_from: Wszelkie bydlę poślubione, które się pod ślubem oddawa, od człowieka nie będzie odkupione, ale śmiercią umrze.
Sentences_to: You will eat the flesh of your sons, and you will eat the flesh of your daughters.
Translated_sentences: any beast that is wedded to a vow will not be redeemed from man, but will die.

Sentences_from: A ten kozieł kosmaty jest król Grecki, a ten róg wielki, który jest między oczyma jego, jest król pierwszy.
Sentences_to: The rough male goat is the king of Greece: and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.
Translated_sentences: the hairy goat is the king of greece, and the great horn that is between his eyes is the first king.

Sentences_from: Bo przez sześć dni stworzył Pan niebo i ziemię, morze, i cokolwiek w nich jest, i odpoczął dnia siódmego; przetoż błogosławił Pan dzień odpocznienia, i poświęcił go.
Sentences_to: for in six days Yahweh made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore Yahweh blessed the Sabbath day, and made it holy.
Translated_sentences: for in six days the lord made heaven and earth, the sea, and all that is in them, and rested the seventh day; therefore the lord blessed the day of rest, and made it holy.

Sentences_from: I będzie mocarz jako zgrzebia, a ten, który go uczynił, jako iskra; i zapalą się oboje pospołu, a nie będzie, ktoby zagasił.
Sentences_to: The strong will be like tinder, and his work like a spark. They will both burn together, and no one will quench them."
Translated_sentences: and the mighty shall be as a scribble, and he that made him shall be as a spark; and they will both be lit.

Sentences_from: Wołają sprawiedliwi, a Pan ich wysłuchiwa, i ze wszystkich trudności ich wybawia ich.
Sentences_to: Yahweh is near to those who have a broken heart, and saves those who have a crushed spirit.
Translated_sentences: the righteous cry, and the lord hears them, and saves them from all their troubles.

Sentences_from: Oto córka moja panna, i założnica jego, wywiodę je zaraz, że je obelżycie, a uczynicie z niemi, co się wam będzie dobrego zdało; tylko mężowi temu nie czyńcie tej zelżywości.
Sentences_to: Behold, here is my virgin daughter and his concubine. I will bring them out now. Humble them, and do with them what seems good to you; but to this man don't do any such folly."
Translated_sentences: behold, my virgin daughter and his concubine, i will bring them forth at once, that i will abhor them, and you will do to them whatever seems best to you. only do not make this man this insult.

Sentences_from: Według sprawiedliwości twej wybaw mię, i wyrwij mię; nakłoó ku mnie ucha twego, i zachowaj mię.
Sentences_to: Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me. Turn your ear to me, and save me.
Translated_sentences: save me according to your righteousness, and deliver me; incline your ear to me, and save me.

Sentences_from: Ale dwom mężom, którzy szpiegowali onę ziemię, rzekł Jozue: Wnijdźcie do domu niewiasty wszetecznej, a wywiedźcie stamtąd niewiastę, i wszystko, co jej jest, jakoście jej przysięgli.
Sentences_to: Joshua said to the two men who had spied out the land, "Go into the prostitute's house, and bring out from there the woman and all that she has, as you swore to her."
Translated_sentences: but to the two men who were spying on the land, joshua said, go into the house of the prostitute, and bring the woman out of there, and all that is hers, as you swore to her.

Sentences_from: A gdy rozszerzy Pan, Bóg twój, granice twoje, jako przysiągł ojcom twoim, i dać wszystkę ziemię, którą zaślubił dać ojcom twoim:
Sentences_to: They shall have like portions to eat, besides that which comes of the sale of his patrimony.
Translated_sentences: and when yahweh your god enlarges your borders, as he has sworn to your fathers, and to give all the land which he has married to give to your fathers:

Sentences_from: Abyś tak nosiła haóbę twoję, a wstydziła się za wszystko, coś czyniła, a tak abyś je ucieszyła.
Sentences_to: that you may bear your own shame, and may be ashamed because of all that you have done, in that you are a comfort to them.
Translated_sentences: that you might bear your reproach and be ashamed of all that you have done, and that you might please them.

Sentences_from: Przetoż teraz o Panie, Boże Izraelski, ziść słudze twemu Dawidowi, ojcu memu, coś mu powiedział, mówiąc: Nie będzie odjęty przed twarzą moją z narodu twego mąż, któryby siedział na stolicy Izraelskiej, jeźli tylko będą przestrzegali synowie twoi drogi swej, chodząc przede mną, jakoś ty chodził przed oblicznością moją.
Sentences_to: Now therefore, may Yahweh, the God of Israel, keep with your servant David my father that which you have promised him, saying, 'There shall not fail you a man in my sight to sit on the throne of Israel, if only your children take heed to their way, to walk before me as you have walked before me.'
Translated_sentences: now therefore, o lord, the god of israel, bring to my servant david my father what he said to him, saying, he will not be taken from your people from your people, who will sit on the throne of israel, if your sons keep their way by walking in front of you. me, as you walked before me.

Sentences_from: Długość opony jednej dwadzieścia i osiem łokci, a szerokość opony jednej na cztery łokcie; pod jedną miarą były wszystkie opony.
Sentences_to: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits. All the curtains had one measure.
Translated_sentences: the length of one tire twenty and eight cubits, and the width of one tire four cubits; all the tires were one measure.

Sentences_from: Któż nie wie z tych wszystkich rzeczy, że to ręka Pańska sprawiła?
Sentences_to: Who doesn't know that in all these, the hand of Yahweh has done this,
Translated_sentences: who does not know of all these things that the hand of the lord has made it?

Sentences_from: A tak stanąwszy Rabsaces wołał głosem wielkim po żydowsku, a mówiąc rzekł: Słuchajcie słów króla wielkiego, króla Assyryjskiego.
Sentences_to: So one of the priests whom they had carried away from Samaria came and lived in Bethel, and taught them how they should fear Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and rabsaces stood, shouting with a loud voice in yiddish, and saying, hear the words of the great king, king of assyria.

Sentences_from: Trzeci Absalom, syn Maachy, córki Tolmaja, króla Giessur; czwarty Adonijasz, syn Haggity;
Sentences_to: the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;
Translated_sentences: third absalom, son of maacha, daughter of tolmai, king of giessur; the fourth, adonijah, son of haggita;

Sentences_from: Teraz tedy tak mówi Pan zastępów: Uważajcież, jako się wam powodzi;
Sentences_to: Now therefore this is what Yahweh of Armies says: Consider your ways.
Translated_sentences: now therefore thus saith the lord of hosts: take heed how well it is unto you;

Sentences_from: O mieczu Pański, dokąd się nie uspokoisz? Wróć się do pochew twoich, uśmierz się, a ucichnij.
Sentences_to: You sword of Yahweh, how long will it be before you be quiet? Put up yourself into your scabbard; rest, and be still.
Translated_sentences: o sword of the lord, how long will you not calm down? return to your scabbards, calm down and be still.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan do Jozuego: Otom dał w ręce twoje Jerycho, i króla jego, i możne wojska jego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to Joshua, "Behold, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and the mighty men of valor.
Translated_sentences: yahweh said to joshua, “behold, i have handed jericho into your hand, with its king and mighty armies.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Manue do Anioła Pańskiego: Daj się proszę zatrzymać, a nagotujemy przed cię koźlątko z stada.
Sentences_to: Manoah said to the angel of Yahweh, "Please, let us detain you, that we may make a young goat ready for you."
Translated_sentences: and manoah said to the angel of the lord, let me stop, please, and we will prepare a young kid of the flock for you.

Sentences_from: Tedy mi rzekł: Synu człowieczy! onić to są mężowie, którzy zamyślają o nieprawości, a radzą złą radę w tem mieście,
Sentences_to: He said to me, Son of man, these are the men who devise iniquity, and who give wicked counsel in this city;
Translated_sentences: then he said to me, son of man! these are the men who ponder iniquity, and counsel bad counsel in this city,

Sentences_from: Połknie śmierć w zwycięstwie, a Pan panujący otrze łzę z każdego oblicza, i pohaóbienie ludu swego odejmie ze wszystkiej ziemi; bo Pan mówił.
Sentences_to: He has swallowed up death forever! The Lord Yahweh will wipe away tears from off all faces. He will take the reproach of his people away from off all the earth, for Yahweh has spoken it.
Translated_sentences: he will swallow death in victory, and the lord god will wipe away a tear from every face, and take the reproach of his people from all the earth; because the lord spoke.

Sentences_from: Inaczej stanie się, gdy zaśnie król, pan mój, z ojcy swymi, że będziemy ja i Salomon, syn mój, jako grzesznicy.
Sentences_to: Otherwise it will happen, when my lord the king shall sleep with his fathers, that I and my son Solomon shall be counted offenders."
Translated_sentences: otherwise, when the king my lord falls asleep with his fathers, i and solomon my son will be sinners.

Sentences_from: Ale Pan rzekł do niego: idź, wróć się drogą twą na puszczę Damaską, a gdy tam przyjdziesz, pomażesz Hazaela za króla nad Syryją;
Sentences_to: Yahweh said to him, "Go, return on your way to the wilderness of Damascus. When you arrive, you shall anoint Hazael to be king over Syria.
Translated_sentences: but yahweh said to him, go back to your way into the wilderness of damascus, and when you come there, you will anoint hazael king over syria.

Sentences_from: Zagubił też one konie, które byli królowie Judzcy oddali słoócu, a stały, kędy wchodzą do domu Pańskiego, podle mieszkania Natanmelecha dworzanina, które było na przedmieściu; i wozy słońca spalił ogniem.
Sentences_to: It happened, when the king had heard the words of the book of the law, that he tore his clothes.
Translated_sentences: and he lost the horses which the kings of judah had given to the sun, and they stood by the way into the house of the lord, by the dwelling of nathanmelech the courtier, which was in the suburbs; and he burnt the chariots of the sun with fire.

Sentences_from: Dał tedy Pan, Bóg nasz, w ręce nasze i Oga, króla Basańskiego, i wszystek lud jego, i poraziliśmy go, tak że nie zostało po nim nikogo.
Sentences_to: So Yahweh our God delivered into our hand Og also, the king of Bashan, and all his people: and we struck him until none was left to him remaining.
Translated_sentences: so yahweh our god put og king of bashan into our hands, and all his people, and we struck him down, so that no one was left of him.

Sentences_from: Dokąd ujdę przed duchem twoim? a dokąd przed obliczem twojem uciekę?
Sentences_to: Where could I go from your Spirit? Or where could I flee from your presence?
Translated_sentences: where can i go from your spirit? and where shall he flee from before you?

Sentences_from: Odpowiedział król, i rzekł: Zaiste wiem, że umyślnie odwłaczacie, bacząc, że mi ten sen z pamięci wyszedł.
Sentences_to: The king answered, I know of a certainty that you would gain time, because you see the thing is gone from me.
Translated_sentences: the king answered and said, indeed i know that you are deliberately delaying, seeing that this dream is gone out of my mind.

Sentences_from: Wielka jest chwała jego w zbawieniu twojem; chwałą i zacnością przyodziałeś go;
Sentences_to: For you make him most blessed forever. You make him glad with joy in your presence.
Translated_sentences: great is his glory in your salvation; you clothed him with glory and honor;

Sentences_from: Każda jednak rzecz poślubiona, którą by kto poślubił Panu ze wszystkiego, co ma z ludzi, i z bydła, i z ról osiadłości swojej, nie będzie sprzedawana, ani odkupowana; bo wszelka rzecz poślubiona najświętsza jest Panu.
Sentences_to: then I will walk contrary to you in wrath; and I also will chastise you seven times for your sins.
Translated_sentences: but every thing wedded to the lord, for all that he has of men, and of cattle, and of the roles of his inheritance, shall not be sold or redeemed; for every thing wedded to the lord is most holy.

Sentences_from: Będą zaiste wielbłądy ich podane na łup, a mnóstwo dobytku ich na korzyść; i rozproszę na wszystkie wiatry tych, którzy i w najostateczniejszych kątach mieszkają, i ze wszystkich stron złe na nich przywiodę, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their livestock a spoil: and I will scatter to all winds those who have the corners of their beards cut off; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, says Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: for their camels will be put up for prey, and their livelihoods for the benefit; and i will scatter into all the winds those who dwell in the most remotest places, and i will cause evil on them on all sides, saith the lord.

Sentences_from: A gdy przyszli posłowie, oto obraz na łożu, a wezgłówko z koziej skóry pod głowami jego.
Sentences_to: When the messengers came in, behold, the teraphim was in the bed, with the pillow of goats' hair at its head.
Translated_sentences: and when the messengers came, behold, there is a picture on the bed, with a headboard of goatskin under his head.

Sentences_from: Potem też Dawid wstał, i wyszedł z jaskini, a zawołał za Saulem, mówiąc: Królu, Panie mój! Tedy się obejrzał Saul nazad, a Dawid schyliwszy się twarzą ku ziemi, pokłonił się.
Sentences_to: David knew that Saul was devising mischief against him; and he said to Abiathar the priest, "Bring the ephod here."
Translated_sentences: then david also arose and went out of the cave, and cried out after saul, saying, king my lord! saul looked back, and david bowed his face to the ground and bowed down.

Sentences_from: A pamiętaj, żeś był niewolnikiem w ziemi Egipskiej, i wywiódł cię Pan, Bóg twój, stamtąd ręką możną, i ramieniem wyciągnionem; przetoż ci przykazał Pan, Bóg twój, abyś obchodził dzień sobotni.
Sentences_to: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.
Translated_sentences: and remember that you were a slave in the land of egypt, and the lord your god brought you out from there with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. therefore yahweh your god commanded you to keep a saturday day.

Sentences_from: Dla braci moich i dla przyjaciół moich teraz ci będę żądał pokoju.
Sentences_to: For my brothers' and companions' sakes, I will now say, "Peace be within you."
Translated_sentences: for my brothers and my friends, now i will ask you for peace.

Sentences_from: Jeźli też który z nich przychodzi, aby mię nawiedził, tedy na zdradzie mówi; serce jego zgromadza sobie nieprawość, a precz odszedłszy roznosi.
Sentences_to: All who hate me whisper together against me. They imagine the worst for me.
Translated_sentences: if any of them comes to visit me, then he speaks in treason; his heart gathers up iniquity for itself, and carries it away.

Sentences_from: I zstąpił Pan w obłoku, i stanął tam z nim, i zawołał imieniem Pan.
Sentences_to: Yahweh descended in the cloud, and stood with him there, and proclaimed the name of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and the lord descended in the cloud, and stood there with him, and called the name of the lord.

Sentences_from: Dziewiąty na Matanijasza, na synów jego i na braci jego dwanaście.
Sentences_to: the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve:
Translated_sentences: the ninth to mattaniah, his sons and his brothers, twelve.

Sentences_from: Aby otwierał oczy ślepych, a wywodził więźniów z ciemnicy, i z domu więzienia siedzących w ciemnościach.
Sentences_to: to open the blind eyes, to bring the prisoners out of the dungeon, and those who sit in darkness out of the prison.
Translated_sentences: that he would open the eyes of the blind, and lead the prisoners out of the dark and out of the prison house.

Sentences_from: Jako żyję Ja, mówi panujący Pan, że ręką możną i ramieniem wyciągnionem, a w popędliwości wylanej będę królował nad wami;
Sentences_to: As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, surely with a mighty hand, and with an outstretched arm, and with wrath poured out, will I be king over you:
Translated_sentences: as i live, saith the lord god, with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm, and in pouring out fury i will reign over you;

Sentences_from: A wszakże, jeźli się upodoba duszy twojej, zabijesz sobie, i będziesz jadł mięso według błogosławieństwa Pana, Boga twego, które da tobie we wszystkich bramach twoich; nieczysty i czysty jeść je będzie, jako sarnę albo jelenia.
Sentences_to: Notwithstanding, you may kill and eat flesh within all your gates, after all the desire of your soul, according to the blessing of Yahweh your God which he has given you: the unclean and the clean may eat of it, as of the gazelle, and as of the hart.
Translated_sentences: but if it pleases your soul, you will kill yourself and eat meat, according to the blessing of the lord your god, which he will give you in all your gates. the unclean and clean shall eat them as a deer or a deer.

Sentences_from: A zabije baranka na ofiarę za występek: a wziąwszy kapłan ze krwi ofiary za występek, pomaże koniec ucha prawego temu, który się oczyszcza; i palec wielki prawej ręki jego, i palec wielki prawej nogi jego.
Sentences_to: then the priest shall examine it; and behold, if the hair in the bright spot has turned white, and its appearance is deeper than the skin; it is leprosy. It has broken out in the burning, and the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is the plague of leprosy.
Translated_sentences: and he shall slaughter the lamb for a trespass offering: and the priest taking of the blood of the trespass offering, he shall anoint the end of the right ear to him who is to be cleansed; and the great finger of his right hand, and the great toe of his right foot.

Sentences_from: Z synów Józefowych, a naprzód z synów Efraimowych, rodzajów ich według familii ich, według domów ojców ich, według liczby imion, od dwudziestu lat i wyżej, wszystkich wychodzących na wojnę;
Sentences_to: Of the children of Joseph, of the children of Ephraim, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;
Translated_sentences: of the sons of joseph, and first of the sons of ephraim, their families, according to their families, according to the houses of their fathers, according to the number of names, from twenty years old and upward, all who go out to war;

Sentences_from: Synów Gazama, synów Uzy, synów Faseacha.
Sentences_to: the children of Gazzam, the children of Uzza, the children of Paseah.
Translated_sentences: the sons of gazam, the sons of uzha, the sons of phaseah.

Sentences_from: Kapanie ustawiczne w dzień gwałtownego deszczu, i żona swarliwa są sobie podobni;
Sentences_to: A continual dropping on a rainy day and a contentious wife are alike:
Translated_sentences: the continual dripping on a day of heavy rain, and a quarrelsome wife are alike;

Sentences_from: Synom Merarego według domów ich dostało się w pokoleniu Rubenowem, i w pokoleniu Gadowem, i w pokoleniu Zabulonowem losem miast dwanaście.
Sentences_to: Their brothers the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of God's house.
Translated_sentences: according to their families, the sons of merari belonged to the tribe of reuben, and to the tribe of gadov, and to the tribe of zebulun, twelve cities.

Sentences_from: I będziecie wołać dnia onego dla króla waszego, którego sobie obierzecie, a nie wysłucha was Pan dnia onego.
Sentences_to: You shall cry out in that day because of your king whom you shall have chosen you; and Yahweh will not answer you in that day."
Translated_sentences: in that day you will cry out for your king whom you choose for yourselves, and the lord will not hear you in that day.

Sentences_from: I kiedyż będzie koniec tym próżnym słowom? albo co cię przymusza, że tak odpowiadasz?
Sentences_to: Shall vain words have an end? Or what provokes you that you answer?
Translated_sentences: and when will these vain words end? or what forces you to answer like that?

Sentences_from: I rzekł Samuel do Saula: Posłał mię Pan, abym cię pomazał za króla nad ludem jego Izraelskim, przetoż teraz posłuchaj głosu słów Pańskich.
Sentences_to: Samuel said to Saul, "Yahweh sent me to anoint you to be king over his people, over Israel. Now therefore listen to the voice of the words of Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and samuel said to saul, the lord has sent me to anoint you to be king over his people israel; now hear the voice of the lord.

Sentences_from: Nogi ich bieżą do złego, i kwapią się na wylanie krwi niewinnej. Myśli ich są myśli nieprawości; spustoszenie i starcie jest na drogach ich.
Sentences_to: Their feet run to evil, and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; desolation and destruction are in their paths.
Translated_sentences: their feet run to evil, and they hasten to shed innocent blood. their thoughts are the thoughts of iniquity; desolation and clash are in their paths.

Sentences_from: Nad to jeszcze urodziła syna, i nazwała imię jego Sela; a Judas był w Chezybie, gdy mu urodziła.
Sentences_to: She yet again bore a son, and named him Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bore him.
Translated_sentences: moreover, she bore a son, and named him selah; and judas was in hezizah when she gave birth to him.

Sentences_from: A po wyjściu dwudziestu lat, w których budował Salomon dom Pański i dom swój,
Sentences_to: It happened at the end of twenty years, in which Solomon had built the house of Yahweh, and his own house,
Translated_sentences: and after he had gone out twenty years, in which solomon built the house of the lord and his house,

Sentences_from: Świadczyć też będzie hardość Izraelska przeciwko niemu; przetoż Izrael i Efraim upadną dla nieprawości swojej, upadnie też i Juda z nimi.
Sentences_to: You will stumble in the day, and the prophet will also stumble with you in the night; and I will destroy your mother.
Translated_sentences: israel's hardness against him will also testify; therefore israel and ephraim will fall because of their iniquity, and judah will also fall with them.

Sentences_from: A ostatek ludu, który był został w mieście, i zbiegi, którzy byli zbiegli do króla Babilońskiego, i inne pospólstwo, przeniósł Nabuzardan, hetman żołnierski.
Sentences_to: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried away captive the residue of the people who were left in the city, and those who fell away, who fell to the king of Babylon, and the residue of the multitude.
Translated_sentences: and the remnant of the people that remained in the city, and the refugees who had fled to the king of babylon, and the rest of the crowd, nebuzaradan the captain of the soldier carried away.

Sentences_from: A oni się byli nań zasadzili w komorze, i rzekła mu: Filistynowie nad tobą, Samsonie; ale on zerwał wici, jakoby kto zerwał nić zgrzebną, ogniem napaloną; i nie poznano, w czem była moc jego.
Sentences_to: Now she had an ambush waiting in the inner room. She said to him, "The Philistines are on you, Samson!" He broke the cords, as a string of tow is broken when it touches the fire. So his strength was not known.
Translated_sentences: and they sat on him in a chamber, and said to him, the philistines are over you, samson; but he broke the sails, as if a man tore a thread of coarse, fired with fire; and it was not known what his strength was.

Sentences_from: Przetoż mów do domu Izraelskiego: Tak mówi panujący Pan: Nie dla was Ja to czynię, o domie Izraelski! ale dla imienia świętobliwości mojej, któreście splugawili między narodami, do którycheście przyszli;
Sentences_to: Therefore tell the house of Israel, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: I don't do [this] for your sake, house of Israel, but for my holy name, which you have profaned among the nations, where you went.
Translated_sentences: therefore say to the house of israel, thus says the lord yahweh: it is not for you that i do this, house of israel. but for my holy name, which you have defiled among the peoples to which you have come;

Sentences_from: Tedy przepuścił Pan powietrze morowe na Izraela. I poległo z Izraela siedmdziesiąt tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: So Yahweh sent a pestilence on Israel; and seventy thousand men of Israel fell.
Translated_sentences: then yahweh gave a pestilential air over israel. and seventy thousand men died of israel.

Sentences_from: I poznaliby grzech, którym zgrzeszyli, ofiarować będzie ono zgromadzenie cielca młodego na ofiarę za grzech, a przywiodą go przed namiot zgromadzenia,
Sentences_to: when the sin in which they have sinned is known, then the assembly shall offer a young bull for a sin offering, and bring it before the Tent of Meeting.
Translated_sentences: and they would know the sin with which they have sinned, and they will offer the congregation of the young calf as a sin offering, and they will bring him to the tabernacle of the congregation.

Sentences_from: Miłując te, którzy cię mają w nienawiści, a nienawidząc tych, którzy cię miłują. Albowiem pokazałeś dziś, że sobie nie poważasz hetmanów, i sług twoich; bom doznał tego dziś, że gdyby Absalom był żyw, choćbyśmy my wszyscy dziś byli pobici, tedyć by się to bardzo podobało.
Sentences_to: Now therefore arise, go out, and speak to comfort your servants; for I swear by Yahweh, if you don't go out, not a man will stay with you this night. That would be worse to you than all the evil that has happened to you from your youth until now."
Translated_sentences: by loving those who hate you, and hating those who love you. for today you have shown that you do not respect your rulers and your servants; for i experienced this today, that if absalom had been alive, though all of us were beaten today, it would have been very pleased.

Sentences_from: Obaczcież, rozdzieliłem wam losem te narody pozostałe w dziedzictwo między pokolenia wasze od Jordanu, i wszystkie narody, którem wytracił, aż do morza wielkiego na zachód słońca.
Sentences_to: Behold, I have allotted to you these nations that remain, to be an inheritance for your tribes, from the Jordan, with all the nations that I have cut off, even to the great sea toward the going down of the sun.
Translated_sentences: behold, i have divided by lot these nations which remain for an inheritance among your tribes from jordan, and all the nations which i have destroyed, even to the great sea at sunset.

Sentences_from: A gdy będą mieli wchodzić do bramy sieni wewnętrznej, tedy się obleką w szaty lniane, a nie wezmą na się nic wełnianego, gdy służyć będą w bramach sieni wnętrznej, i wewnątrz.
Sentences_to: It shall be that, when they enter in at the gates of the inner court, they shall be clothed with linen garments; and no wool shall come on them, while they minister in the gates of the inner court, and within.
Translated_sentences: and when they are about to enter the gate of the inner court, they shall put on linen garments, and take nothing of wool to serve in the gates of the inner court and inside.

Sentences_from: Albo posłałlibym mór na tę ziemię, i wylałbym popędliwość swoję na nią ku wytraceniu, aby z niej ludzie i zwierzęta byli wytraceni.
Sentences_to: Or if I send a pestilence into that land, and pour out my wrath on it in blood, to cut off from it man and animal;
Translated_sentences: or i would send a plague upon the earth, and pour out my wrath upon it for destruction, that from it men and animals might be cut off.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, który mówił usty swemi do Dawida, ojca mego, i skutecznie to wypełnił, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: He said, "Blessed is Yahweh, the God of Israel, who spoke with his mouth to David your father, and has with his hand fulfilled it, saying,
Translated_sentences: and he said, blessed be the lord, the god of israel, who spoke with his mouth to david my father, and he fulfilled it effectively, saying,

Sentences_from: Ani na bogów ojców swych nie będzie dbał, ani o miłość niewiast, ani o żadnego boga dbać będzie, przeto, że się nade wszystko wyniesie.
Sentences_to: Neither shall he regard the gods of his fathers, nor the desire of women, nor regard any god; for he shall magnify himself above all.
Translated_sentences: he will not care for the gods of his fathers, nor for the love of women, nor for any god, because he will exalt himself above all else.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Mojżesz do niego: Gdy wynijdę z miasta, wyciągnę ręce swe do Pana, a gromy ustaną, i grad nie będzie więcej, abyś wiedział, że Pańska jest ziemia;
Sentences_to: Moses said to him, "As soon as I have gone out of the city, I will spread abroad my hands to Yahweh. The thunders shall cease, neither shall there be any more hail; that you may know that the earth is Yahweh's.
Translated_sentences: and moses said to him, when i go out of the city, i will stretch out my hands to the lord, and the thunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, that thou mayest know that the earth is yahweh;

Sentences_from: I zstąpił Pan w obłoku, i mówił do niego, a wziąwszy z Ducha, który był w nim, podzielił go między siedemdziesiąt mężów starszych; i stało się, gdy odpoczął nad nimi on Duch, tedy prorokowali, a potem nigdy.
Sentences_to: Yahweh came down in the cloud, and spoke to him, and took of the Spirit that was on him, and put it on the seventy elders: and it happened that when the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied, but they did so no more.
Translated_sentences: and the lord descended in the cloud, and spoke to him, and taking of the spirit that was in him, divided him among the seventy elders; and it happened when the spirit rested on them, that they prophesied, and then never.

Sentences_from: On wysyła słowo swe na ziemię; bardzo prędko bieży wyrok jego.
Sentences_to: He sends out his commandment to the earth. His word runs very swiftly.
Translated_sentences: he sends his word to the earth; his sentence is very quick.

Sentences_from: A czyniący miłosierdzie nad tysiącami tych, którzy mię miłują, i strzegą przykazaó moich.
Sentences_to: and showing loving kindness to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.
Translated_sentences: and showing mercy to thousands of those who love me and keep my commandments.

Sentences_from: Ręce swoje obraca do kądzieli, a palcami swemi trzyma wrzeciono.
Sentences_to: She lays her hands to the distaff, and her hands hold the spindle.
Translated_sentences: she turns her hands to the distaff, and with her fingers she holds the spindle.

Sentences_from: Bo pamiętam na sądy twoje wieczne, Panie! któremi się cieszę.
Sentences_to: I remember your ordinances of old, Yahweh, and have comforted myself.
Translated_sentences: for i remember your judgments forever, lord! i am happy.

Sentences_from: I obróci się w proch po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej, i będzie na ludziach, i na bydle wrzodem czyniącym pryszczele, po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej.
Sentences_to: It shall become small dust over all the land of Egypt, and shall be a boil breaking out with boils on man and on animal, throughout all the land of Egypt."
Translated_sentences: and it shall turn to dust in all the land of egypt, and it shall be on men and on cattle as a blistering ulcer throughout all the land of egypt.

Sentences_from: Ja też wam to uczynię: nawiedzę was strachem, suchotami i gorączką, które wam oczy popsują a boleścią napełnią dusze wasze, a siać będziecie próżno nasienie wasze, bo je zjedzą nieprzyjaciele wasi;
Sentences_to: According to the length of the years you shall increase its price, and according to the shortness of the years you shall diminish its price; for he is selling the number of the crops to you.
Translated_sentences: i will also do this to you: i will visit you with fear, consumption and fever, which will spoil your eyes and fill your souls with pain, and you will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will eat them;

Sentences_from: Gdy on sprawi pokój, któż go wzruszy? także, gdy skryje oblicze, któż go ujrzy? A to czyni tak całemu narodowi, jako każdemu człowiekowi,
Sentences_to: When he gives quietness, who then can condemn? When he hides his face, who then can see him? Alike whether to a nation, or to a man,
Translated_sentences: when he makes peace, who will touch him? and when he hides his face, who will see him? and this is what he does to the whole nation, as to every human being,

Sentences_from: I pytał się Dawid Pana, który odpowiedział: Nie pójdziesz przeciwko nim; ale je obtoczywszy z tyłu natrzesz na nie przeciwko morwom.
Sentences_to: When David inquired of Yahweh, he said, "You shall not go up. Circle around behind them, and attack them over against the mulberry trees.
Translated_sentences: and david asked the lord, and he said, thou shalt not go against them; but trim them behind you and meet them against the mulberries.

Sentences_from: I hamował Kaleb lud szemrzący przeciw Mojżeszowi, i mówił: Pójdźmy a posiądźmy ziemię, bo ją pewnie sobie podbijemy.
Sentences_to: Caleb stilled the people before Moses, and said, "Let us go up at once, and possess it; for we are well able to overcome it."
Translated_sentences: and caleb restrained the people who were murmuring against moses, and said, let us go and possess the land, for we will surely conquer it.

Sentences_from: I opuściwszy wszystkie rozkazania Pana, Boga swego, poczynili sobie lane bałwany, mianowicie dwóch cielców; poczynili też gaje, a kłaniali się wszystkiemu wojsku niebieskiemu, i służyli Baalowi.
Sentences_to: Urijah the priest did so, according to all that king Ahaz commanded.
Translated_sentences: and having abandoned all the commandments of the lord their god, they made for themselves idols, two calves; and they made groves, and worshiped all the army of heaven, and served baal.

Sentences_from: Pytaliśmy tedy starszych onych męwiąc do nich: Któż wam rozkazał ten dom budować, i te muru z gruntu wywodzić?
Sentences_to: Then we asked those elders, and said to them thus, "Who gave you a decree to build this house, and to finish this wall?"
Translated_sentences: so we asked the elders of the same, saying to them, who commanded you to build this house, and to bring out the walls from the ground?

Sentences_from: Wyższe są niż niebiosa, cóż uczynisz? Głębsze niż piekło, jakoż poznasz?
Sentences_to: They are high as heaven. What can you do? They are deeper than Sheol . What can you know?
Translated_sentences: they are higher than the heavens, what will you do? deeper than hell, how will you know?

Sentences_from: Oto Pana, Boga twego, są niebiosa, i niebiosa niebios, ziemia i wszystko co na niej.
Sentences_to: Behold, to Yahweh your God belongs heaven and the heaven of heavens, the earth, with all that is therein.
Translated_sentences: behold, the lord your god is the heavens and the heavens, the heavens, the earth and all that is in it.

Sentences_from: Strzeżże, synu mój! przykazania ojca twego, a nie opuszczaj nauki matki twojej.
Sentences_to: My son, keep your father's commandment, and don't forsake your mother's teaching.
Translated_sentences: my son, beware! your father's commandments, and do not forsake your mother's teaching.

Sentences_from: A choć początek twój mały będzie, jednak ostatek twój bardzo się rozmnoży.
Sentences_to: Though your beginning was small, yet your latter end would greatly increase.
Translated_sentences: and although your beginning will be small, your remnant will be greatly multiplied.

Sentences_from: I będzie ofiarował z niego jeden chleb z każdej ofiary na podnoszenie Panu. Kapłanowi, który kropi krwią ofiar spokojnych, należeć to będzie.
Sentences_to: "'This is the law of the meal offering: the sons of Aaron shall offer it before Yahweh, before the altar.
Translated_sentences: and he will offer one bread from each offering to be lifted up to the lord. it will be up to the priest who sprinkles the blood of peaceful sacrifices.

Sentences_from: Bodaj się były zaćmiły gwiazdy przy zmierzkaniu jej! a czekając światła, aby się go była nie doczekała, ani nie oglądała zorzy porannej!
Sentences_to: Let the stars of its twilight be dark. Let it look for light, but have none, neither let it see the eyelids of the morning,
Translated_sentences: may the stars be dimmed as they measured her! and waiting for the light to be there, nor to see the morning light!

Sentences_from: I uczynili synowie Lewiego według słowa Mojżeszowego; i poległo z ludu dnia onego około trzech tysięcy mężów.
Sentences_to: The sons of Levi did according to the word of Moses: and there fell of the people that day about three thousand men.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of levi did according to the word of moses; and about three thousand men of the people that day died.

Sentences_from: Bracią także twoję, pokolenie Lewiego, ród ojca twego, przypuścisz do siebie, aby byli przy tobie, i posługowali tobie; a ty i synowie twoi z tobą służyć będziecie przed namiotem świadectwa.
Sentences_to: Your brothers also, the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, bring near with you, that they may be joined to you, and minister to you: but you and your sons with you shall be before the tent of the testimony.
Translated_sentences: your brethren also, the tribe of levi, the lineage of your father, you shall bring to yourselves, that they may be with you, and minister to you; and you and your sons will serve you in front of the tent of testimony.

Sentences_from: A tak chwaliłem wesele, przeto, iż niemasz nic lepszego człowiekowi pod słońcem, jedno jeść, i pić, i weselić się, a iż mu jedno to zostaje z pracy jego po wszystkie dni żywota jego, które mu Bóg dał pod słońcem.
Sentences_to: Then I commended mirth, because a man has no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be joyful: for that will accompany him in his labor all the days of his life which God has given him under the sun.
Translated_sentences: and so i praised the joy, because there is nothing better for a man under the sun, one to eat and drink and be glad, and that he remains one for his work all the days of his life, which god gave him under the sun.

Sentences_from: A z Absalomem poszło było dwieście mężów z Jeruzalemu zaproszonych, którzy szli w prostości swojej, niewiedząc o niczem.
Sentences_to: Two hundred men went with Absalom out of Jerusalem, who were invited, and went in their simplicity; and they didn't know anything.
Translated_sentences: and with absalom there were two hundred invited men from jerusalem, walking in their straightness, knowing nothing.

Sentences_from: Bo tak mówi Pan: Oto Ja puszczę na cię strach, na cię i na wszystkich przyjaciół twoich, którzy upadną od miecza nieprzyjaciół swych, na co oczy twoje patrzyć będą; a wszystkiego Judę podam w ręce króla Babilońskiego, który ich zaprowadzi do Babil onu, i pozabija ich mieczem.
Sentences_to: For thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will make you a terror to yourself, and to all your friends; and they shall fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes shall see it; and I will give all Judah into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall carry them captive to Babylon, and shall kill them with the sword.
Translated_sentences: for thus says the lord: behold, i will send fear upon you, upon you, and upon all your friends who will fall by the sword of their enemies, and your eyes will see them; and i will put all judah into the hands of the king of babylon, who will lead them to babylon and slay them with the sword.

Sentences_from: A wyrzuciwszy bałwany z domu Baalowego, popalili je.
Sentences_to: They brought out the pillars that were in the house of Baal, and burned them.
Translated_sentences: and they threw the idols out of the house of baal, and burned them.

Sentences_from: Ale Pan jest Bóg prawy, jest Bóg żywy, i król wieczny; przed jego zapalczywością ziemia drży, a narody nie mogą znieść rozgniewania jego.
Sentences_to: But Yahweh is the true God; he is the living God, and an everlasting King: at his wrath the earth trembles, and the nations are not able to withstand his indignation.
Translated_sentences: but the lord is a righteous god, there is a living god and an everlasting king; before his fury the earth trembles, and the nations cannot bear his anger.

Sentences_from: Tedy kazał przyjść Isaj siedmiu synom swoim przed Samuela. I rzekł Samuel do Isajego: Nie obrał Pan i tych.
Sentences_to: Jesse made seven of his sons to pass before Samuel. Samuel said to Jesse, "Yahweh has not chosen these."
Translated_sentences: and jesse commanded his seven sons to come before samuel. and samuel said to jesse, the lord hath not chosen them either.

Sentences_from: Naliczono ich z pokolenia Judowego siedemdziesiąt i cztery tysiące i sześć set.
Sentences_to: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Judah, were sixty-four thousand six hundred.
Translated_sentences: they were numbered seventy-four thousand and six hundred of the tribe of judah.

Sentences_from: Bo im on los rzucił, a ręka jego onę im sznurem rozmierzyła; aż na wieki dziedzicznie ją posiądą, od narodu do narodu mieszkać w niej będą.
Sentences_to: He has cast the lot for them, and his hand has divided it to them with a measuring line. They shall possess it forever. From generation to generation they will dwell in it.
Translated_sentences: for he cast lots to them, and his hand measured them with a rope; till they inherit it for ever, they will live in it from nation to nation.

Sentences_from: Synów Azgadowych tysiąc dwieście dwadzieścia i dwa.
Sentences_to: The children of Azgad, one thousand two hundred twenty-two.
Translated_sentences: the children of azgad, one thousand two hundred twenty-two.

Sentences_from: Szedł tedy Dawid, sam i one sześć set mężów, które miał z sobą, a przyszli aż do potoku Besor; a niektórzy pozostali.
Sentences_to: Achish answered David, "I know that you are good in my sight, as an angel of God. Notwithstanding the princes of the Philistines have said, 'He shall not go up with us to the battle.'
Translated_sentences: so david went along with him and the six hundred men he had with him, and they came to the brook besor; and some others.

Sentences_from: Wtemem ocucił i spojrzałem, a sen mój był mi wdzięczny.
Sentences_to: On this I awakened, and saw; and my sleep was sweet to me.
Translated_sentences: then he woke up and i looked, and my dream was grateful to me.

Sentences_from: Roku dziewiątego Sedekijasza, króla Judzkiego, miesiąca dziesiątego, przyciągnął Nabuchodonozor, król Babiloński, ze wszystkiem wojskiem swojem do Jeruzalemu, i oblegli je.
Sentences_to: It happened when Jerusalem was taken, (in the ninth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, in the tenth month, came Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon and all his army against Jerusalem, and besieged it;
Translated_sentences: in the ninth year of zedekiah king of judah in the tenth month, nebuchadnezzar king of babylon came with all his army to jerusalem, and they besieged it.

Sentences_from: I posłał Farao, a oto, nie zdechło z bydła Izraelskiego i jedno; ale ociężało serce Faraonowe, i nie wypuścił ludu.
Sentences_to: Pharaoh sent, and, behold, there was not so much as one of the livestock of the Israelites dead. But the heart of Pharaoh was stubborn, and he didn't let the people go.
Translated_sentences: and pharaoh sent, and, behold, one of the cattle of israel did not die, and one thing; but pharaoh's heart was heavy, and he did not let the people go.

Sentences_from: Izali zatrzymał w gniewie litości swoje? Sela.
Sentences_to: Then I thought, "I will appeal to this: the years of the right hand of the Most High."
Translated_sentences: has he kept his pity in anger? sela.

Sentences_from: Tedy odpowiedzą: Przeto, iż opuścili Pana, Boga swego, który wywiódł ojce ich z ziemi Egipskiej, a chwycili się bogów cudzych, i kłaniali się im, a służyli im: dla tegoż przywiódł Pan na nie to wszystko złe.
Sentences_to: and they shall answer, 'Because they forsook Yahweh their God, who brought their fathers out of the land of Egypt, and laid hold of other gods, and worshiped them, and served them. Therefore Yahweh has brought all this evil on them.'"
Translated_sentences: then they shall answer, because they forsook the lord their god, who brought their fathers out of the land of egypt, and took hold of other gods, and worshiped them, and served them: therefore the lord hath brought all these evil upon them.

Sentences_from: Podam ich, mówię, na utrapienie, i na ucisk po wszystkich królestwach ziemi, na pohaóbienie i na przypowieść, na przysłowie i na przeklęstwo po wszystkich miejscach, do których ich zapędzę;
Sentences_to: I will even give them up to be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth for evil; to be a reproach and a proverb, a taunt and a curse, in all places where I shall drive them.
Translated_sentences: i will give them, i say, affliction and tribulation in all the kingdoms of the earth, and reproach and parable, proverb and curse in all the places where i will drive them;

Sentences_from: Którzy myślą złe rzeczy w sercu, a na każdy dzień zbierają się na wojnę.
Sentences_to: They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent. Viper's poison is under their lips. Selah.
Translated_sentences: who think bad things in their hearts, and each day gather for war.

Sentences_from: Dosycieście już krążyli około tej góry, obróćcież się ku północy;
Sentences_to: "You have encircled this mountain long enough. Turn northward.
Translated_sentences: you have already circled around this mountain, turn to the north;

Sentences_from: Była granica ich od Machanaim wszystko Basan i wszystko królestwo Oga, króla Basańskiego, i wszystkie wsi Jairowe, które są w Basan, sześćdziesiąt miast.
Sentences_to: Their border was from Mahanaim, all Bashan, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair, which are in Bashan, sixty cities.
