Translated_sentences: their boundary was from mahanaim, all bashan, and all the kingdom of og king of bashan, and all the villages of jairus, which are in bashan, sixty cities.

Sentences_from: A sam tylko Mojżesz wstąpi do Pana; ale oni nie przybliżą się ani lud wstąpi z nim.
Sentences_to: Moses alone shall come near to Yahweh, but they shall not come near, neither shall the people go up with him."
Translated_sentences: and moses alone will ascend to the lord; but they will not come near, nor the people will go up with him.

Sentences_from: I mówił Abram: Otoś mi nie dał potomka, ale oto sługa domu mego dziedzicem moim będzie.
Sentences_to: Abram said, "Behold, to me you have given no seed: and, behold, one born in my house is my heir."
Translated_sentences: and abram said, behold, thou hast given me no offspring, but behold, the servant of my house shall be my heir.

Sentences_from: Tedy niebiosa opowiedzą sprawiedliwość jego; albowiem sam Bóg jest sędzią. Sela.
Sentences_to: The heavens shall declare his righteousness, for God himself is judge. Selah.
Translated_sentences: then the heavens will declare his righteousness; for god himself is the judge. sela.

Sentences_from: A gdy przyszli do gumna Nachonowego, ściągnął Oza rękę swoję ku skrzyni Bożej, i zadzierżał ją: bo woły były wystąpiły z drogi:
Sentences_to: When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached for the ark of God, and took hold of it; for the cattle stumbled.
Translated_sentences: and when they came to nakhon's barn, oz drew his hand toward the ark of god, and plucked it: for the oxen were out of the way:

Sentences_from: A rozmnożę nasienie twoje jako proch ziemi; bo jeźli kto będzie mógł zliczyć proch ziemi, tedy i nasienie twoje zliczone będzie.
Sentences_to: I will make your offspring as the dust of the earth, so that if a man can number the dust of the earth, then your seed may also be numbered.
Translated_sentences: and i will multiply your seed as the dust of the earth; for if anyone can count the dust of the earth, then also your seed will be counted.

Sentences_from: I czarnoksiężnik, i ten, który ma sprawę z duchy złymi, i praktykarz, i wywiadujący się czego od umarłych.
Sentences_to: according to the tenor of the law which they shall teach you, and according to the judgment which they shall tell you, you shall do; you shall not turn aside from the sentence which they shall show you, to the right hand, nor to the left.
Translated_sentences: and a sorcerer, and one who deals with evil spirits, and a practitioner, and inquiring from the dead.

Sentences_from: Gdzież jest król Elmat, i król Arfad, i król miasta Sefarwaim, Ana, i Awa?
Sentences_to: Where is the king of Hamath, and the king of Arpad, and the king of the city of Sepharvaim, of Hena, and Ivvah?'"
Translated_sentences: where is king elmat, and king of arphad, and the king of the city of sepharvaim ana and awa?

Sentences_from: Nie będziesz pożądał domu bliźniego twego, ani będziesz pożądał żony bliźniego twego, ani sługi jego, ani dziewki jego, ani wołu jego, ani osła jego, ani żadnej rzeczy bliźniego twego.
Sentences_to: "You shall not covet your neighbor's house. You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's."
Translated_sentences: thou shalt not covet thy neighbour's house, neither thou shalt covet thy neighbor's wife, nor his manservant, nor his maid, nor his ox, nor his ass, nor any thing that is thy neighbour's.

Sentences_from: A synowie Korego: Asyr, i Elkana, i Abyjazaf. Teć są domy Korytów.
Sentences_to: The sons of Korah: Assir, and Elkanah, and Abiasaph; these are the families of the Korahites.
Translated_sentences: and the sons of kore: assyr, and elkanah, and abyjazaph. these are the houses of korytów.

Sentences_from: A powiedziałem wam: Jam Pan, Bóg wasz, nie bójcież się bogów Amorejskich, w których ziemi wy mieszkacie; aleście nie usłuchali głosu mego.
Sentences_to: and I said to you, "I am Yahweh your God; you shall not fear the gods of the Amorites, in whose land you dwell." But you have not listened to my voice.'"
Translated_sentences: and i said to you, i am the lord your god. do not be afraid of the amorite gods, in whose land you live; but you did not listen to my voice.

Sentences_from: Że, widząc synowie Boży córki ludzkie, iż były piękne, brali je sobie za żony, ze wszystkich, które sobie upodobali.
Sentences_to: that God's sons saw that men's daughters were beautiful, and they took for themselves wives of all that they chose.
Translated_sentences: that when the sons of god saw the daughters of men, that they were beautiful, they took them for themselves wives of all whom they pleased.

Sentences_from: A wziąwszy je, przeprawił je przez tęż rzekę, i przeprowadził wszystko, co miał.
Sentences_to: Jacob was left alone, and wrestled with a man there until the breaking of the day.
Translated_sentences: and he took them, and crossed the river, and carried away all that he had.

Sentences_from: Będę wysławiał Pana ze wszystkiego serca mego; opowiadać będę wszysteki cuda twoje.
Sentences_to: I will be glad and rejoice in you. I will sing praise to your name, O Most High.
Translated_sentences: i will praise the lord with all my heart; i will recount all your wonders.

Sentences_from: Śpiewajcie Bogu, śpiewajcie psalmy imieniowi jego; gotujcie drogę temu, który jeździ na obłokach. Pan jest imię jego, radujcież się przed obliczem jego.
Sentences_to: A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows, is God in his holy habitation.
Translated_sentences: sing to god, sing psalms to his name; prepare a way for him who rides on the clouds. the lord is his name, rejoice in his presence.

Sentences_from: Tedy się modlił Izaak Panu za żonę swą, iż była niepłodna; i wysłuchał go Pan, i poczęła Rebeka, żona jego.
Sentences_to: Isaac entreated Yahweh for his wife, because she was barren. Yahweh was entreated by him, and Rebekah his wife conceived.
Translated_sentences: and isaac prayed to the lord for his wife, that she was barren; and the lord heard him, and rebekah his wife conceived.

Sentences_from: Pan wszystko za mię wykona. O Panie! miłosierdzie twoje trwa na wieki; sprawy rąk twoich nie opuścisz.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me; your loving kindness, Yahweh, endures forever. Don't forsake the works of your own hands.
Translated_sentences: the lord will do everything for me. oh lord! your mercy endures forever; thou shalt not forsake the work of thy hands.

Sentences_from: Tedy wezwawszy Laban wszystkich mężów miejsca onego, sprawił ucztę.
Sentences_to: Laban gathered together all the men of the place, and made a feast.
Translated_sentences: and laban summoned all the men of that place, and made a feast.

Sentences_from: Wstańże, a młóć, córko Syoóska! bo róg twój uczynię żelazny, a kopyta twoje uczynię miedziane, i pokruszysz wiele narodów; i poświęcę Panu korzyści ich, a majętności ich Panu wszystkiej ziemi.
Sentences_to: Arise and thresh, daughter of Zion; for I will make your horn iron, and I will make your hoofs brass; and you will beat in pieces many peoples: and I will devote their gain to Yahweh, and their substance to the Lord of the whole earth.
Translated_sentences: arise, and thresh, daughter of son! for i will make your horn iron, and i will make your hooves of copper, and you will break up many nations; and i will consecrate their interests to the lord, and their goods to the lord of all the earth.

Sentences_from: A w każdem mieście złożył tarcze i włócznie, a opatrzył je bardzo mocno: a tak panował nad Judą i Benjaminem.
Sentences_to: He put shields and spears in every city, and made them exceeding strong. Judah and Benjamin belonged to him.
Translated_sentences: and in every city he put shields and spears together, and banded them very tightly: and he reigned over judah and benjamin.

Sentences_from: Uczynisz też deski do przybytku, dwadzieścia desek ku stronie południowej, ku wiatrowi południowemu.
Sentences_to: You shall make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side southward.
Translated_sentences: and thou shalt make the boards for the tabernacle, twenty boards for the south side, due to the south wind.

Sentences_from: Synów Pachat Moabowych, synów Jesui Joabowych dwa tysiące ośm set i dwanaście;
Sentences_to: The children of Pahathmoab, of the children of Jeshua and Joab, two thousand eight hundred twelve.
Translated_sentences: the children of pachat moab, the children of jeshua joab, two thousand eight hundred and twelve.

Sentences_from: Na czem są podstawki jej ugruntowane? albo kto założył kamień jej węgielny?
Sentences_to: Whereupon were its foundations fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,
Translated_sentences: on what are its bases grounded? or who laid its cornerstone?

Sentences_from: Dla proroków skruszyło się serce moje we mnie, poruszyły się wszystkie kości moje, stałem się jako człowiek pijany, a jako mąż, po którym się rozeszło wino, dla Pana i dla słów świętobliwości jego.
Sentences_to: Concerning the prophets. My heart within me is broken, all my bones shake; I am like a drunken man, and like a man whom wine has overcome, because of Yahweh, and because of his holy words.
Translated_sentences: for the prophets my heart in me is crushed, all my bones are moved; i am a drunkard man, and as a man to whom the wine was spattered, for the sake of the lord and for his holy words.

Sentences_from: Stawają się jako plewa przed wiatrem, i jako perz, który wicher porywa.
Sentences_to: How often is it that they are as stubble before the wind, as chaff that the storm carries away?
Translated_sentences: they appear as chaff before the wind, and as couch grass that the wind carries away.

Sentences_from: Każdego, który się nazywa imieniem mojem, i któregom ku chwale swojej stworzył, któregom ukształtował, i któregom uczynił.
Sentences_to: everyone who is called by my name, and whom I have created for my glory, whom I have formed, yes, whom I have made.'"
Translated_sentences: everyone who is called by my name, whom i have created for my glory, and whom i fashioned and made.

Sentences_from: Roku czwartego króla Ezechyjasza, (który był rok siódmy Ozeasza, syna Eli, króla Izraelskiego) wyciągnął Salmanaser, król Assyryjski, przeciwko Samaryi, i obległ ją.
Sentences_to: The children of Israel did secretly things that were not right against Yahweh their God: and they built them high places in all their cities, from the tower of the watchmen to the fortified city;
Translated_sentences: in the fourth year of king hezekiah (which was the seventh year of hosea the son of elah king of israel) king of assyria shalmanaser against samaria and besieged it.

Sentences_from: Owce i woły wszystkie, nadto i zwierzęta polne.
Sentences_to: The birds of the sky, the fish of the sea, and whatever passes through the paths of the seas.
Translated_sentences: all sheep and cattle, and the animals of the field.

Sentences_from: Teć są dziedzictwa, które losem podzielili w osiadłość Eleazar kapłan, i Jozue, syn Nunów, i przedniejsi z ojców pokolenia synów Izraelskich w Sylo przed Panem, u drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia, i dokończyli podziału ziemi.
Sentences_to: These are the inheritances, which Eleazar the priest, Joshua the son of Nun, and the heads of the fathers' houses of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed for inheritance by lot in Shiloh before Yahweh, at the door of the Tent of Meeting. So they made an end of dividing the land.
Translated_sentences: these are the inheritances which eleazar the priest, and joshua the son of nun, and the heads of the fathers of the tribe of the children of israel, in shiloh before the lord, at the door of the tabernacle of congregation, plotted to land, and finished dividing the land.

Sentences_from: A widząc Gaal lud, rzekł do Zebula: Oto, lud idzie z wierzchu gór. Któremu odpowiedział Zebul: Cieó góry ty widzisz, jakoby ludzie.
Sentences_to: When Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, "Behold, people are coming down from the tops of the mountains." Zebul said to him, "You see the shadow of the mountains as if they were men."
Translated_sentences: and when gaal saw the people, he said to zebul, behold, the people are coming down from the top of the mountains. to which zebul answered, thou shalt see the mountains, as if men.

Sentences_from: Synowie Sofachowi: Suach, Harnefer, i Sual, i Bery, i Imra.
Sentences_to: The sons of Zophah: Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,
Translated_sentences: the sons of zephah: suah, harnefer, and sual, and berry, and imra.

Sentences_from: A inne sprawy Amazyjaszowe, pierwsze i poślednie, izali nie są zapisane w księgi królów Judzkich i Izraelskich?
Sentences_to: These are those who conspired against him: Zabad the son of Shimeath the Ammonitess, and Jehozabad the son of Shimrith the Moabitess.
Translated_sentences: and the other works of amaziah, first and last, are not recorded in the books of the kings of judah and israel?

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Nie będzie nazywane więcej imię twoje Jakób, ale Izrael; boś sobie mężnie poczynał z Bogiem, i z ludźmi, i przemogłeś.
Sentences_to: Jacob asked him, "Please tell me your name." He said, "Why is it that you ask what my name is?" He blessed him there.
Translated_sentences: and he said, thy name shall no more be called jacob, but israel; for you have made bravely for yourself with god and men, and you have prevailed.

Sentences_from: I tak zbogacił się on człowiek bardzo, i miał owiec wiele, i służebnic i sług, i wielbłądów, i osłów.
Sentences_to: The man increased exceedingly, and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.
Translated_sentences: and the man was greatly enriched, and had many sheep, and maidservants, and menservants, and camels and donkeys.

Sentences_from: A tak usłyszawszy Achab, że umarł Nabot, wstał, a szedł do winnicy Nabota Jezreelity, aby ją posiadł.
Sentences_to: It happened, when Ahab heard that Naboth was dead, that Ahab rose up to go down to the vineyard of Naboth the Jezreelite, to take possession of it.
Translated_sentences: and when ahab heard that naboth was dead, he got up and went to naboth's vineyard to possess it.

Sentences_from: Kto wyleje krew człowieczą, przez człowieka krew jego wylana będzie: bo na wyobrażenie Boże uczynion jest człowiek.
Sentences_to: Whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man, for God made man in his own image.
Translated_sentences: whoever sheds man's blood, his blood will be shed by man: for man is made in the image of god.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Zawściągnij głos swój od płaczu, a oczy swe od łez; bo będziesz miała zapłatę za pracę swoję, mówi Pan, że się nawrócą z ziemi nieprzyjacielskiej.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh: Refrain your voice from weeping, and your eyes from tears; for your work shall be rewarded, says Yahweh; and they shall come again from the land of the enemy.
Translated_sentences: thus says the lord: restrain your voice from weeping, and your eyes from tears; for thou shalt be rewarded for thy labor, saith the lord, that they shall turn from the enemy's land.

Sentences_from: A słupów do nich cztery, także podstawków ich cztery miedzianych; główki ich srebrne, i zakrycia wierzchów ich, także okręcenia ich srebrne.
Sentences_to: Their pillars were four, and their sockets four, of brass; their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals, and their fillets, of silver.
Translated_sentences: and their pillars four, and their sockets four of brass; their heads are silver, and the covers of their tops, and their wraps are silver.

Sentences_from: A poczekawszy jeszcze drugie siedem dni, po wtóre wypuścił gołębicę z korabia.
Sentences_to: He stayed yet another seven days; and again he sent the dove out of the ship.
Translated_sentences: and after waiting another seven days, he sent the dove out of the ark the second time.

Sentences_from: Błogosławiony Pan, Bóg Izraelski, od wieków aż na wieki. I rzekł wszystek lud Amen, i chwalił Pana.
Sentences_to: Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting. All the people said, "Amen," and praised Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: blessed is the lord god of israel from ages to ages. and all the people spoke, amen, and praised the lord.

Sentences_from: Nawrócą się, aby siedzieli pod cieniem jego, ożyją jako zboże, i puszczą się jako winna macica, której pamiątka będzie jako wino Libańskie.
Sentences_to: Men will dwell in his shade. They will revive like the grain, and blossom like the vine. Their fragrance will be like the wine of Lebanon.
Translated_sentences: they will turn to sit under its shadow, to live as corn, and to go forth as a vine, the memorial of which will be as lebanese wine.

Sentences_from: A posyłając je Mojżesz na przeszpiegowanie ziemi Chananejskiej, mówił do nich: Idźcie w tę stronę ku południowi, a wnijdźcie na górę:
Sentences_to: Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, and said to them, "Go up this way by the South, and go up into the hill country:
Translated_sentences: and when moses sent them to spy out the land of canaan, he said to them, go in this direction toward the south, and go up to the mountain.

Sentences_from: Ale gdy go zastaną, nagradza siedmiorako, albo wszystkę majętność domu swego daje.
Sentences_to: but if he is found, he shall restore seven times. He shall give all the wealth of his house.
Translated_sentences: but when they find him, he rewards sevenfold, or gives all the possessions of his house.

Sentences_from: I wyciągnął Mojżesz rękę swą ku niebu, i były ciemności gęste po wszystkiej ziemi Egipskiej przez trzy dni.
Sentences_to: Moses stretched out his hand toward the sky, and there was a thick darkness in all the land of Egypt three days.
Translated_sentences: and moses stretched out his hand to heaven, and the darkness was thick over all the land of egypt for three days.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy Samuel sprawował całopalenie, że Filistynowie przyciągnęli blisko, aby walczyli przeciw Izraelowi; ale zagrzmiał Pan grzmotem wielkim dnia onego nad Filistynami, a potarł je, i porażeni są przed obliczem Izraela.
Sentences_to: As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Yahweh thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines, and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.
Translated_sentences: it happened, while samuel was performing the burnt offering, that the philistines came near to fight against israel; but the lord thundered with great thunder that day over the philistines, and struck them, and they were struck before israel.

Sentences_from: Tak mówi Pan: Jako gdyby kto znalazł wino w gronie, i rzekłby: Nie psuj go, bo błogosławieństwo jest w niem; tak i Ja uczynię dla sług moich, że ich wszystkich nie wygubię.
Sentences_to: Thus says Yahweh, "As the new wine is found in the cluster, and one says, 'Don't destroy it, for a blessing is in it:' so will I do for my servants' sake, that I may not destroy them all.
Translated_sentences: thus says the lord: as if any man find wine among the bunch, and say, do not spoil it, for the blessing is in it; so i will do for my servants, that i will not destroy them all.

Sentences_from: Tedy nabrawszy Abimelech owiec, i wołów, i sług, i służebnic, dał Abrahamowi, i wrócił mu Sarę, żonę jego.
Sentences_to: Abimelech took sheep and cattle, male servants and female servants, and gave them to Abraham, and restored Sarah, his wife, to him.
Translated_sentences: and abimelech took sheep, and oxen, and menservants and female servants, and gave it to abraham, and restored him sarah his wife.

Sentences_from: Ale przemógł lud, który przestawał z Amrym, on lud, który zostawał przy Tebni, synem Ginetowym; i umarł Tebni, a królował Amry.
Sentences_to: But the people who followed Omri prevailed against the people who followed Tibni the son of Ginath: so Tibni died, and Omri reigned.
Translated_sentences: but the people who stayed with amry, the people who stayed with tebni, the son of ginet, prevailed; and tebni died, and amri reigned.

Sentences_from: Tedy słudzy króla Syryjskiego rzekli do niego: Bogowie ich są bogowie górni, przetoż nas przemogli; a wszakże zwiedźmy z nimi bitwę w polu a ujrzysz, jeźli ich nie przemożemy.
Sentences_to: The servants of the king of Syria said to him, "Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we. But let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.
Translated_sentences: then the servants of the king of syria said to him, their gods are high gods, therefore they have prevailed over us; yet let us make a battle with them in the field, and you will see if we do not prevail against them.

Sentences_from: I stworzył Bóg wieloryby wielkie, i wszelką duszę żywiącą płazającą się, którą hojnie wywiodły wody, według rodzaju ich; i wszelkie ptactwo skrzydlaste, według rodzaju ich; i widział Bóg, że to było dobre.
Sentences_to: God created the large sea creatures, and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.
Translated_sentences: and god created the great whales, and every creeping living soul, which the waters bore abundantly, according to their kind; and all the winged birds, according to their kind; and god saw that it was good.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Saul do wyrostka swego, który nosił broń jego: Dobądź miecza twego, a przebij mię nim, by snać nie przyszli ci nieobrzezańcy, i nie przebili mię, a nie czynili igrzyska ze mnie. Ale nie chciał wyrostek jego, bo się bardzo bał. Przetoż Saul porwał miecz i upadł nań.
Sentences_to: Then Saul said to his armor bearer, "Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and abuse me!" But his armor bearer would not; for he was terrified. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell on it.
Translated_sentences: and saul said to his pupil who carried his weapons, draw thy sword, and pierce me with it, lest the uncircumcised men come, and pierce me, and make plots of me. but he did not want his appendix, because he was very afraid. so saul took the sword and fell on it.

Sentences_from: Toż wszyscy prorocy prorokowali, mówiąc: Ciągnij do Ramot Galaad, a będzieć się szczęściło; albowiem je poda Pan, w ręce królewskie.
Sentences_to: Some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and silver for tribute; the Arabians also brought him flocks, seven thousand and seven hundred rams, and seven thousand and seven hundred male goats.
Translated_sentences: then all the prophets prophesied, saying, go to ramoth galaad, and you will be happy; for the lord will give them into royal hands.

Sentences_from: I stało się, gdy było utwierdzone królestwo jego, że pomordował sługi swe, którzy zabili króla, ojca jego.

Sentences_from: Który nasyca dobrem usta twoje, a odnawia jako orła młodość twoję.

Sentences_from: A teć są pokolenia Ezawa, ojca Edomczyków, na górze Seir.
Sentences_to: This is the history of the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in the hill country of Seir:

Sentences_from: Pan króluje, oblekł się w dostojność; oblekł się Pan w możność, i przepasał się; utwierdził też okrąg świata, aby się nie poruszył.
Sentences_to: Yahweh reigns! He is clothed with majesty! Yahweh is armed with strength. The world also is established. It can't be moved.
Translated_sentences: the lord reigns, he has clothed himself with majesty; the lord put on power and girded himself; and he made the world circle firmly so that it would not move.

Sentences_from: Co się tknie spraw ludzkich według słowa ust twoich, chroniłem się drogi okrutnika.
Sentences_to: As for the works of men, by the word of your lips, I have kept myself from the ways of the violent.
Translated_sentences: whatever happens to human affairs according to the word of your mouth, i have sheltered myself in the ways of the cruel.

Sentences_from: Choć i plewy i siano mam dla osłów naszych, także chleb i wino mam dla siebie i dla służebnicy twej i dla sługi, który jest ze mną, sługą twoim; nie mam niedostatku z żadnej rzeczy.
Sentences_to: Yet there is both straw and provender for our donkeys; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for your handmaid, and for the young man who is with your servants: there is no want of anything."
Translated_sentences: although i have chaff and hay for our donkeys, i have bread and wine for myself, and for your handmaid, and for your servant who is with me, your servant. i have no shortage of any thing.

Sentences_from: Ale jeźliby kto umyślnie przeciw bliźniemu swemu zasadziwszy się zdradą zabił go, i od ołtarza mego weźmiesz go, aby umarł.
Sentences_to: If a man schemes and comes presumptuously on his neighbor to kill him, you shall take him from my altar, that he may die.
Translated_sentences: but if any man, deliberately, after deceit, kills him, and thou shalt take him from my altar, that he may die.

Sentences_from: Królowie z wojskami uciekali, uciekali: ale ta, która przyglądała domu, dzieliła łupy.

Sentences_from: I rzekł: Cóż to za słowa, któreć Pan powiedział? proszę nie taj przedemną; to a toć Bóg niechaj uczyni, jeźliże co zataisz przedemną ze wszystkich słów, które mówił do ciebie.
Sentences_to: He said, "What is the thing that he has spoken to you? Please don't hide it from me. God do so to you, and more also, if you hide anything from me of all the things that he spoke to you."
Translated_sentences: and he said, what are these words which the lord said to thee? please do not hide from me; this and this god do, if what thou hast concealed from me from all the words that he has spoken to thee.

Sentences_from: Nie zataiła się żadna kość moja przed tobą, chociażem był uczyniony w skrytości, i misternie złożony w niskościach ziemi.
Sentences_to: My frame wasn't hidden from you, when I was made in secret, woven together in the depths of the earth.

Sentences_from: I rzekłem: Cóż jest? A on odpowiedział: To jest efa wychodzące. Potem rzekł: Toć jest oko ich przypatrujące się wszystkiej ziemi.

Sentences_from: Aza cię będzie karał bojąc się ciebie? albo z tobą pójdzie do sądu?

Sentences_from: Ale lud rzekł do Saula: Izali Jonatan umrze, który uczynił to wybawienie wielkie w Izraelu? Boże uchowaj! jako żywy Pan, nie spadnie i włos z głowy jego na ziemię; albowiem za pomocą Bożą uczynił to dzisiaj. A tak wybawił lud Jonatana, że nie umarł.
Sentences_to: The people said to Saul, "Shall Jonathan die, who has worked this great salvation in Israel? Far from it! As Yahweh lives, there shall not one hair of his head fall to the ground; for he has worked with God this day!" So the people rescued Jonathan, that he didn't die.
Translated_sentences: but the people said to saul, will jonathan die, who made this salvation great in israel? god forbid! as the living lord, not a hair from his head will fall to the ground; for with god's help he did it today. so he saved jonathan's people that they did not die.

Sentences_from: Tedy król Daryjusz rozkazał, aby szukano w biblijotece między skarbami tamże złożonemi w Babilonie.
Sentences_to: Then Darius the king made a decree, and search was made in the house of the archives, where the treasures were laid up in Babylon.
Translated_sentences: then king darius commanded that they should search the library for the treasures there in babylon.

Sentences_from: Niech będą przed Panem ustawicznie, ażby wygładził z ziemi pamiątkę ich,
Sentences_to: Let them be before Yahweh continually, that he may cut off their memory from the earth;
Translated_sentences: let them be before the lord continually, until he has wiped out their remembrance from the ground,

Sentences_from: Nadto wszystkie naczynia, z których pijał król Salomon, były złote, także i wszystkie naczynia domu lasu Libanowego były z szczerego złota; nic nie było ze srebra, ani go miano w jakiej cenie za dni Salomonowych.
Sentences_to: All king Solomon's drinking vessels were of gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of Lebanon were of pure gold: none were of silver; it was nothing accounted of in the days of Solomon.
Translated_sentences: moreover, all the vessels from which king solomon drank were gold, and all the vessels of the house of the forest of lebanon were pure gold; nothing was of silver, nor was it called at any price in the days of solomon.

Sentences_from: Niech nam dadzą dwóch cielców, a niech sobie obiorą cielca jednego, a porąbią go na sztuki, i włożą na drwa; ale ognia niech nie podkładają: ja też przygotuję drugiego cielca, którego włożę na drwa, a ognia nie podłożę.
Sentences_to: Let them therefore give us two bulls; and let them choose one bull for themselves, and cut it in pieces, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under; and I will dress the other bull, and lay it on the wood, and put no fire under it.
Translated_sentences: let them give us two calves, and let them take one calf for themselves, and cut it into pieces and put it on wood; but let them not set fire; i, too, will prepare another calf, which i will put on the wood, and not set fire to it.

Sentences_from: Gdy się wrzuci garść zboża do ziemi na wierzchu gór, zaszumi jako Liban urodzaj jego, a mieszczanie zakwitną jako zioła polne.
Sentences_to: Abundance of grain shall be throughout the land. Its fruit sways like Lebanon. Let it flourish, thriving like the grass of the field.

Sentences_from: Tedy każesz zatrąbić w trąbę huczną miesiąca siódmego, dnia dziesiątego tegoż miesiąca; w dzień oczyszczenia każecie zatrąbić po wszystkiej ziemi waszej.
Sentences_to: It shall be for Aaron and his sons; and they shall eat it in a holy place: for it is most holy to him of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire by a perpetual statute."

Sentences_from: I postanowili, aby obwołano po wszystkim Izraelu, od Beersaby aż do Dan, żeby się zeszli na obchód święta przejścia Panu, Bogu Izraelskiemu, do Jeruzalemu; albowiem już go dawno nie obchodzili, jako było napisane.

Sentences_from: Jako lilija między cierniem, tak przyjaciółka moja między pannami.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Kaina: Gdzież jest Abel brat twój? który odpowiedział: Nie wiem; izalim ja stróżem brata mego?

Sentences_from: Tedy posłał Sanballat, i Giesem do mnie mówiąc: Przyjdź, a zejdźmy się społem we wsiach, które są na polu Ono. Ale oni myślili uczynić mi co złego.

Sentences_from: Nie przystoi mowa poważna głupiemu, dopieroż księciu usta kłamliwe.

Translated_sentences: serious speech is not fitting for a fool, but a prince has a lying mouth.

Sentences_from: Tedy synowie Aaronowi, Nadab i Abiju, wziąwszy każdy kadzielnicę swoję, włożyli w nią ognia, i włożywszy nań kadzidła ofiarowali przed obliczem Pańskiem ogieó obcy, czego im był nie rozkazał.
Sentences_to: It happened on the eighth day, that Moses called Aaron and his sons, and the elders of Israel;

Sentences_from: Droga Pańska jest mocą szczeremu; ale strachem tym, którzy broją złości.
Sentences_to: The way of Yahweh is a stronghold to the upright, but it is a destruction to the workers of iniquity.

Sentences_from: Tedy krzyczał lud, gdy zatrąbiono w trąby, albowiem gdy usłyszał lud głos trąb, krzyczał i lud wielkim głosem, i upadł mur na miejscu swem, i wszedł lud do miasta, każdy przeciw miejscu, gdzie stał, i wzięli miasto;
Sentences_to: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the trumpets. It happened, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.
Translated_sentences: and the people shouted when the trumpets were blown, for when the people heard the sound of the trumpets, they shouted with a loud voice, and the wall fell down in their place, and the people went into the city, each one against where he stood, and they took the city;

Sentences_from: Wystąpili przeciwko Panu, bo synów cudzych napłodzili; a tak teraz pożre ich miesiąc z majętnościami ich.
Sentences_to: As they were multiplied, so they sinned against me. I will change their glory into shame.

Sentences_from: I będą żywotem duszy twojej, a ozdobą szyi twojej.
Sentences_to: so they will be life to your soul, and grace for your neck.

Sentences_from: Jako gdyby kto uciekał przede lwem, a zabieżał mu niedźwiedź; albo gdyby wszedł do domu, a podparł się ręką swą na ścianie, ukąsiłby go wąż.
Sentences_to: As if a man fled from a lion, and a bear met him; Or he went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, and a snake bit him.
Translated_sentences: as if a man fled from a lion and a bear met him; or if he went into the house and rested his hand on the wall, the snake would bite him.

Sentences_from: Przetoż będę cię wyznawał Panie między narodami; a imieniowi twemu śpiewać będę.
Sentences_to: Therefore I will give thanks to you, Yahweh, among the nations. Will sing praises to your name.
Translated_sentences: therefore i will confess you, lord, among the nations; and to your name i will sing.

Sentences_from: Zbudował też przegrodzenie na dwadzieścia łokci wdłuż od strony do strony domu, z tarcic cedrowych od tła aż do stropu. A tak zbudował Bogu wewnątrz przybytek, aby był świątnicą najświętszą.
Sentences_to: He built twenty cubits on the hinder part of the house with boards of cedar from the floor to the ceiling: he built them for it within, for an oracle, even for the most holy place.
Translated_sentences: he also built a partition twenty cubits long from the side of the house, of cedar lumber from the background to the ceiling. so he built a tabernacle within for god, that it would be a most holy place.

Sentences_from: Zaiste kielich jest w rękach Pańskich, a ten wina mętnego nalany; z tegoż nalewać będzie, tak, że i drożdże jego wyssą i wypiją wszyscy niepobożni ziemi.
Sentences_to: But I will declare this forever: I will sing praises to the God of Jacob.

Sentences_from: Ale ty i słudzy twoi, wiem, że się jeszcze nie boicie oblicza Pana Boga.

Sentences_from: Gdy mawiał Efraim, strach bywał, bo był wywyższony w Izraelu; ale gdy zgrzeszył przy Baalu, tedy umarł.

Sentences_from: I rzekł Pan do Mojżesza, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: "'They shall therefore follow my requirements, lest they bear sin for it, and die therein, if they profane it. I am Yahweh who sanctifies them.
Translated_sentences: and the lord spake unto moses, saying,

Sentences_from: Którego długość przy drzwiach na północy była na wejrzeniu na sto łokci, a szerokość na pięćdziesiąt łokci.
Sentences_to: Before the length of one hundred cubits was the north door, and the breadth was fifty cubits.
Translated_sentences: its length at the door to the north was one hundred cubits at the sight, and fifty cubits wide.

Sentences_from: Niech się rozradują niebiosa, a niech się rozweseli ziemia, a niech mówią w narodach: Pan króluje!
Sentences_to: Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice! Let them say among the nations, "Yahweh reigns!"
Translated_sentences: let the heavens rejoice, let the earth rejoice, and let them say in the nations: the lord reigns!

Sentences_from: Tedy opowiem imię twoje braciom mym; w pośród zgromadzenia chwalić cię będę.
Sentences_to: You who fear Yahweh, praise him! All you descendants of Jacob, glorify him! Stand in awe of him, all you descendants of Israel!
Translated_sentences: then will i tell my brethren your name; in the midst of the assembly i will praise you.

Sentences_from: A tak przyszedł Dawid, i wszystek Izrael do Baala w Karyjatyjarym, które jest w Judzie, aby przyprowadzili stamtąd skrzynię Pana Boga siedzącego nad Cherubinami, gdzie wzywane bywa imię jego.
Sentences_to: David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath Jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God Yahweh that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.
Translated_sentences: so david and all israel came to baal in karyathiary, which is in judah, to bring from there the chest of the lord god sitting on the cherubim, where his name is called.

Sentences_from: Zostawiali tedy ono na jutro, jako był rozkazał Mojżesz; a nie zśmierdło się, i robak nie był w niem.
Sentences_to: They laid it up until the morning, as Moses asked, and it didn't become foul, neither was there any worm in it.
Translated_sentences: so they left it until tomorrow, as moses had commanded; and it did not get foul, and the worm was not in it.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł jeden do drugiego: Chodźcie, rzućmy losy, abyśmy się dowiedzieli, dla kogo to złe na nas przyszło; rzucili tedy losy, i padł los na Jonasza.
Sentences_to: They all said to each other, "Come, let us cast lots, that we may know who is responsible for this evil that is on us." So they cast lots, and the lot fell on Jonah.
Translated_sentences: one said to another, come, let us cast lots, that we may find out for whom this evil has come upon us; so they cast lots, and the lot fell on jonah.

Sentences_from: Wielbijcie Pana ze mną, a wywyższajmy imię jego społecznie.
Sentences_to: I sought Yahweh, and he answered me, and delivered me from all my fears.
Translated_sentences: worship the lord with me and let us exalt his name socially.

Sentences_from: Doznasz też, iż rozmnożone będzie nasienie twoje, a potomstwo twoje będzie jako ziele ziemi.
Sentences_to: You shall know also that your seed shall be great, Your offspring as the grass of the earth.
Translated_sentences: you will also experience that your seed will be multiplied, and your offspring will be like the herb of the earth.

Sentences_from: Nadto jabłek granatowych cztery sta do onych dwóch siatek, które dwa rzędy jabłek granatowych były na każdej siatce, aby okrywały one dwie gałki okrągłe, które były na wierzchu słupów.
Sentences_to: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the pillars.
Translated_sentences: moreover, four hundred to two grids of pomegranates, two rows of pomegranates on each grid, to cover the two round knobs that were on top of the poles.

Sentences_from: Cić są synowie Racheli, którzy się urodzili Jakóbowi; wszystkich dusz czternaście.
Sentences_to: These are the sons of Rachel, who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.
Translated_sentences: these are the sons of rachel, who were born to jacob; all fourteen souls.

Sentences_from: A zgoła Bóg przewrotnie nie czyni, a Wszechmocny nie podwraca sądu.
Sentences_to: Yes surely, God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert justice.
Translated_sentences: and god does not perversely do things, and the almighty does not subvert judgment.

Sentences_from: Także złota pewną wagę na wszystkie naczynia złote, od wszystkiej usługi; srebra także na wszystkie naczynia srebrne pewną wagę, na wszystkie naczynia ku wszelakiej usłudze;
Sentences_to: of gold by weight for the gold, for all vessels of every kind of service; for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;
Translated_sentences: and gold, a certain weight, for all gold vessels, for all service; silver also for all silverware, a certain weight, for all utensils for all service;

Sentences_from: Niech mię zważy na wadze sprawiedliwej, a niech Bóg pozna szczerość moję.
Sentences_to: (let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know my integrity);
Translated_sentences: let me weigh in a fair weight, and may god know my sincerity.

Sentences_from: A widząc mężowie z Azotu, co się działo, rzekli: Niechaj nie zostawa skrzynia Boga Izraelskiego z nami; albowiem sroga jest ręka jego przeciwko nam, i przeciwko Dagonowi, bogu naszemu.
Sentences_to: When the men of Ashdod saw that it was so, they said, "The ark of the God of Israel shall not stay with us; for his hand is severe on us, and on Dagon our god."
Translated_sentences: and when the men of azot saw what was done, they said, let not the ark of the god of israel leave with us; for his hand is fierce against us and against dagon our god.

Sentences_from: A gdy Mojżesz wchodził do namiotu zgromadzenia, by się rozmawiał z Bogiem, tedy słyszał głos mówiącego do siebie z ubłagalni, która była nad skrzynią świadectwa, między dwiema Cheruby, a stamtąd mawiał do niego.
Sentences_to: When Moses went into the Tent of Meeting to speak with Yahweh, he heard his voice speaking to him from above the mercy seat that was on the ark of the Testimony, from between the two cherubim: and he spoke to him.
Translated_sentences: as moses was going into the tabernacle of meeting to speak with god, he heard the voice of the man speaking to himself from the mercy seat that was above the chest of testimony between the two cherubim, and from there he was speaking to him.

Sentences_from: Sędzie i urzędniki postanowisz sobie we wszystkich bramach twoich, które Pan, Bóg twój, da tobie w każdem pokoleniu twojem, aby sądzili lud sądem sprawiedliwym.
Sentences_to: It shall not seem hard to you, when you let him go free from you; for to the double of the hire of a hireling has he served you six years: and Yahweh your God will bless you in all that you do.
Translated_sentences: in all your gates you shall make judges and officials, which the lord your god will give you in all your tribes, that they may judge the people with righteous judgment.

Sentences_from: Radował się Egipt, gdy oni wychodzili; albowiem był przypadł na nich strach ich.
Sentences_to: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the fear of them had fallen on them.
Translated_sentences: egypt rejoiced as they went out; for their fear was fallen upon them.

Sentences_from: Dzwonek a jabłko granatowe, i zaś dzwonek i jabłko granatowe, u podołka płaszcza w około ku posługiwaniu, jako rozkazał Pan Mojżeszowi.
Sentences_to: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate, around the skirts of the robe, to minister in, as Yahweh commanded Moses.
Translated_sentences: a bell, and a pomegranate, and a bell, and a pomegranate, around the skirt of the mantle, for the service, as the lord commanded moses.

Sentences_from: Oto przyjdą dni, w które zabiorą wszystko do Babilonu, cokolwiek jest w domu twoim, i cokolwiek schowali ojcowie twoi aż do dnia tego; nie zostanie ci nic, mówi Pan.
Sentences_to: Truly, Yahweh, the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands,
Translated_sentences: behold, the days will come when they will take whatever is in your house to babylon, and whatever is hidden by your fathers until this day; you have nothing left, saith the lord.

Sentences_from: Gdyby człowiek zgrzeszył przeciwko bliźniemu swemu, a przywiódłby go do przysięgi, tak żeby przysięgać musiał, a przyszłaby przysięga ona przed ołtarz twój w tym domu:
Sentences_to: "If a man sin against his neighbor, and an oath is laid on him to cause him to swear, and he comes and swears before your altar in this house;
Translated_sentences: if a man had sinned against his neighbor and made him swear, so that he would have to swear, and she would have sworn before your altar in this house:

Sentences_from: Oliwę do świecenia, wonne rzeczy na olejek pomazywania, i na wonne kadzenie;
Sentences_to: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the sweet incense,
Translated_sentences: oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and for sweet incense;

Sentences_from: I wrócił ono srebro matce swojej. Tedy wziąwszy matka jego dwieście srebrników, dała je złotnikowi; i uczynił z nich obraz ryty i lany, który był w domu Michasowym.
Sentences_to: When he restored the money to his mother, his mother took two hundred pieces of silver, and gave them to the founder, who made of it an engraved image and a molten image: and it was in the house of Micah.
Translated_sentences: and he returned the silver to his mother. then his mother took two hundred pieces of silver, and gave them to the goldsmith; and made of them the engraved and mastic image that was in the house of micah.

Sentences_from: Rzekł zaś Pan do Mojżesza, mówiąc:
Sentences_to: who brought you out of the land of Egypt, to be your God. I am Yahweh."
Translated_sentences: and the lord spake unto moses, saying,

Sentences_from: A to dla wszelkiej złości synów Izraelskich i synów Judzkich, którą popełniali, pobudzając mię do gniewu, sami, królowie ich, książęta ich, kapłani ich i prorocy ich, jako mężowie Judzcy, tak obywatele Jeruzalemscy.
Sentences_to: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
Translated_sentences: and this is because of all the wickedness of the children of israel and the children of judah that they have committed to inciting me to anger themselves, their kings, their princes, and their priests and their prophets, as the men of judah, and the inhabitants of jerusalem.

Sentences_from: I wyciągnął miecz z dołu szumiącego i z błota lgnącego, a postawił na skale nogi moje, i utwierdził kroki moje;
Sentences_to: He has put a new song in my mouth, even praise to our God. Many shall see it, and fear, and shall trust in Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: and he drew his sword from the roaring pit and from the sticking mud, and set my feet on the rock, and made my steps firm.

Sentences_from: Tedy synowie Ammonowi wyciągnęli, a uszykowali się do bitwy przed samem wejściem w bramę; Syryjczyk zasię z Soby, i Rechob, i Istob, i Maacha byli osobno w polu.
Sentences_to: The children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the entrance of the gate: and the Syrians of Zobah and of Rehob, and the men of Tob and Maacah, were by themselves in the field.
Translated_sentences: then the sons of ammon stretched out and prepared themselves for battle, just before entering the gate; and the syrian of sheba, and rehob, and istob, and maahah, were apart in the field.

Sentences_from: Nad całopalenie poranne, które ma być całopalenie ustawiczne, ofiarować to będziecie,
Sentences_to: You shall offer these besides the burnt offering of the morning, which is for a continual burnt offering.
Translated_sentences: for a morning burnt offering, which is to be a continual burnt offering, you shall offer it,

Sentences_from: A w dzień ofiary Pańskiej nawiedzę książąt i synów królewskich, i wszystkich, którzy się obłóczą w szaty cudzoziemskie.
Sentences_to: It will happen in the day of Yahweh's sacrifice, that I will punish the princes, the king's sons, and all those who are clothed with foreign clothing.
Translated_sentences: and on the day of the sacrifice of the lord i will visit the princes and the sons of the king, and all who dress in foreign garments.

Sentences_from: Tedy przyszedł Adonijasz, syn Haggity, do Betsaby, matki Salomonowej, któremu ona rzekła: A spokojneż jest przyjście twoje? A on odpowiedział: Spokojne.
Sentences_to: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith came to Bathsheba the mother of Solomon. She said, "Do you come peaceably?" He said, "Peaceably.
Translated_sentences: and adonijah son of haggith came to bathsheba the mother of solomon, and she said to him, is thy coming at ease? and he said, take it easy.

Sentences_from: A tak teraz ja Nabuchodonozor chwalę, i wywyższam i wysławiam króla niebieskiego, którego wszystkie sprawy są prawdą, a ścieszki jego sądem, a który chodzących w hardości poniżyć może.
Sentences_to: At the end of the days I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven, and my understanding returned to me, and I blessed the Most High, and I praised and honored him who lives forever; for his dominion is an everlasting dominion, and his kingdom from generation to generation.
Translated_sentences: and now i, nebuchadnezzar, praise and exalt and praise the king of heaven, whose all things are truth, and whose paths are his judgment, and who can humiliate those who walk in pride.

Sentences_from: Te familije Gersonowe za przybytkiem kłać się będą ku zachodowi.
Sentences_to: The families of the Gershonites shall encamp behind the tabernacle westward.
Translated_sentences: behind the tabernacle these gerson families will bow to the west.

Sentences_from: Pan go będzie strzegł, i żywić go będzie; błogosławony będzie na ziemi, ani go poda na wolę nieprzyjaciół jego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh will sustain him on his sickbed, and restore him from his bed of illness.
Translated_sentences: the lord will keep him and feed him; blessed shall he be in the earth, neither shall he deliver him to the will of his enemies.

Sentences_from: Dla domu Pana, Boga naszego, będę szukał twego dobrego.
Sentences_to: For the sake of the house of Yahweh our God, I will seek your good.
Translated_sentences: for the house of the lord our god, i will seek your good.

Sentences_from: I nie będą się błąkać oczy widzących, i uszy słuchających pilnie słuchać będą.
Sentences_to: The eyes of those who see will not be dim, and the ears of those who hear will listen.
Translated_sentences: the eyes of those who see it will not wander, and the ears of those who hear will listen diligently.

Sentences_from: A Jerycho było zamknione, i opatrzone przed synami Izraelskimi, i nikt z niego nie wychodził, ani do niego wchodził.
Sentences_to: Now Jericho was tightly shut up because of the children of Israel. No one went out, and no one came in.
Translated_sentences: and jericho was shut off and provided before the children of israel, and no one went out of it or entered it.

Sentences_from: Ale gdy będzie lud onej ziemi wchodził przed obliczność Pańską na święta uroczyste, tedy ten, co wnijdzie drogą bramy od północy, aby się kłaniał, wynijdzie drogą bramy południowej; a kto wnijdzie drogą bramy południowej, wynijdzie drogą bramy pół nocnej; nie wróci się drogą onej bramy, którą wszedł, ale przeciwko niej wynijdzie.
Sentences_to: But when the people of the land shall come before Yahweh in the appointed feasts, he who enters by the way of the north gate to worship shall go forth by the way of the south gate; and he who enters by the way of the south gate shall go forth by the way of the north gate: he shall not return by the way of the gate by which he came in, but shall go forth straight before him.
Translated_sentences: but when the people of the land have entered into the presence of the lord on solemn feasts, then those who enter the way of the north gate to bow down will go out along the way of the south gate; and whoever enters the way of the south gate will exit the way of the half gate of the night; he will not turn back by the way of the gate which he entered, but will go out against it.

Sentences_from: I odszedł Bóg od niego z miejsca, na którem mówił z nim.
Sentences_to: God went up from him in the place where he spoke with him.
Translated_sentences: and god departed from him from the place where he spoke with him.

Sentences_from: A gdy umarł Hesron w Kaleb Efrata, tedy żona Hesronowa Abija porodziła mu Assura, ojca Tekui.
Sentences_to: After that Hezron was dead in Caleb Ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron's wife bore him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.
Translated_sentences: and when hesron died in caleb ephratha, hesron's wife abijah bore him assura the father of tekua.

Sentences_from: A siedem kapłanów wziąwszy siedem trąb z rogów baranich, przed skrzynią Pańską szli, idąc i trąbiąc w trąby; a zbrojni szli przed nimi, ostatek też ludu pospolitego szedł za skrzynią Pańską, gdy idąc trąbiono w trąby.
Sentences_to: The seven priests bearing the seven trumpets of rams' horns before the ark of Yahweh went on continually, and blew the trumpets: and the armed men went before them. The rear guard came after the ark of Yahweh. The trumpets sounded as they went.
Translated_sentences: and the seven priests took the seven trumpets from the rams' horns, and went before the ark of the lord, and sounded the trumpets; and the armed went before them, and the remnant of the common people followed the ark of the lord, as the trumpets were going as they went.

Sentences_from: Tedy rzekł Pan Bóg do węża: Iżeś to uczynił, przeklętym będziesz nad wszystkie zwierzęta, i nad wszystkie bestyje polne; na brzuchu twoim czołgać się będziesz, a proch żreć będziesz po wszystkie dni żywota twego.
Sentences_to: Yahweh God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. On your belly you shall go, and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.
Translated_sentences: yahweh god said to the serpent, “because you have done this, you will be cursed above all animals, and above all the beasts of the field. crawl on your belly, and eat dust all the days of your life.

Sentences_from: Ale Heli zstarzał się był bardzo, i słyszał wszystko, co czynili synowie jego całemu Izraelowi, i jako sypiali z niewiastami, które się schadzały przede drzwi namiotu zgromadzenia.
Sentences_to: Now Eli was very old; and he heard all that his sons did to all Israel, and how that they lay with the women who served at the door of the Tent of Meeting.
Translated_sentences: but eli was very old, and he heard all that his sons did to all israel, and how they slept with the women who gathered in front of the tent of meeting.

Sentences_from: I oddane jest pole i jaskinia, która była na niem, Abrahamowi w osiadłość grobu, od synów Hetowych.
Sentences_to: The field, and the cave that is in it, were deeded to Abraham for a possession of a burying place by the children of Heth.
Translated_sentences: and the field and the cave that was in it were given to abraham for the possession of a tomb by the children of heth.

Sentences_from: A była granica Amorejczykowa od góry, gdzie wstępują do niedźwiadków, od skały ich i wyżej.
Sentences_to: The border of the Amorites was from the ascent of Akrabbim, from the rock, and upward.
Translated_sentences: and the border of the amorites was from above, where they go up to the little bears, from their rock, and above.

Sentences_from: Aby więcej nie błądził dom Izraelski odemnie, a nie mazali się więcej żadnemi przestępstwami swojemi, aby byli ludem moim, a Ja abym był Bogiem ich, mówi panujący Pan.
Sentences_to: that the house of Israel may go no more astray from me, neither defile themselves any more with all their transgressions; but that they may be my people, and I may be their God, says the Lord Yahweh.
Translated_sentences: that the house of israel would no longer go astray from me, and that they may no longer be smeared with their transgressions, that they may be my people, and i may be their god, saith the lord god.

Sentences_from: A tak zgromadzili się do Masfa, a czerpając wodę, wylewali przed Panem, i pościli tam dnia onego, mówiąc: Zgrzeszyliśmy Panu. I sądził Samuel syny Izraelskie w Masfa.
Sentences_to: They gathered together to Mizpah, and drew water, and poured it out before Yahweh, and fasted on that day, and said there, "We have sinned against Yahweh." Samuel judged the children of Israel in Mizpah.
Translated_sentences: and they gathered themselves to mizpah, and drawing water, poured out before the lord, and fasted there that day, saying, we have sinned to the lord. and samuel judged the children of israel at mizpah.

Sentences_from: Rozgniewałem się był na lud mój, splugawiłem dziedzictwo moje, a dałem je w ręce twoje; aleś im ty nie okazała miłosierdzia, i starców obciążałaś jarzmem twojem bardzo,
Sentences_to: I was angry with my people, I profaned my inheritance, and gave them into your hand: you showed them no mercy; on the aged you have very heavily laid your yoke.
Translated_sentences: i was angry with my people, i defiled my inheritance, and gave it into your hands. but you showed no mercy to them, and burdened the elderly with your yoke very much,

Sentences_from: Dnia onego będzie Izrael jako trzeci między Egipczanem i Assyryjczykiem, a błogosławieństwo będzie w pośrodku ziemi.
Sentences_to: In that day, Israel will be the third with Egypt and with Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth;
Translated_sentences: on that day israel will be the third between the egyptians and the assyrians, and the blessing will be in the center of the earth.

Sentences_from: A syn Hananijaszowy: Faltyjasz, i Jesajasz; synowie Rafajaszowi, synowie Arnanaszowi, synowie Obadyjaszowi, synowie Sechenijaszowi.
Sentences_to: The sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah, and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sons of Shecaniah.
Translated_sentences: and the son of hananiah: phaliah and jeshaiah; the sons of raphaiah, the sons of arnanah, the sons of obadiah, the sons of secheniah.

Sentences_from: Jeźli do miłościwego lata poświęcił rolę swoję, według szacunku twego zostanie.
Sentences_to: If he dedicates his field from the Year of Jubilee, according to your valuation it shall stand.
Translated_sentences: if he has sacrificed his land to a gracious summer, he will remain in your honor.

Sentences_from: I dał Pan Mojżeszowi dokonawszy mowy z nim na górze Synaj dwie tablice świadectwa, tablice kamienne, pisane palcem Bożym.
Sentences_to: He gave to Moses, when he finished speaking with him on Mount Sinai, the two tablets of the testimony, stone tablets, written with God's finger.
Translated_sentences: and the lord gave moses, after speaking with him on mount sinai, two tablets of testimony, tablets of stone, written with the finger of god.

Sentences_from: Abym poświęcił wielkie imię moje, które było splugawione między narodami, któreście wy zmazali w pośrodku ich; i dowiedzą się narody, żem Ja Pan, mówi panujący Pan, gdy poświęcony będę w was przed oczyma ich;
Sentences_to: I will sanctify my great name, which has been profaned among the nations, which you have profaned in their midst; and the nations shall know that I am Yahweh, says the Lord Yahweh, when I shall be sanctified in you before their eyes.
Translated_sentences: that i may bless my great name which is defiled among the nations which you have blotted out in their midst; and the peoples shall know that i am the lord, saith the lord god, when i am sanctified in you before their eyes.

Sentences_from: Ale jeźliżby po miłościwem lecie poświęcił rolę twoję tedy kapłan obrachuje mu pieniądze według lat zostawających do miłościwego lata i umniejszy mu się z szacunku twego.
Sentences_to: "'If you in spite of these things will not listen to me, then I will chastise you seven times more for your sins.
Translated_sentences: but if, after merciful summer, he sacrifices your land, the priest shall count the money for him according to the years remaining until the gracious summer, and he shall be less than your esteem.
